Browse the source code of pocl/include/CL/cl2.hpp

29/*! \file
30 *
31 * \brief C++ bindings for OpenCL 1.0 (rev 48), OpenCL 1.1 (rev 33),
32 * OpenCL 1.2 (rev 15), OpenCL 2.0 (rev 29) and OpenCL 2.1 (rev 17).
33 * \author Lee Howes and Bruce Merry
34 *
35 * Derived from the OpenCL 1.x C++ bindings written by
36 * Benedict R. Gaster, Laurent Morichetti and Lee Howes
37 * With additions and fixes from:
38 * Brian Cole, March 3rd 2010 and April 2012
39 * Matt Gruenke, April 2012.
40 * Bruce Merry, February 2013.
41 * Tom Deakin and Simon McIntosh-Smith, July 2013
42 * James Price, 2015-
43 * \version 2.1.0
44 * \date 2018-12-07
45 *
46 * Optional extension support
47 *
48 * cl_ext_device_fission
49 * #define CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION
50 * cl_khr_d3d10_sharing
51 * #define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP
52 * cl_khr_sub_groups
53 * #define CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR
54 * cl_khr_image2d_from_buffer
55 * #define CL_HPP_USE_CL_IMAGE2D_FROM_BUFFER_KHR
56 *
57 * Doxygen documentation for this header is available here:
58 *
59 * http://khronosgroup.github.io/OpenCL-CLHPP/
60 *
61 * The latest version of this header can be found on the GitHub releases page:
62 *
63 * https://github.com/KhronosGroup/OpenCL-CLHPP/releases
64 *
65 * Bugs and patches can be submitted to the GitHub repository:
66 *
67 * https://github.com/KhronosGroup/OpenCL-CLHPP
68 */
69
70/*! \mainpage
71 * \section intro Introduction
72 * For many large applications C++ is the language of choice and so it seems
73 * reasonable to define C++ bindings for OpenCL.
74 *
75 * The interface is contained with a single C++ header file \em cl2.hpp and all
76 * definitions are contained within the namespace \em cl. There is no additional
77 * requirement to include \em cl.h and to use either the C++ or original C
78 * bindings; it is enough to simply include \em cl2.hpp.
79 *
80 * The bindings themselves are lightweight and correspond closely to the
81 * underlying C API. Using the C++ bindings introduces no additional execution
82 * overhead.
83 *
84 * There are numerous compatibility, portability and memory management
85 * fixes in the new header as well as additional OpenCL 2.0 features.
86 * As a result the header is not directly backward compatible and for this
87 * reason we release it as cl2.hpp rather than a new version of cl.hpp.
88 *
89 *
90 * \section compatibility Compatibility
91 * Due to the evolution of the underlying OpenCL API the 2.0 C++ bindings
92 * include an updated approach to defining supported feature versions
93 * and the range of valid underlying OpenCL runtime versions supported.
94 *
95 * The combination of preprocessor macros CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION and
96 * CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION control this range. These are three digit
97 * decimal values representing OpenCL runime versions. The default for
98 * the target is 200, representing OpenCL 2.0 and the minimum is also
99 * defined as 200. These settings would use 2.0 API calls only.
100 * If backward compatibility with a 1.2 runtime is required, the minimum
101 * version may be set to 120.
102 *
103 * Note that this is a compile-time setting, and so affects linking against
104 * a particular SDK version rather than the versioning of the loaded runtime.
105 *
106 * The earlier versions of the header included basic vector and string
107 * classes based loosely on STL versions. These were difficult to
108 * maintain and very rarely used. For the 2.0 header we now assume
109 * the presence of the standard library unless requested otherwise.
110 * We use std::array, std::vector, std::shared_ptr and std::string
111 * throughout to safely manage memory and reduce the chance of a
112 * recurrance of earlier memory management bugs.
113 *
114 * These classes are used through typedefs in the cl namespace:
115 * cl::array, cl::vector, cl::pointer and cl::string.
116 * In addition cl::allocate_pointer forwards to std::allocate_shared
117 * by default.
118 * In all cases these standard library classes can be replaced with
119 * custom interface-compatible versions using the CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY,
120 * CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR, CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR and
121 * CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING macros.
122 *
123 * The OpenCL 1.x versions of the C++ bindings included a size_t wrapper
124 * class to interface with kernel enqueue. This caused unpleasant interactions
125 * with the standard size_t declaration and led to namespacing bugs.
126 * In the 2.0 version we have replaced this with a std::array-based interface.
127 * However, the old behaviour can be regained for backward compatibility
128 * using the CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY macro.
129 *
130 * Finally, the program construction interface used a clumsy vector-of-pairs
131 * design in the earlier versions. We have replaced that with a cleaner
132 * vector-of-vectors and vector-of-strings design. However, for backward
133 * compatibility old behaviour can be regained with the
134 * CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY macro.
135 *
136 * In OpenCL 2.0 OpenCL C is not entirely backward compatibility with
137 * earlier versions. As a result a flag must be passed to the OpenCL C
138 * compiled to request OpenCL 2.0 compilation of kernels with 1.2 as
139 * the default in the absence of the flag.
140 * In some cases the C++ bindings automatically compile code for ease.
141 * For those cases the compilation defaults to OpenCL C 2.0.
142 * If this is not wanted, the CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD macro may
143 * be specified to assume 1.2 compilation.
144 * If more fine-grained decisions on a per-kernel bases are required
145 * then explicit build operations that take the flag should be used.
146 *
147 *
148 * \section parameterization Parameters
149 * This header may be parameterized by a set of preprocessor macros.
150 *
151 * - CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
152 *
153 * Defines the target OpenCL runtime version to build the header
154 * against. Defaults to 200, representing OpenCL 2.0.
155 *
156 * - CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING
157 *
158 * Do not use the standard library string class. cl::string is not
159 * defined and may be defined by the user before cl2.hpp is
160 * included.
161 *
162 * - CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR
163 *
164 * Do not use the standard library vector class. cl::vector is not
165 * defined and may be defined by the user before cl2.hpp is
166 * included.
167 *
168 * - CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY
169 *
170 * Do not use the standard library array class. cl::array is not
171 * defined and may be defined by the user before cl2.hpp is
172 * included.
173 *
174 * - CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR
175 *
176 * Do not use the standard library unique_ptr class. cl::pointer and
177 * the cl::allocate_pointer functions are not defined and may be
178 * defined by the user before cl2.hpp is included.
179 *
180 * - CL_HPP_ENABLE_DEVICE_FISSION
181 *
182 * Enables device fission for OpenCL 1.2 platforms.
183 *
184 * - CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
185 *
186 * Enable exceptions for use in the C++ bindings header. This is the
187 * preferred error handling mechanism but is not required.
188 *
189 * - CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY
190 *
191 * Backward compatibility option to support cl.hpp-style size_t
192 * class. Replaces the updated std::array derived version and
193 * removal of size_t from the namespace. Note that in this case the
194 * new size_t class is placed in the cl::compatibility namespace and
195 * thus requires an additional using declaration for direct backward
196 * compatibility.
197 *
198 * - CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY
199 *
200 * Enable older vector of pairs interface for construction of
201 * programs.
202 *
203 * - CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD
204 *
205 * Default to OpenCL C 1.2 compilation rather than OpenCL C 2.0
206 * applies to use of cl::Program construction and other program
207 * build variants.
208 *
209 * - CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR
210 *
211 * Enable the cl_khr_subgroups extension.
212 *
213 * - CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR
214 *
215 * Enable the cl_khr_il_program extension.
216 *
217 *
218 * \section example Example
219 *
220 * The following example shows a general use case for the C++
221 * bindings, including support for the optional exception feature and
222 * also the supplied vector and string classes, see following sections for
223 * decriptions of these features.
224 *
225 * \code
226 #define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
227 #define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 200
228
229 #include <CL/cl2.hpp>
230 #include <iostream>
231 #include <vector>
232 #include <memory>
233 #include <algorithm>
234
235 const int numElements = 32;
236
237 int main(void)
238 {
239 // Filter for a 2.0 platform and set it as the default
240 std::vector<cl::Platform> platforms;
241 cl::Platform::get(&platforms);
242 cl::Platform plat;
243 for (auto &p : platforms) {
244 std::string platver = p.getInfo<CL_PLATFORM_VERSION>();
245 if (platver.find("OpenCL 2.") != std::string::npos) {
246 plat = p;
247 }
248 }
249 if (plat() == 0) {
250 std::cout << "No OpenCL 2.0 platform found.";
251 return -1;
252 }
253
254 cl::Platform newP = cl::Platform::setDefault(plat);
255 if (newP != plat) {
256 std::cout << "Error setting default platform.";
257 return -1;
258 }
259
260 // Use C++11 raw string literals for kernel source code
261 std::string kernel1{R"CLC(
262 global int globalA;
263 kernel void updateGlobal()
264 {
265 globalA = 75;
266 }
267 )CLC"};
268 std::string kernel2{R"CLC(
269 typedef struct { global int *bar; } Foo;
270 kernel void vectorAdd(global const Foo* aNum, global const int *inputA, global const int *inputB,
271 global int *output, int val, write_only pipe int outPipe, queue_t childQueue)
272 {
273 output[get_global_id(0)] = inputA[get_global_id(0)] + inputB[get_global_id(0)] + val + *(aNum->bar);
274 write_pipe(outPipe, &val);
275 queue_t default_queue = get_default_queue();
276 ndrange_t ndrange = ndrange_1D(get_global_size(0)/2, get_global_size(0)/2);
277
278 // Have a child kernel write into third quarter of output
279 enqueue_kernel(default_queue, CLK_ENQUEUE_FLAGS_WAIT_KERNEL, ndrange,
280 ^{
281 output[get_global_size(0)*2 + get_global_id(0)] =
282 inputA[get_global_size(0)*2 + get_global_id(0)] + inputB[get_global_size(0)*2 + get_global_id(0)] + globalA;
283 });
284
285 // Have a child kernel write into last quarter of output
286 enqueue_kernel(childQueue, CLK_ENQUEUE_FLAGS_WAIT_KERNEL, ndrange,
287 ^{
288 output[get_global_size(0)*3 + get_global_id(0)] =
289 inputA[get_global_size(0)*3 + get_global_id(0)] + inputB[get_global_size(0)*3 + get_global_id(0)] + globalA + 2;
290 });
291 }
292 )CLC"};
293
294 // New simpler string interface style
295 std::vector<std::string> programStrings {kernel1, kernel2};
296
297 cl::Program vectorAddProgram(programStrings);
298 try {
299 vectorAddProgram.build("-cl-std=CL2.0");
300 }
301 catch (...) {
302 // Print build info for all devices
303 cl_int buildErr = CL_SUCCESS;
304 auto buildInfo = vectorAddProgram.getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>(&buildErr);
305 for (auto &pair : buildInfo) {
306 std::cerr << pair.second << std::endl << std::endl;
307 }
308
309 return 1;
310 }
311
312 typedef struct { int *bar; } Foo;
313
314 // Get and run kernel that initializes the program-scope global
315 // A test for kernels that take no arguments
316 auto program2Kernel =
317 cl::KernelFunctor<>(vectorAddProgram, "updateGlobal");
318 program2Kernel(
319 cl::EnqueueArgs(
320 cl::NDRange(1)));
321
322 //////////////////
323 // SVM allocations
324
325 auto anSVMInt = cl::allocate_svm<int, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<>>();
326 *anSVMInt = 5;
327 cl::SVMAllocator<Foo, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<cl::SVMTraitReadOnly<>>> svmAllocReadOnly;
328 auto fooPointer = cl::allocate_pointer<Foo>(svmAllocReadOnly);
329 fooPointer->bar = anSVMInt.get();
330 cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<>> svmAlloc;
331 std::vector<int, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<>>> inputA(numElements, 1, svmAlloc);
332 cl::coarse_svm_vector<int> inputB(numElements, 2, svmAlloc);
333
334 //
335 //////////////
336
337 // Traditional cl_mem allocations
338 std::vector<int> output(numElements, 0xdeadbeef);
339 cl::Buffer outputBuffer(begin(output), end(output), false);
340 cl::Pipe aPipe(sizeof(cl_int), numElements / 2);
341
342 // Default command queue, also passed in as a parameter
343 cl::DeviceCommandQueue defaultDeviceQueue = cl::DeviceCommandQueue::makeDefault(
344 cl::Context::getDefault(), cl::Device::getDefault());
345
346 auto vectorAddKernel =
347 cl::KernelFunctor<
348 decltype(fooPointer)&,
349 int*,
350 cl::coarse_svm_vector<int>&,
351 cl::Buffer,
352 int,
353 cl::Pipe&,
354 cl::DeviceCommandQueue
355 >(vectorAddProgram, "vectorAdd");
356
357 // Ensure that the additional SVM pointer is available to the kernel
358 // This one was not passed as a parameter
359 vectorAddKernel.setSVMPointers(anSVMInt);
360
361 // Hand control of coarse allocations to runtime
362 cl::enqueueUnmapSVM(anSVMInt);
363 cl::enqueueUnmapSVM(fooPointer);
364 cl::unmapSVM(inputB);
365 cl::unmapSVM(output2);
366
367 cl_int error;
368 vectorAddKernel(
369 cl::EnqueueArgs(
370 cl::NDRange(numElements/2),
371 cl::NDRange(numElements/2)),
372 fooPointer,
373 inputA.data(),
374 inputB,
375 outputBuffer,
376 3,
377 aPipe,
378 defaultDeviceQueue,
379 error
380 );
381
382 cl::copy(outputBuffer, begin(output), end(output));
383 // Grab the SVM output vector using a map
384 cl::mapSVM(output2);
385
386 cl::Device d = cl::Device::getDefault();
387
388 std::cout << "Output:\n";
389 for (int i = 1; i < numElements; ++i) {
390 std::cout << "\t" << output[i] << "\n";
391 }
392 std::cout << "\n\n";
393
394 return 0;
395 }
396 *
397 * \endcode
398 *
399 */
400#ifndef CL_HPP_
401#define CL_HPP_
402
403/* Handle deprecated preprocessor definitions. In each case, we only check for
404 * the old name if the new name is not defined, so that user code can define
405 * both and hence work with either version of the bindings.
406 */
407#if !defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP) && defined(USE_DX_INTEROP)
408# pragma message("cl2.hpp: USE_DX_INTEROP is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP instead")
409# define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP
410#endif
411#if !defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION) && defined(USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
412# pragma message("cl2.hpp: USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION instead")
413# define CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION
414#endif
415#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS) && defined(__CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
416# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS instead")
417# define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
418#endif
419#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR) && defined(__NO_STD_VECTOR)
420# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __NO_STD_VECTOR is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR instead")
421# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR
422#endif
423#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING) && defined(__NO_STD_STRING)
424# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __NO_STD_STRING is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING instead")
425# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING
426#endif
427#if defined(VECTOR_CLASS)
428# pragma message("cl2.hpp: VECTOR_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::vector instead")
429#endif
430#if defined(STRING_CLASS)
431# pragma message("cl2.hpp: STRING_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::string instead.")
432#endif
433#if !defined(CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS) && defined(__CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS)
434# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS instead")
435# define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS
436#endif
437
438/* Warn about features that are no longer supported
439 */
440#if defined(__USE_DEV_VECTOR)
441# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __USE_DEV_VECTOR is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
442#endif
443#if defined(__USE_DEV_STRING)
444# pragma message("cl2.hpp: __USE_DEV_STRING is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
445#endif
446
447/* Detect which version to target */
448#if !defined(CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
449# pragma message("cl2.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not defined. It will default to 210 (OpenCL 2.1)")
450# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 210
451#endif
452#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 210
453# pragma message("cl2.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200 or 210). It will be set to 210")
454# undef CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
455# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 210
456#endif
457
458/* Forward target OpenCL version to C headers if necessary */
459#if defined(CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
460/* Warn if prior definition of CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is lower than
461 * requested C++ bindings version */
462#if CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
463# pragma message("CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is already defined as is lower than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION")
464#endif
465#else
466# define CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
467#endif
468
469#if !defined(CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION)
470# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 200
471#endif
472#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 210
473# pragma message("cl2.hpp: CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200 or 210). It will be set to 100")
474# undef CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION
475# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 100
476#endif
477#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION > CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
478# error "CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION must not be greater than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION"
479#endif
480
481#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 100 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS)
482# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS
483#endif
484#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 110 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
485# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
486#endif
487#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 120 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
488# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS
489#endif
490#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 200 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS)
491# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS
492#endif
493#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 210 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS)
494# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS
495#endif
496
497#ifdef _WIN32
498
499#include <malloc.h>
500
501#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
502#include <CL/cl_d3d10.h>
503#include <CL/cl_dx9_media_sharing.h>
504#endif
505#endif // _WIN32
506
507#if defined(_MSC_VER)
508#include <intrin.h>
509#endif // _MSC_VER
510
511 // Check for a valid C++ version
512
513// Need to do both tests here because for some reason __cplusplus is not
514// updated in visual studio
515#if (!defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus < 201103L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1700)
516#error Visual studio 2013 or another C++11-supporting compiler required
517#endif
518
519//
520#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION) || defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR)
521#include <CL/cl_ext.h>
522#endif
523
524#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__MACOSX)
525#include <OpenCL/opencl.h>
526#else
527#include <CL/opencl.h>
528#endif // !__APPLE__
529
530#if (__cplusplus >= 201103L)
531#define CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ noexcept
532#else
533#define CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
534#endif
535
536#if defined(_MSC_VER)
537# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __declspec(selectany)
538#else
539# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_
540#endif // !_MSC_VER
541
542// Define deprecated prefixes and suffixes to ensure compilation
543// in case they are not pre-defined
544#if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
545#define CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
546#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
547#if !defined(CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
548#define CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
549#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
550
551#if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
552#define CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
553#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
554#if !defined(CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
555#define CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
556#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
557
558#if !defined(CL_CALLBACK)
559#define CL_CALLBACK
560#endif //CL_CALLBACK
561
562#include <utility>
563#include <limits>
564#include <iterator>
565#include <mutex>
566#include <cstring>
567#include <functional>
568
569
570// Define a size_type to represent a correctly resolved size_t
571#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
572namespace cl {
573 using size_type = ::size_t;
574} // namespace cl
575#else // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
576namespace cl {
577 using size_type = size_t;
578} // namespace cl
579#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
580
581
582#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
583#include <exception>
584#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
585
586#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
587#include <vector>
588namespace cl {
589 template < class T, class Alloc = std::allocator<T> >
590 using vector = std::vector<T, Alloc>;
591} // namespace cl
592#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
593
594#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
595#include <string>
596namespace cl {
597 using string = std::string;
598} // namespace cl
599#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
600
601#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
602
603#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
604#include <memory>
605namespace cl {
606 // Replace unique_ptr and allocate_pointer for internal use
607 // to allow user to replace them
608 template<class T, class D>
609 using pointer = std::unique_ptr<T, D>;
610} // namespace cl
611#endif
612#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
613#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
614#include <array>
615namespace cl {
616 template < class T, size_type N >
617 using array = std::array<T, N>;
618} // namespace cl
619#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
620
621// Define size_type appropriately to allow backward-compatibility
622// use of the old size_t interface class
623#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
624namespace cl {
625 namespace compatibility {
626 /*! \brief class used to interface between C++ and
627 * OpenCL C calls that require arrays of size_t values, whose
628 * size is known statically.
629 */
630 template <int N>
631 class size_t
632 {
633 private:
634 size_type data_[N];
635
636 public:
637 //! \brief Initialize size_t to all 0s
638 size_t()
639 {
640 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
641 data_[i] = 0;
642 }
643 }
644
645 size_t(const array<size_type, N> &rhs)
646 {
647 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
648 data_[i] = rhs[i];
649 }
650 }
651
652 size_type& operator[](int index)
653 {
654 return data_[index];
655 }
656
657 const size_type& operator[](int index) const
658 {
659 return data_[index];
660 }
661
662 //! \brief Conversion operator to T*.
663 operator size_type* () { return data_; }
664
665 //! \brief Conversion operator to const T*.
666 operator const size_type* () const { return data_; }
667
668 operator array<size_type, N>() const
669 {
670 array<size_type, N> ret;
671
672 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
673 ret[i] = data_[i];
674 }
675 return ret;
676 }
677 };
678 } // namespace compatibility
679
680 template<int N>
681 using size_t = compatibility::size_t<N>;
682} // namespace cl
683#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
684
685// Helper alias to avoid confusing the macros
686namespace cl {
687 namespace detail {
688 using size_t_array = array<size_type, 3>;
689 } // namespace detail
690} // namespace cl
691
692
693/*! \namespace cl
694 *
695 * \brief The OpenCL C++ bindings are defined within this namespace.
696 *
697 */
698namespace cl {
699 class Memory;
700
701#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(name) \
702 if (!pfn_##name) { \
703 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name) \
704 clGetExtensionFunctionAddress(#name); \
705 if (!pfn_##name) { \
706 } \
707 }
708
709#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, name) \
710 if (!pfn_##name) { \
711 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name) \
712 clGetExtensionFunctionAddressForPlatform(platform, #name); \
713 if (!pfn_##name) { \
714 } \
715 }
716
717 class Program;
718 class Device;
719 class Context;
720 class CommandQueue;
721 class DeviceCommandQueue;
722 class Memory;
723 class Buffer;
724 class Pipe;
725
726#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
727 /*! \brief Exception class
728 *
729 * This may be thrown by API functions when CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS is defined.
730 */
731 class Error : public std::exception
732 {
733 private:
734 cl_int err_;
735 const char * errStr_;
736 public:
737 /*! \brief Create a new CL error exception for a given error code
738 * and corresponding message.
739 *
740 * \param err error code value.
741 *
742 * \param errStr a descriptive string that must remain in scope until
743 * handling of the exception has concluded. If set, it
744 * will be returned by what().
745 */
746 Error(cl_int err, const char * errStr = NULL) : err_(err), errStr_(errStr)
747 {}
748
749 ~Error() throw() {}
750
751 /*! \brief Get error string associated with exception
752 *
753 * \return A memory pointer to the error message string.
754 */
755 virtual const char * what() const throw ()
756 {
757 if (errStr_ == NULL) {
758 return "empty";
759 }
760 else {
761 return errStr_;
762 }
763 }
764
765 /*! \brief Get error code associated with exception
766 *
767 * \return The error code.
768 */
769 cl_int err(void) const { return err_; }
770 };
771#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) #x
772#else
773#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) NULL
774#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
775
776
777namespace detail
778{
779#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
780static inline cl_int errHandler (
781 cl_int err,
782 const char * errStr = NULL)
783{
784 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
785 throw Error(err, errStr);
786 }
787 return err;
788}
789#else
790static inline cl_int errHandler (cl_int err, const char * errStr = NULL)
791{
792 (void) errStr; // suppress unused variable warning
793 return err;
794}
795#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
796}
797
798

964
965namespace detail {
966
967// Generic getInfoHelper. The final parameter is used to guide overload
968// resolution: the actual parameter passed is an int, which makes this
969// a worse conversion sequence than a specialization that declares the
970// parameter as an int.
971template<typename Functor, typename T>
972inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Functor f, cl_uint name, T* param, long)
973{
974 return f(name, sizeof(T), param, NULL);
975}
976
977// Specialized for getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES>
978// Assumes that the output vector was correctly resized on the way in
979template <typename Func>
980inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<vector<unsigned char>>* param, int)
981{
982 if (name != CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES) {
983 return CL_INVALID_VALUE;
984 }
985 if (param) {
986 // Create array of pointers, calculate total size and pass pointer array in
987 size_type numBinaries = param->size();
988 vector<unsigned char*> binariesPointers(numBinaries);
989
990 for (size_type i = 0; i < numBinaries; ++i)
991 {
992 binariesPointers[i] = (*param)[i].data();
993 }
994
995 cl_int err = f(name, numBinaries * sizeof(unsigned char*), binariesPointers.data(), NULL);
996
997 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
998 return err;
999 }
1000 }
1001
1002
1003 return CL_SUCCESS;
1004}
1005
1006// Specialized getInfoHelper for vector params
1007template <typename Func, typename T>
1008inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, long)
1009{
1010 size_type required;
1011 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1012 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1013 return err;
1014 }
1015 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(T);
1016
1017 // Temporary to avoid changing param on an error
1018 vector<T> localData(elements);
1019 err = f(name, required, localData.data(), NULL);
1020 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1021 return err;
1022 }
1023 if (param) {
1024 *param = std::move(localData);
1025 }
1026
1027 return CL_SUCCESS;
1028}
1029
1030/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1031 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1032 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1033 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1034 * template will provide a better match.
1035 */
1036template <typename Func, typename T>
1037inline cl_int getInfoHelper(
1038 Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1039{
1040 size_type required;
1041 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1042 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1043 return err;
1044 }
1045
1046 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(typename T::cl_type);
1047
1048 vector<typename T::cl_type> value(elements);
1049 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1050 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1051 return err;
1052 }
1053
1054 if (param) {
1055 // Assign to convert CL type to T for each element
1056 param->resize(elements);
1057
1058 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
1059 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
1060 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; i++) {
1061 (*param)[i] = T(value[i], true);
1062 }
1063 }
1064 return CL_SUCCESS;
1065}
1066
1067// Specialized GetInfoHelper for string params
1068template <typename Func>
1069inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, string* param, long)
1070{
1071 size_type required;
1072 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1073 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1074 return err;
1075 }
1076
1077 // std::string has a constant data member
1078 // a char vector does not
1079 if (required > 0) {
1080 vector<char> value(required);
1081 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1082 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1083 return err;
1084 }
1085 if (param) {
1086 param->assign(begin(value), prev(end(value)));
1087 }
1088 }
1089 else if (param) {
1090 param->assign("");
1091 }
1092 return CL_SUCCESS;
1093}
1094
1095// Specialized GetInfoHelper for clsize_t params
1096template <typename Func, size_type N>
1097inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, array<size_type, N>* param, long)
1098{
1099 size_type required;
1100 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1101 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1102 return err;
1103 }
1104
1105 size_type elements = required / sizeof(size_type);
1106 vector<size_type> value(elements, 0);
1107
1108 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1109 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1110 return err;
1111 }
1112
1113 // Bound the copy with N to prevent overruns
1114 // if passed N > than the amount copied
1115 if (elements > N) {
1116 elements = N;
1117 }
1118 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; ++i) {
1119 (*param)[i] = value[i];
1120 }
1121
1122 return CL_SUCCESS;
1123}
1124
1125template<typename T> struct ReferenceHandler;
1126
1127/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1128 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1129 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1130 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1131 * template will provide a better match.
1132 */
1133template<typename Func, typename T>
1134inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1135{
1136 typename T::cl_type value;
1137 cl_int err = f(name, sizeof(value), &value, NULL);
1138 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1139 return err;
1140 }
1141 *param = value;
1142 if (value != NULL)
1143 {
1144 err = param->retain();
1145 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1146 return err;
1147 }
1148 }
1149 return CL_SUCCESS;
1150}
1151
1152#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_(F) \
1153 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_PROFILE, string) \
1154 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, string) \
1155 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_NAME, string) \
1156 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_VENDOR, string) \
1157 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_EXTENSIONS, string) \
1158 \
1159 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_TYPE, cl_device_type) \
1160 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_VENDOR_ID, cl_uint) \
1161 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS, cl_uint) \
1162 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS, cl_uint) \
1163 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE, size_type) \
1164 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES, cl::vector<size_type>) \
1165 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR, cl_uint) \
1166 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT, cl_uint) \
1167 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT, cl_uint) \
1168 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG, cl_uint) \
1169 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT, cl_uint) \
1170 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE, cl_uint) \
1171 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY, cl_uint) \
1172 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ADDRESS_BITS, cl_uint) \
1173 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS, cl_uint) \
1174 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS, cl_uint) \
1175 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE, cl_ulong) \
1176 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_WIDTH, size_type) \
1177 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_IMAGE2D_MAX_HEIGHT, size_type) \

1367 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_STYLE_EXT, cl::vector<cl_device_partition_property_ext>)
1368
1369template <typename enum_type, cl_int Name>
1370struct param_traits {};
1371
1372#define CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_(token, param_name, T) \
1373struct token; \
1374template<> \
1375struct param_traits<detail:: token,param_name> \
1376{ \
1377 enum { value = param_name }; \
1378 typedef T param_type; \
1379};
1380
1381CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1382#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1383CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1384#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1385#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1386CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1387#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1388#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1389CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1390#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1391#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1392CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1393#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1394
1395#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR) && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 210

1397#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR) && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 210

1413
1414// Include deprecated query flags based on versions
1415// Only include deprecated 1.0 flags if 2.0 not active as there is an enum clash
1416#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 100 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1417CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1418#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 110
1419#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 110 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200

1421#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120

1423CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1424#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
