1490
1491// Convenience functions
1492
1493template <typename Func, typename T>
1494inline cl_int
1495getInfo(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param)
1496{
1497 return getInfoHelper(f, name, param, 0);
1498}
1499
1500template <typename Func, typename Arg0>
1501struct GetInfoFunctor0
1502{
1503 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_;
1504 cl_int operator ()(
1505 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1506 { return f_(arg0_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1507};
1508
1509template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1>
1510struct GetInfoFunctor1
1511{
1512 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_; const Arg1& arg1_;
1513 cl_int operator ()(
1514 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1515 { return f_(arg0_, arg1_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1516};
1517
1518template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename T>
1519inline cl_int
1520getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, cl_uint name, T* param)
1521{
1522 GetInfoFunctor0<Func, Arg0> f0 = { f, arg0 };
1523 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1524}
1525
1526template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1, typename T>
1527inline cl_int
1528getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, const Arg1& arg1, cl_uint name, T* param)
1529{
1530 GetInfoFunctor1<Func, Arg0, Arg1> f0 = { f, arg0, arg1 };
1531 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1532}
1533
1534
1535template<typename T>
1536struct ReferenceHandler
1537{ };
1538
1539#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1540/**
1541 * OpenCL 1.2 devices do have retain/release.
1542 */
1543template <>
1544struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1545{
1546 /**
1547 * Retain the device.
1548 * \param device A valid device created using createSubDevices
1549 * \return
1550 * CL_SUCCESS if the function executed successfully.
1551 * CL_INVALID_DEVICE if device was not a valid subdevice
1552 * CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES
1553 * CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY
1554 */
1555 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id device)
1556 { return ::clRetainDevice(device); }
1557 /**
1558 * Retain the device.
1559 * \param device A valid device created using createSubDevices
1560 * \return
1561 * CL_SUCCESS if the function executed successfully.
1562 * CL_INVALID_DEVICE if device was not a valid subdevice
1563 * CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES
1564 * CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY
1565 */
1566 static cl_int release(cl_device_id device)
1567 { return ::clReleaseDevice(device); }
1568};
1569#else // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1570/**
1571 * OpenCL 1.1 devices do not have retain/release.
1572 */
1573template <>
1574struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1575{
1576 // cl_device_id does not have retain().
1577 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id)
1578 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1579 // cl_device_id does not have release().
1580 static cl_int release(cl_device_id)
1581 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1582};
1583#endif // ! (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120)
1584
1585template <>
1586struct ReferenceHandler<cl_platform_id>
1587{
1588 // cl_platform_id does not have retain().
1589 static cl_int retain(cl_platform_id)
1590 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1591 // cl_platform_id does not have release().
1592 static cl_int release(cl_platform_id)
1593 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1594};
1595
1596template <>
1597struct ReferenceHandler<cl_context>
1598{
1599 static cl_int retain(cl_context context)
1600 { return ::clRetainContext(context); }
1601 static cl_int release(cl_context context)
1602 { return ::clReleaseContext(context); }
1603};
1604
1605template <>
1606struct ReferenceHandler<cl_command_queue>
1607{
1608 static cl_int retain(cl_command_queue queue)
1609 { return ::clRetainCommandQueue(queue); }
1610 static cl_int release(cl_command_queue queue)
1611 { return ::clReleaseCommandQueue(queue); }
1612};
1613
1614template <>
1615struct ReferenceHandler<cl_mem>
1616{
1617 static cl_int retain(cl_mem memory)
1618 { return ::clRetainMemObject(memory); }
1619 static cl_int release(cl_mem memory)
1620 { return ::clReleaseMemObject(memory); }
1621};
1622
1623template <>
1624struct ReferenceHandler<cl_sampler>
1625{
1626 static cl_int retain(cl_sampler sampler)
1627 { return ::clRetainSampler(sampler); }
1628 static cl_int release(cl_sampler sampler)
1629 { return ::clReleaseSampler(sampler); }
1630};
1631
1632template <>
1633struct ReferenceHandler<cl_program>
1634{
1635 static cl_int retain(cl_program program)
1636 { return ::clRetainProgram(program); }
1637 static cl_int release(cl_program program)
1638 { return ::clReleaseProgram(program); }
1639};
1640
1641template <>
1642struct ReferenceHandler<cl_kernel>
1643{
1644 static cl_int retain(cl_kernel kernel)
1645 { return ::clRetainKernel(kernel); }
1646 static cl_int release(cl_kernel kernel)
1647 { return ::clReleaseKernel(kernel); }
1648};
1649
1650template <>
1651struct ReferenceHandler<cl_event>
1652{
1653 static cl_int retain(cl_event event)
1654 { return ::clRetainEvent(event); }
1655 static cl_int release(cl_event event)
1656 { return ::clReleaseEvent(event); }
1657};
1658
1659
1660#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1661// Extracts version number with major in the upper 16 bits, minor in the lower 16
1662static cl_uint getVersion(const vector<char> &versionInfo)
1663{
1664 int highVersion = 0;
1665 int lowVersion = 0;
1666 int index = 7;
1667 while(versionInfo[index] != '.' ) {
1668 highVersion *= 10;
1669 highVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
1670 ++index;
1671 }
1672 ++index;
1673 while(versionInfo[index] != ' ' && versionInfo[index] != '\0') {
1674 lowVersion *= 10;
1675 lowVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
1676 ++index;
1677 }
1678 return (highVersion << 16) | lowVersion;
1679}
1680
1681static cl_uint getPlatformVersion(cl_platform_id platform)
1682{
1683 size_type size = 0;
1684 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, 0, NULL, &size);
1685
1686 vector<char> versionInfo(size);
1687 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, size, versionInfo.data(), &size);
1688 return getVersion(versionInfo);
1689}
1690
1691static cl_uint getDevicePlatformVersion(cl_device_id device)
1692{
1693 cl_platform_id platform;
1694 clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM, sizeof(platform), &platform, NULL);
1695 return getPlatformVersion(platform);
1696}
1697
1698static cl_uint getContextPlatformVersion(cl_context context)
1699{
1700 // The platform cannot be queried directly, so we first have to grab a
1701 // device and obtain its context
1702 size_type size = 0;
1703 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, 0, NULL, &size);
1704 if (size == 0)
1705 return 0;
1706 vector<cl_device_id> devices(size/sizeof(cl_device_id));
1707 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, size, devices.data(), NULL);
1708 return getDevicePlatformVersion(devices[0]);
1709}
1710#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1711
1712template <typename T>
1713class Wrapper
1714{
1715public:
1716 typedef T cl_type;
1717
1718protected:
1719 cl_type object_;
1720
1721public:
1722 Wrapper() : object_(NULL) { }
1723
1724 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) : object_(obj)
1725 {
1726 if (retainObject) {
1727 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1728 }
1729 }
1730
1731 ~Wrapper()
1732 {
1733 if (object_ != NULL) { release(); }
1734 }
1735
1736 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1737 {
1738 object_ = rhs.object_;
1739 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1740 }
1741
1742 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
1743 {
1744 object_ = rhs.object_;
1745 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1746 }
1747
1748 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1749 {
1750 if (this != &rhs) {
1751 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1752 object_ = rhs.object_;
1753 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1754 }
1755 return *this;
1756 }
1757
1758 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
1759 {
1760 if (this != &rhs) {
1761 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1762 object_ = rhs.object_;
1763 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1764 }
1765 return *this;
1766 }
1767
1768 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
1769 {
1770 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1771 object_ = rhs;
1772 return *this;
1773 }
1774
1775 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
1776
1777 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
1778
1779 const cl_type get() const { return object_; }
1780
1781 cl_type get() { return object_; }
1782
1783
1784protected:
1785 template<typename Func, typename U>
1786 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1787
1788 cl_int retain() const
1789 {
1790 if (object_ != nullptr) {
1791 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
1792 }
1793 else {
1794 return CL_SUCCESS;
1795 }
1796 }
1797
1798 cl_int release() const
1799 {
1800 if (object_ != nullptr) {
1801 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
1802 }
1803 else {
1804 return CL_SUCCESS;
1805 }
1806 }
1807};
1808
1809template <>
1810class Wrapper<cl_device_id>
1811{
1812public:
1813 typedef cl_device_id cl_type;
1814
1815protected:
1816 cl_type object_;
1817 bool referenceCountable_;
1818
1819 static bool isReferenceCountable(cl_device_id device)
1820 {
1821 bool retVal = false;
1822#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1823#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1824 if (device != NULL) {
1825 int version = getDevicePlatformVersion(device);
1826 if(version > ((1 << 16) + 1)) {
1827 retVal = true;
1828 }
1829 }
1830#else // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1831 retVal = true;
1832#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1833#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1834 return retVal;
1835 }
1836
1837public:
1838 Wrapper() : object_(NULL), referenceCountable_(false)
1839 {
1840 }
1841
1842 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) :
1843 object_(obj),
1844 referenceCountable_(false)
1845 {
1846 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(obj);
1847
1848 if (retainObject) {
1849 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1850 }
1851 }
1852
1853 ~Wrapper()
1854 {
1855 release();
1856 }
1857
1858 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1859 {
1860 object_ = rhs.object_;
1861 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
1862 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1863 }
1864
1865 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
1866 {
1867 object_ = rhs.object_;
1868 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1869 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1870 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
1871 }
1872
1873 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1874 {
1875 if (this != &rhs) {
1876 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1877 object_ = rhs.object_;
1878 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1879 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1880 }
1881 return *this;
1882 }
1883
1884 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
1885 {
1886 if (this != &rhs) {
1887 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1888 object_ = rhs.object_;
1889 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1890 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1891 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
1892 }
1893 return *this;
1894 }
1895
1896 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
1897 {
1898 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1899 object_ = rhs;
1900 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
1901 return *this;
1902 }
1903
1904 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
1905
1906 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
1907
1908 cl_type get() const { return object_; }
1909
1910protected:
1911 template<typename Func, typename U>
1912 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1913
1914 template<typename Func, typename U>
1915 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, vector<U>*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1916
1917 cl_int retain() const
1918 {
1919 if( object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_ ) {
1920 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
1921 }
1922 else {
1923 return CL_SUCCESS;
1924 }
1925 }
1926
1927 cl_int release() const
1928 {
1929 if (object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_) {
1930 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
1931 }
1932 else {
1933 return CL_SUCCESS;
1934 }
1935 }
1936};
1937
1938template <typename T>
1939inline bool operator==(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
1940{
1941 return lhs() == rhs();
1942}
1943
1944template <typename T>
1945inline bool operator!=(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
1946{
1947 return !operator==(lhs, rhs);
1948}
1949
1950} // namespace detail
1951//! \endcond
1952
1953
1954using BuildLogType = vector<std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>::param_type>>;
1955#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
1956/**
1957* Exception class for build errors to carry build info
1958*/
1959class BuildError : public Error
1960{
1961private:
1962 BuildLogType buildLogs;
1963public:
1964 BuildError(cl_int err, const char * errStr, const BuildLogType &vec) : Error(err, errStr), buildLogs(vec)
1965 {
1966 }
1967
1968 BuildLogType getBuildLog() const
1969 {
1970 return buildLogs;
1971 }
1972};
1973namespace detail {
1974 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
1975 cl_int err,
1976 const char * errStr,
1977 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
1978 {
1979 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1980 throw BuildError(err, errStr, buildLogs);
1981 }
1982 return err;
1983 }
1984} // namespace detail
1985
1986#else
1987namespace detail {
1988 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
1989 cl_int err,
1990 const char * errStr,
1991 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
1992 {
1993 (void)buildLogs; // suppress unused variable warning
1994 (void)errStr;
1995 return err;
1996 }
1997} // namespace detail
1998#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
1999
2000
2001/*! \stuct ImageFormat
2002 * \brief Adds constructors and member functions for cl_image_format.
2003 *
2004 * \see cl_image_format
2005 */
2006struct ImageFormat : public cl_image_format
2007{
2008 //! \brief Default constructor - performs no initialization.
2009 ImageFormat(){}
2010
2011 //! \brief Initializing constructor.
2012 ImageFormat(cl_channel_order order, cl_channel_type type)
2013 {
2014 image_channel_order = order;
2015 image_channel_data_type = type;
2016 }
2017
2018 //! \brief Assignment operator.
2019 ImageFormat& operator = (const ImageFormat& rhs)
2020 {
2021 if (this != &rhs) {
2022 this->image_channel_data_type = rhs.image_channel_data_type;
2023 this->image_channel_order = rhs.image_channel_order;
2024 }
2025 return *this;
2026 }
2027};
2028
2029/*! \brief Class interface for cl_device_id.
2030 *
2031 * \note Copies of these objects are inexpensive, since they don't 'own'
2032 * any underlying resources or data structures.
2033 *
2034 * \see cl_device_id
2035 */
2036class Device : public detail::Wrapper<cl_device_id>
2037{
2038private:
2039 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2040 static Device default_;
2041 static cl_int default_error_;
2042
2043 /*! \brief Create the default context.
2044 *
2045 * This sets @c default_ and @c default_error_. It does not throw
2046 * @c cl::Error.
2047 */
2048 static void makeDefault();
2049
2050 /*! \brief Create the default platform from a provided platform.
2051 *
2052 * This sets @c default_. It does not throw
2053 * @c cl::Error.
2054 */
2055 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Device &p) {
2056 default_ = p;
2057 }
2058
2059public:
2060#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2061 /*! \brief Reset the default.
2062 *
2063 * This sets @c default_ to an empty value to support cleanup in
2064 * the unit test framework.
2065 * This function is not thread safe.
2066 */
2067 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2068 default_ = Device();
2069 }
2070#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2071
2072 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
2073 Device() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2074
2075 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_device_id.
2076 *
2077 * This simply copies the device ID value, which is an inexpensive operation.
2078 */
2079 explicit Device(const cl_device_id &device, bool retainObject = false) :
2080 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(device, retainObject) { }
2081
2082 /*! \brief Returns the first device on the default context.
2083 *
2084 * \see Context::getDefault()
2085 */
2086 static Device getDefault(
2087 cl_int *errResult = NULL)
2088 {
2089 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2090 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2091 if (errResult != NULL) {
2092 *errResult = default_error_;
2093 }
2094 return default_;
2095 }
2096
2097 /**
2098 * Modify the default device to be used by
2099 * subsequent operations.
2100 * Will only set the default if no default was previously created.
2101 * @return updated default device.
2102 * Should be compared to the passed value to ensure that it was updated.
2103 */
2104 static Device setDefault(const Device &default_device)
2105 {
2106 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_device));
2107 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2108 return default_;
2109 }
2110
2111 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_device_id.
2112 *
2113 * This simply copies the device ID value, which is an inexpensive operation.
2114 */
2115 Device& operator = (const cl_device_id& rhs)
2116 {
2117 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2118 return *this;
2119 }
2120
2121 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
2122 * Required for MSVC.
2123 */
2124 Device(const Device& dev) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(dev) {}
2125
2126 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
2127 * Required for MSVC.
2128 */
2129 Device& operator = (const Device &dev)
2130 {
2131 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(dev);
2132 return *this;
2133 }
2134
2135 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
2136 * Required for MSVC.
2137 */
2138 Device(Device&& dev) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(dev)) {}
2139
2140 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
2141 * Required for MSVC.
2142 */
2143 Device& operator = (Device &&dev)
2144 {
2145 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(dev));
2146 return *this;
2147 }
2148
2149 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetDeviceInfo().
2150 template <typename T>
2151 cl_int getInfo(cl_device_info name, T* param) const
2152 {
2153 return detail::errHandler(
2154 detail::getInfo(&::clGetDeviceInfo, object_, name, param),
2155 __GET_DEVICE_INFO_ERR);
2156 }
2157
2158 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetDeviceInfo() that returns by value.
2159 template <cl_int name> typename
2160 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type
2161 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
2162 {
2163 typename detail::param_traits<
2164 detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type param;
2165 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2166 if (err != NULL) {
2167 *err = result;
2168 }
2169 return param;
2170 }
2171
2172
2173#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2174 /**
2175 * Return the current value of the host clock as seen by the device.
2176 * The resolution of the device timer may be queried with the
2177 * CL_DEVICE_PROFILING_TIMER_RESOLUTION query.
2178 * @return The host timer value.
2179 */
2180 cl_ulong getHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2181 {
2182 cl_ulong retVal = 0;
2183 cl_int err =
2184 clGetHostTimer(this->get(), &retVal);
2185 detail::errHandler(
2186 err,
2187 __GET_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2188 if (error) {
2189 *error = err;
2190 }
2191 return retVal;
2192 }
2193
2194 /**
2195 * Return a synchronized pair of host and device timestamps as seen by device.
2196 * Use to correlate the clocks and get the host timer only using getHostTimer
2197 * as a lower cost mechanism in between calls.
2198 * The resolution of the host timer may be queried with the
2199 * CL_PLATFORM_HOST_TIMER_RESOLUTION query.
2200 * The resolution of the device timer may be queried with the
2201 * CL_DEVICE_PROFILING_TIMER_RESOLUTION query.
2202 * @return A pair of (device timer, host timer) timer values.
2203 */
2204 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> getDeviceAndHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2205 {
2206 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> retVal;
2207 cl_int err =
2208 clGetDeviceAndHostTimer(this->get(), &(retVal.first), &(retVal.second));
2209 detail::errHandler(
2210 err,
2211 __GET_DEVICE_AND_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2212 if (error) {
2213 *error = err;
2214 }
2215 return retVal;
2216 }
2217#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2218
2219 /**
2220 * CL 1.2 version
2221 */
2222#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2223 //! \brief Wrapper for clCreateSubDevices().
2224 cl_int createSubDevices(
2225 const cl_device_partition_property * properties,
2226 vector<Device>* devices)
2227 {
2228 cl_uint n = 0;
2229 cl_int err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, 0, NULL, &n);
2230 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2231 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2232 }
2233
2234 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2235 err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2236 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2237 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2238 }
2239
2240 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2241 // with safe construction
2242 if (devices) {
2243 devices->resize(ids.size());
2244
2245 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2246 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2247 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2248 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
2249 // by the runtime
2250 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
2251 }
2252 }
2253
2254 return CL_SUCCESS;
2255 }
2256#elif defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
2257
2258/**
2259 * CL 1.1 version that uses device fission extension.
2260 */
2261 cl_int createSubDevices(
2262 const cl_device_partition_property_ext * properties,
2263 vector<Device>* devices)
2264 {
2265 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int
2266 ( CL_API_CALL * PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT)(
2267 cl_device_id /*in_device*/,
2268 const cl_device_partition_property_ext * /* properties */,
2269 cl_uint /*num_entries*/,
2270 cl_device_id * /*out_devices*/,
2271 cl_uint * /*num_devices*/ ) CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1;
2272
2273 static PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT = NULL;
2274 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateSubDevicesEXT);
2275
2276 cl_uint n = 0;
2277 cl_int err = pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, 0, NULL, &n);
2278 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2279 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2280 }
2281
2282 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2283 err = pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2284 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2285 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2286 }
2287 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2288 // with safe construction
2289 if (devices) {
2290 devices->resize(ids.size());
2291
2292 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2293 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2294 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2295 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
2296 // by the runtime
2297 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
2298 }
2299 }
2300 return CL_SUCCESS;
2301 }
2302#endif // defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
2303};
2304
2305CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Device::default_initialized_;
2306CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Device Device::default_;
2307CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Device::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
2308
2309/*! \brief Class interface for cl_platform_id.
2310 *
2311 * \note Copies of these objects are inexpensive, since they don't 'own'
2312 * any underlying resources or data structures.
2313 *
2314 * \see cl_platform_id
2315 */
2316class Platform : public detail::Wrapper<cl_platform_id>
2317{
2318private:
2319 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2320 static Platform default_;
2321 static cl_int default_error_;
2322
2323 /*! \brief Create the default context.
2324 *
2325 * This sets @c default_ and @c default_error_. It does not throw
2326 * @c cl::Error.
2327 */
2328 static void makeDefault() {
2329 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
2330 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
2331 */
2332#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2333 try
2334#endif
2335 {
2336 // If default wasn't passed ,generate one
2337 // Otherwise set it
2338 cl_uint n = 0;
2339
2340 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &n);
2341 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2342 default_error_ = err;
2343 return;
2344 }
2345 if (n == 0) {
2346 default_error_ = CL_INVALID_PLATFORM;
2347 return;
2348 }
2349
2350 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2351 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), NULL);
2352 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2353 default_error_ = err;
2354 return;
2355 }
2356
2357 default_ = Platform(ids[0]);
2358 }
2359#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2360 catch (cl::Error &e) {
2361 default_error_ = e.err();
2362 }
2363#endif
2364 }
2365
2366 /*! \brief Create the default platform from a provided platform.
2367 *
2368 * This sets @c default_. It does not throw
2369 * @c cl::Error.
2370 */
2371 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Platform &p) {
2372 default_ = p;
2373 }
2374
2375public:
2376#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2377 /*! \brief Reset the default.
2378 *
2379 * This sets @c default_ to an empty value to support cleanup in
2380 * the unit test framework.
2381 * This function is not thread safe.
2382 */
2383 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2384 default_ = Platform();
2385 }
2386#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2387
2388 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
2389 Platform() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2390
2391 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_platform_id.
2392 *
2393 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
2394 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
2395 * earlier versions.
2396 * This simply copies the platform ID value, which is an inexpensive operation.
2397 */
2398 explicit Platform(const cl_platform_id &platform, bool retainObject = false) :
2399 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(platform, retainObject) { }
2400
2401 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_platform_id.
2402 *
2403 * This simply copies the platform ID value, which is an inexpensive operation.
2404 */
2405 Platform& operator = (const cl_platform_id& rhs)
2406 {
2407 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2408 return *this;
2409 }
2410
2411 static Platform getDefault(
2412 cl_int *errResult = NULL)
2413 {
2414 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2415 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2416 if (errResult != NULL) {
2417 *errResult = default_error_;
2418 }
2419 return default_;
2420 }
2421
2422 /**
2423 * Modify the default platform to be used by
2424 * subsequent operations.
2425 * Will only set the default if no default was previously created.
2426 * @return updated default platform.
2427 * Should be compared to the passed value to ensure that it was updated.
2428 */
2429 static Platform setDefault(const Platform &default_platform)
2430 {
2431 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_platform));
2432 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2433 return default_;
2434 }
2435
2436 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetPlatformInfo().
2437 cl_int getInfo(cl_platform_info name, string* param) const
2438 {
2439 return detail::errHandler(
2440 detail::getInfo(&::clGetPlatformInfo, object_, name, param),
2441 __GET_PLATFORM_INFO_ERR);
2442 }
2443
2444 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetPlatformInfo() that returns by value.
2445 template <cl_int name> typename
2446 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type
2447 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
2448 {
2449 typename detail::param_traits<
2450 detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type param;
2451 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2452 if (err != NULL) {
2453 *err = result;
2454 }
2455 return param;
2456 }
2457
2458 /*! \brief Gets a list of devices for this platform.
2459 *
2460 * Wraps clGetDeviceIDs().
2461 */
2462 cl_int getDevices(
2463 cl_device_type type,
2464 vector<Device>* devices) const
2465 {
2466 cl_uint n = 0;
2467 if( devices == NULL ) {
2468 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2469 }
2470 cl_int err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, 0, NULL, &n);
2471 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2472 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2473 }
2474
2475 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2476 err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2477 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2478 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2479 }
2480
2481 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2482 // with safe construction
2483 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2484 // API-owned objects.
2485 if (devices) {
2486 devices->resize(ids.size());
2487
2488 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2489 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2490 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2491 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2492 }
2493 }
2494 return CL_SUCCESS;
2495 }
2496
2497#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
2498 /*! \brief Get the list of available D3D10 devices.
2499 *
2500 * \param d3d_device_source.
2501 *
2502 * \param d3d_object.
2503 *
2504 * \param d3d_device_set.
2505 *
2506 * \param devices returns a vector of OpenCL D3D10 devices found. The cl::Device
2507 * values returned in devices can be used to identify a specific OpenCL
2508 * device. If \a devices argument is NULL, this argument is ignored.
2509 *
2510 * \return One of the following values:
2511 * - CL_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully.
2512 *
2513 * The application can query specific capabilities of the OpenCL device(s)
2514 * returned by cl::getDevices. This can be used by the application to
2515 * determine which device(s) to use.
2516 *
2517 * \note In the case that exceptions are enabled and a return value
2518 * other than CL_SUCCESS is generated, then cl::Error exception is
2519 * generated.
2520 */
2521 cl_int getDevices(
2522 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2523 void * d3d_object,
2524 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2525 vector<Device>* devices) const
2526 {
2527 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR)(
2528 cl_platform_id platform,
2529 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2530 void * d3d_object,
2531 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2532 cl_uint num_entries,
2533 cl_device_id * devices,
2534 cl_uint* num_devices);
2535
2536 if( devices == NULL ) {
2537 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2538 }
2539
2540 static PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR = NULL;
2541 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(object_, clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR);
2542
2543 cl_uint n = 0;
2544 cl_int err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2545 object_,
2546 d3d_device_source,
2547 d3d_object,
2548 d3d_device_set,
2549 0,
2550 NULL,
2551 &n);
2552 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2553 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2554 }
2555
2556 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2557 err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2558 object_,
2559 d3d_device_source,
2560 d3d_object,
2561 d3d_device_set,
2562 n,
2563 ids.data(),
2564 NULL);
2565 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2566 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2567 }
2568
2569 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2570 // with safe construction
2571 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2572 // API-owned objects.
2573 if (devices) {
2574 devices->resize(ids.size());
2575
2576 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2577 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2578 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2579 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2580 }
2581 }
2582 return CL_SUCCESS;
2583 }
2584#endif
2585
2586 /*! \brief Gets a list of available platforms.
2587 *
2588 * Wraps clGetPlatformIDs().
2589 */
2590 static cl_int get(
2591 vector<Platform>* platforms)
2592 {
2593 cl_uint n = 0;
2594
2595 if( platforms == NULL ) {
2596 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2597 }
2598
2599 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &n);
2600 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2601 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2602 }
2603
2604 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2605 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), NULL);
2606 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2607 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2608 }
2609
2610 if (platforms) {
2611 platforms->resize(ids.size());
2612
2613 // Platforms don't reference count
2614 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2615 (*platforms)[i] = Platform(ids[i]);
2616 }
2617 }
2618 return CL_SUCCESS;
2619 }
2620
2621 /*! \brief Gets the first available platform.
2622 *
2623 * Wraps clGetPlatformIDs(), returning the first result.
2624 */
2625 static cl_int get(
2626 Platform * platform)
2627 {
2628 cl_int err;
2629 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2630 if (platform) {
2631 *platform = default_platform;
2632 }
2633 return err;
2634 }
2635
2636 /*! \brief Gets the first available platform, returning it by value.
2637 *
2638 * \return Returns a valid platform if one is available.
2639 * If no platform is available will return a null platform.
2640 * Throws an exception if no platforms are available
2641 * or an error condition occurs.
2642 * Wraps clGetPlatformIDs(), returning the first result.
2643 */
2644 static Platform get(
2645 cl_int * errResult = NULL)
2646 {
2647 cl_int err;
2648 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2649 if (errResult) {
2650 *errResult = err;
2651 }
2652 return default_platform;
2653 }
2654
2655#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2656 //! \brief Wrapper for clUnloadCompiler().
2657 cl_int
2658 unloadCompiler()
2659 {
2660 return ::clUnloadPlatformCompiler(object_);
2661 }
2662#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2663}; // class Platform
2664
2665CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Platform::default_initialized_;
2666CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Platform Platform::default_;
2667CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Platform::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
2668
2669
2670/**
2671 * Deprecated APIs for 1.2
2672 */
2673#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
2674/**
2675 * Unload the OpenCL compiler.
2676 * \note Deprecated for OpenCL 1.2. Use Platform::unloadCompiler instead.
2677 */
2678inline CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED cl_int
2679UnloadCompiler() CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED;
2680inline cl_int
2681UnloadCompiler()
2682{
2683 return ::clUnloadCompiler();
2684}
2685#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
2686
2687/*! \brief Class interface for cl_context.
2688 *
2689 * \note Copies of these objects are shallow, meaning that the copy will refer
2690 * to the same underlying cl_context as the original. For details, see
2691 * clRetainContext() and clReleaseContext().
2692 *
2693 * \see cl_context
2694 */
2695class Context
2696 : public detail::Wrapper<cl_context>
2697{
2698private:
2699 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2700 static Context default_;
2701 static cl_int default_error_;
2702
2703 /*! \brief Create the default context from the default device type in the default platform.
2704 *
2705 * This sets @c default_ and @c default_error_. It does not throw
2706 * @c cl::Error.
2707 */
2708 static void makeDefault() {
2709 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
2710 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
2711 */
2712#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2713 try
2714#endif
2715 {
2716#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2717 const Platform &p = Platform::getDefault();
2718 cl_platform_id defaultPlatform = p();
2719 cl_context_properties properties[3] = {
2720 CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, (cl_context_properties)defaultPlatform, 0
2721 };
2722#else // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2723 cl_context_properties *properties = nullptr;
2724#endif // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2725
2726 default_ = Context(
2727 CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT,
2728 properties,
2729 NULL,
2730 NULL,
2731 &default_error_);
2732 }
2733#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2734 catch (cl::Error &e) {
2735 default_error_ = e.err();
2736 }
2737#endif
2738 }
2739
2740
2741 /*! \brief Create the default context from a provided Context.
2742 *
2743 * This sets @c default_. It does not throw
2744 * @c cl::Error.
2745 */
2746 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Context &c) {
2747 default_ = c;
2748 }
2749
2750public:
2751#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2752 /*! \brief Reset the default.
2753 *
2754 * This sets @c default_ to an empty value to support cleanup in
2755 * the unit test framework.
2756 * This function is not thread safe.
2757 */
2758 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2759 default_ = Context();
2760 }
2761#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2762
2763 /*! \brief Constructs a context including a list of specified devices.
2764 *
2765 * Wraps clCreateContext().
2766 */
2767 Context(
2768 const vector<Device>& devices,
2769 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2770 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2771 const char *,
2772 const void *,
2773 size_type,
2774 void *) = NULL,
2775 void* data = NULL,
2776 cl_int* err = NULL)
2777 {
2778 cl_int error;
2779
2780 size_type numDevices = devices.size();
2781 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
2782
2783 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
2784 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
2785 }
2786
2787 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
2788 properties, (cl_uint) numDevices,
2789 deviceIDs.data(),
2790 notifyFptr, data, &error);
2791
2792 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
2793 if (err != NULL) {
2794 *err = error;
2795 }
2796 }
2797
2798 Context(
2799 const Device& device,
2800 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2801 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2802 const char *,
2803 const void *,
2804 size_type,
2805 void *) = NULL,
2806 void* data = NULL,
2807 cl_int* err = NULL)
2808 {
2809 cl_int error;
2810
2811 cl_device_id deviceID = device();
2812
2813 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
2814 properties, 1,
2815 &deviceID,
2816 notifyFptr, data, &error);
2817
2818 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
2819 if (err != NULL) {
2820 *err = error;
2821 }
2822 }
2823
2824 /*! \brief Constructs a context including all or a subset of devices of a specified type.
2825 *
2826 * Wraps clCreateContextFromType().
2827 */
2828 Context(
2829 cl_device_type type,
2830 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2831 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2832 const char *,
2833 const void *,
2834 size_type,
2835 void *) = NULL,
2836 void* data = NULL,
2837 cl_int* err = NULL)
2838 {
2839 cl_int error;
2840
2841#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2842 cl_context_properties prop[4] = {CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, 0, 0, 0 };
2843
2844 if (properties == NULL) {
2845 // Get a valid platform ID as we cannot send in a blank one
2846 vector<Platform> platforms;
2847 error = Platform::get(&platforms);
2848 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
2849 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2850 if (err != NULL) {
2851 *err = error;
2852 }
2853 return;
2854 }
2855
2856 // Check the platforms we found for a device of our specified type
2857 cl_context_properties platform_id = 0;
2858 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < platforms.size(); i++) {
2859
2860 vector<Device> devices;
2861
2862#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2863 try {
2864#endif
2865
2866 error = platforms[i].getDevices(type, &devices);
2867
2868#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2869 } catch (cl::Error& e) {
2870 error = e.err();
2871 }
2872 // Catch if exceptions are enabled as we don't want to exit if first platform has no devices of type
2873 // We do error checking next anyway, and can throw there if needed
2874#endif
2875
2876 // Only squash CL_SUCCESS and CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND
2877 if (error != CL_SUCCESS && error != CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) {
2878 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2879 if (err != NULL) {
2880 *err = error;
2881 }
2882 }
2883
2884 if (devices.size() > 0) {
2885 platform_id = (cl_context_properties)platforms[i]();
2886 break;
2887 }
2888 }
2889
2890 if (platform_id == 0) {
2891 detail::errHandler(CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2892 if (err != NULL) {
2893 *err = CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2894 }
2895 return;
2896 }
2897
2898 prop[1] = platform_id;
2899 properties = &prop[0];
2900 }
2901#endif
2902 object_ = ::clCreateContextFromType(
2903 properties, type, notifyFptr, data, &error);
2904
2905 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2906 if (err != NULL) {
2907 *err = error;
2908 }
2909 }
2910
2911 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
2912 * Required for MSVC.
2913 */
2914 Context(const Context& ctx) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(ctx) {}
2915
2916 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
2917 * Required for MSVC.
2918 */
2919 Context& operator = (const Context &ctx)
2920 {
2921 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(ctx);
2922 return *this;
2923 }
2924
2925 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
2926 * Required for MSVC.
2927 */
2928 Context(Context&& ctx) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(ctx)) {}
2929
2930 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
2931 * Required for MSVC.
2932 */
2933 Context& operator = (Context &&ctx)
2934 {
2935 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(ctx));
2936 return *this;
2937 }
2938
2939
2940 /*! \brief Returns a singleton context including all devices of CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT.
2941 *
2942 * \note All calls to this function return the same cl_context as the first.
2943 */
2944 static Context getDefault(cl_int * err = NULL)
2945 {
2946 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2947 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2948 if (err != NULL) {
2949 *err = default_error_;
2950 }
2951 return default_;
2952 }
2953
2954 /**
2955 * Modify the default context to be used by
2956 * subsequent operations.
2957 * Will only set the default if no default was previously created.
2958 * @return updated default context.
2959 * Should be compared to the passed value to ensure that it was updated.
2960 */
2961 static Context setDefault(const Context &default_context)
2962 {
2963 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_context));
2964 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2965 return default_;
2966 }
2967
2968 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
2969 Context() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2970
2971 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_context - takes ownership.
2972 *
2973 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the cl_context
2974 * into the new Context object.
2975 */
2976 explicit Context(const cl_context& context, bool retainObject = false) :
2977 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(context, retainObject) { }
2978
2979 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_context - takes ownership.
2980 *
2981 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the rhs and calls
2982 * clReleaseContext() on the value previously held by this instance.
2983 */
2984 Context& operator = (const cl_context& rhs)
2985 {
2986 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2987 return *this;
2988 }
2989
2990 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetContextInfo().
2991 template <typename T>
2992 cl_int getInfo(cl_context_info name, T* param) const
2993 {
2994 return detail::errHandler(
2995 detail::getInfo(&::clGetContextInfo, object_, name, param),
2996 __GET_CONTEXT_INFO_ERR);
2997 }
2998
2999 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetContextInfo() that returns by value.
3000 template <cl_int name> typename
3001 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type
3002 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
3003 {
3004 typename detail::param_traits<
3005 detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type param;
3006 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3007 if (err != NULL) {
3008 *err = result;
3009 }
3010 return param;
3011 }
3012
3013 /*! \brief Gets a list of supported image formats.
3014 *
3015 * Wraps clGetSupportedImageFormats().
3016 */
3017 cl_int getSupportedImageFormats(
3018 cl_mem_flags flags,
3019 cl_mem_object_type type,
3020 vector<ImageFormat>* formats) const
3021 {
3022 cl_uint numEntries;
3023
3024 if (!formats) {
3025 return CL_SUCCESS;
3026 }
3027
3028 cl_int err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3029 object_,
3030 flags,
3031 type,
3032 0,
3033 NULL,
3034 &numEntries);
3035 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3036 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3037 }
3038
3039 if (numEntries > 0) {
3040 vector<ImageFormat> value(numEntries);
3041 err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3042 object_,
3043 flags,
3044 type,
3045 numEntries,
3046 (cl_image_format*)value.data(),
3047 NULL);
3048 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3049 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3050 }
3051
3052 formats->assign(begin(value), end(value));
3053 }
3054 else {
3055 // If no values are being returned, ensure an empty vector comes back
3056 formats->clear();
3057 }
3058
3059 return CL_SUCCESS;
3060 }
3061};
3062
3063inline void Device::makeDefault()
3064{
3065 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
3066 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
3067 */
3068#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3069 try
3070#endif
3071 {
3072 cl_int error = 0;
3073
3074 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
3075 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
3076
3077 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
3078 default_error_ = error;
3079 }
3080 else {
3081 default_ = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()[0];
3082 default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3083 }
3084 }
3085#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3086 catch (cl::Error &e) {
3087 default_error_ = e.err();
3088 }
3089#endif
3090}
3091
3092CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Context::default_initialized_;
3093CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Context Context::default_;
3094CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Context::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3095
3096/*! \brief Class interface for cl_event.
3097 *
3098 * \note Copies of these objects are shallow, meaning that the copy will refer
3099 * to the same underlying cl_event as the original. For details, see
3100 * clRetainEvent() and clReleaseEvent().
3101 *
3102 * \see cl_event
3103 */
3104class Event : public detail::Wrapper<cl_event>
3105{
3106public:
3107 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
3108 Event() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
3109
3110 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_event - takes ownership.
3111 *
3112 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
3113 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
3114 * earlier versions.
3115 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the cl_event
3116 * into the new Event object.
3117 */
3118 explicit Event(const cl_event& event, bool retainObject = false) :
3119 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(event, retainObject) { }
3120
3121 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_event - takes ownership.
3122 *
3123 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the rhs and calls
3124 * clReleaseEvent() on the value previously held by this instance.
3125 */
3126 Event& operator = (const cl_event& rhs)
3127 {
3128 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3129 return *this;
3130 }
3131
3132 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetEventInfo().
3133 template <typename T>
3134 cl_int getInfo(cl_event_info name, T* param) const
3135 {
3136 return detail::errHandler(
3137 detail::getInfo(&::clGetEventInfo, object_, name, param),
3138 __GET_EVENT_INFO_ERR);
3139 }
3140
3141 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetEventInfo() that returns by value.
3142 template <cl_int name> typename
3143 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_event_info, name>::param_type
3144 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
3145 {
3146 typename detail::param_traits<
3147 detail::cl_event_info, name>::param_type param;
3148 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3149 if (err != NULL) {
3150 *err = result;
3151 }
3152 return param;
3153 }
3154
3155 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetEventProfilingInfo().
3156 template <typename T>
3157 cl_int getProfilingInfo(cl_profiling_info name, T* param) const
3158 {
3159 return detail::errHandler(detail::getInfo(
3160 &::clGetEventProfilingInfo, object_, name, param),
3161 __GET_EVENT_PROFILE_INFO_ERR);
3162 }
3163
3164 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetEventProfilingInfo() that returns by value.
3165 template <cl_int name> typename
3166 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_profiling_info, name>::param_type
3167 getProfilingInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
3168 {
3169 typename detail::param_traits<
3170 detail::cl_profiling_info, name>::param_type param;
3171 cl_int result = getProfilingInfo(name, &param);
3172 if (err != NULL) {
3173 *err = result;
3174 }
3175 return param;
3176 }
3177
3178 /*! \brief Blocks the calling thread until this event completes.
3179 *
3180 * Wraps clWaitForEvents().
3181 */
3182 cl_int wait() const
3183 {
3184 return detail::errHandler(
3185 ::clWaitForEvents(1, &object_),
3186 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3187 }
3188
3189#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3190 /*! \brief Registers a user callback function for a specific command execution status.
3191 *
3192 * Wraps clSetEventCallback().
3193 */
3194 cl_int setCallback(
3195 cl_int type,
3196 void (CL_CALLBACK * pfn_notify)(cl_event, cl_int, void *),
3197 void * user_data = NULL)
3198 {
3199 return detail::errHandler(
3200 ::clSetEventCallback(
3201 object_,
3202 type,
3203 pfn_notify,
3204 user_data),
3205 __SET_EVENT_CALLBACK_ERR);
3206 }
3207#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3208
3209 /*! \brief Blocks the calling thread until every event specified is complete.
3210 *
3211 * Wraps clWaitForEvents().
3212 */
3213 static cl_int
3214 waitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events)
3215 {
3216 return detail::errHandler(
3217 ::clWaitForEvents(
3218 (cl_uint) events.size(), (events.size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events.front() : NULL),
3219 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3220 }
3221};
3222
3223#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3224/*! \brief Class interface for user events (a subset of cl_event's).
3225 *
3226 * See Event for details about copy semantics, etc.
3227 */
3228class UserEvent : public Event
3229{
3230public:
3231 /*! \brief Constructs a user event on a given context.
3232 *
3233 * Wraps clCreateUserEvent().
3234 */
3235 UserEvent(
3236 const Context& context,
3237 cl_int * err = NULL)
3238 {
3239 cl_int error;
3240 object_ = ::clCreateUserEvent(
3241 context(),
3242 &error);
3243
3244 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_USER_EVENT_ERR);
3245 if (err != NULL) {
3246 *err = error;
3247 }
3248 }
3249
3250 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
3251 UserEvent() : Event() { }
3252
3253 /*! \brief Sets the execution status of a user event object.
3254 *
3255 * Wraps clSetUserEventStatus().
3256 */
3257 cl_int setStatus(cl_int status)
3258 {
3259 return detail::errHandler(
3260 ::clSetUserEventStatus(object_,status),
3261 __SET_USER_EVENT_STATUS_ERR);
3262 }
3263};
3264#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3265
3266/*! \brief Blocks the calling thread until every event specified is complete.
3267 *
3268 * Wraps clWaitForEvents().
3269 */
3270inline static cl_int
3271WaitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events)
3272{
3273 return detail::errHandler(
3274 ::clWaitForEvents(
3275 (cl_uint) events.size(), (events.size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events.front() : NULL),
3276 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3277}
3278
3279/*! \brief Class interface for cl_mem.
3280 *
3281 * \note Copies of these objects are shallow, meaning that the copy will refer
3282 * to the same underlying cl_mem as the original. For details, see
3283 * clRetainMemObject() and clReleaseMemObject().
3284 *
3285 * \see cl_mem
3286 */
3287class Memory : public detail::Wrapper<cl_mem>
3288{
3289public:
3290 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
3291 Memory() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
3292
3293 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
3294 *
3295 * Optionally transfer ownership of a refcount on the cl_mem
3296 * into the new Memory object.
3297 *
3298 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
3299 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
3300 * earlier versions.
3301 *
3302 * See Memory for further details.
3303 */
3304 explicit Memory(const cl_mem& memory, bool retainObject) :
3305 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(memory, retainObject) { }
3306
3307 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_mem - takes ownership.
3308 *
3309 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the rhs and calls
3310 * clReleaseMemObject() on the value previously held by this instance.
3311 */
3312 Memory& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
3313 {
3314 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3315 return *this;
3316 }
3317
3318 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
3319 * Required for MSVC.
3320 */
3321 Memory(const Memory& mem) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(mem) {}
3322
3323 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
3324 * Required for MSVC.
3325 */
3326 Memory& operator = (const Memory &mem)
3327 {
3328 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(mem);
3329 return *this;
3330 }
3331
3332 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
3333 * Required for MSVC.
3334 */
3335 Memory(Memory&& mem) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(mem)) {}
3336
3337 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
3338 * Required for MSVC.
3339 */
3340 Memory& operator = (Memory &&mem)
3341 {
3342 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(mem));
3343 return *this;
3344 }
3345
3346
3347 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetMemObjectInfo().
3348 template <typename T>
3349 cl_int getInfo(cl_mem_info name, T* param) const
3350 {
3351 return detail::errHandler(
3352 detail::getInfo(&::clGetMemObjectInfo, object_, name, param),
3353 __GET_MEM_OBJECT_INFO_ERR);
3354 }
3355
3356 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetMemObjectInfo() that returns by value.
3357 template <cl_int name> typename
3358 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_mem_info, name>::param_type
3359 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
3360 {
3361 typename detail::param_traits<
3362 detail::cl_mem_info, name>::param_type param;
3363 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3364 if (err != NULL) {
3365 *err = result;
3366 }
3367 return param;
3368 }
3369
3370#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3371 /*! \brief Registers a callback function to be called when the memory object
3372 * is no longer needed.
3373 *
3374 * Wraps clSetMemObjectDestructorCallback().
3375 *
3376 * Repeated calls to this function, for a given cl_mem value, will append
3377 * to the list of functions called (in reverse order) when memory object's
3378 * resources are freed and the memory object is deleted.
3379 *
3380 * \note
3381 * The registered callbacks are associated with the underlying cl_mem
3382 * value - not the Memory class instance.
3383 */
3384 cl_int setDestructorCallback(
3385 void (CL_CALLBACK * pfn_notify)(cl_mem, void *),
3386 void * user_data = NULL)
3387 {
3388 return detail::errHandler(
3389 ::clSetMemObjectDestructorCallback(
3390 object_,
3391 pfn_notify,
3392 user_data),
3393 __SET_MEM_OBJECT_DESTRUCTOR_CALLBACK_ERR);
3394 }
3395#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3396
3397};
3398
3399// Pre-declare copy functions
3400class Buffer;
3401template< typename IteratorType >
3402cl_int copy( IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );
3403template< typename IteratorType >
3404cl_int copy( const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator );
3405template< typename IteratorType >
3406cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );
3407template< typename IteratorType >
3408cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator );
3409
3410
3411#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
3412namespace detail
3413{
3414 class SVMTraitNull
3415 {
3416 public:
3417 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3418 {
3419 return 0;
3420 }
3421 };
3422} // namespace detail
3423
3424template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3425class SVMTraitReadWrite
3426{
3427public:
3428 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3429 {
3430 return CL_MEM_READ_WRITE |
3431 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3432 }
3433};
3434
3435template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3436class SVMTraitReadOnly
3437{
3438public:
3439 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3440 {
3441 return CL_MEM_READ_ONLY |
3442 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3443 }
3444};
3445
3446template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3447class SVMTraitWriteOnly
3448{
3449public:
3450 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3451 {
3452 return CL_MEM_WRITE_ONLY |
3453 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3454 }
3455};
3456
3457template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3458class SVMTraitCoarse
3459{
3460public:
3461 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3462 {
3463 return Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3464 }
3465};
3466
3467template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3468class SVMTraitFine
3469{
3470public:
3471 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3472 {
3473 return CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER |
3474 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3475 }
3476};
3477
3478template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3479class SVMTraitAtomic
3480{
3481public:
3482 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3483 {
3484 return
3485 CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER |
3486 CL_MEM_SVM_ATOMICS |
3487 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3488 }
3489};
3490
3491// Pre-declare SVM map function
3492template<typename T>
3493inline cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
3494 T* ptr,
3495 cl_bool blocking,
3496 cl_map_flags flags,
3497 size_type size,
3498 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
3499 Event* event = NULL);
3500
3501/**
3502 * STL-like allocator class for managing SVM objects provided for convenience.
3503 *
3504 * Note that while this behaves like an allocator for the purposes of constructing vectors and similar objects,
3505 * care must be taken when using with smart pointers.
3506 * The allocator should not be used to construct a unique_ptr if we are using coarse-grained SVM mode because
3507 * the coarse-grained management behaviour would behave incorrectly with respect to reference counting.
3508 *
3509 * Instead the allocator embeds a Deleter which may be used with unique_ptr and is used
3510 * with the allocate_shared and allocate_ptr supplied operations.
3511 */
3512template<typename T, class SVMTrait>
3513class SVMAllocator {
3514private:
3515 Context context_;
3516
3517public:
3518 typedef T value_type;
3519 typedef value_type* pointer;
3520 typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
3521 typedef value_type& reference;
3522 typedef const value_type& const_reference;
3523 typedef std::size_t size_type;
3524 typedef std::ptrdiff_t difference_type;
3525
3526 template<typename U>
3527 struct rebind
3528 {
3529 typedef SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> other;
3530 };
3531
3532 template<typename U, typename V>
3533 friend class SVMAllocator;
3534
3535 SVMAllocator() :
3536 context_(Context::getDefault())
3537 {
3538 }
3539
3540 explicit SVMAllocator(cl::Context context) :
3541 context_(context)
3542 {
3543 }
3544
3545
3546 SVMAllocator(const SVMAllocator &other) :
3547 context_(other.context_)
3548 {
3549 }
3550
3551 template<typename U>
3552 SVMAllocator(const SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> &other) :
3553 context_(other.context_)
3554 {
3555 }
3556
3557 ~SVMAllocator()
3558 {
3559 }
3560
3561 pointer address(reference r) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3562 {
3563 return std::addressof(r);
3564 }
3565
3566 const_pointer address(const_reference r) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3567 {
3568 return std::addressof(r);
3569 }
3570
3571 /**
3572 * Allocate an SVM pointer.
3573 *
3574 * If the allocator is coarse-grained, this will take ownership to allow
3575 * containers to correctly construct data in place.
3576 */
3577 pointer allocate(
3578 size_type size,
3579 typename cl::SVMAllocator<void, SVMTrait>::const_pointer = 0)
3580 {
3581 // Allocate memory with default alignment matching the size of the type
3582 void* voidPointer =
3583 clSVMAlloc(
3584 context_(),
3585 SVMTrait::getSVMMemFlags(),
3586 size*sizeof(T),
3587 0);
3588 pointer retValue = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(
3589 voidPointer);
3590#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3591 if (!retValue) {
3592 std::bad_alloc excep;
3593 throw excep;
3594 }
3595#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3596
3597 // If allocation was coarse-grained then map it
3598 if (!(SVMTrait::getSVMMemFlags() & CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER)) {
3599 cl_int err = enqueueMapSVM(retValue, CL_TRUE, CL_MAP_READ | CL_MAP_WRITE, size*sizeof(T));
3600 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3601 std::bad_alloc excep;
3602 throw excep;
3603 }
3604 }
3605
3606 // If exceptions disabled, return null pointer from allocator
3607 return retValue;
3608 }
3609
3610 void deallocate(pointer p, size_type)
3611 {
3612 clSVMFree(context_(), p);
3613 }
3614
3615 /**
3616 * Return the maximum possible allocation size.
3617 * This is the minimum of the maximum sizes of all devices in the context.
3618 */
3619 size_type max_size() const CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3620 {
3621 size_type maxSize = std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max() / sizeof(T);
3622
3623 for (const Device &d : context_.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()) {
3624 maxSize = std::min(
3625 maxSize,
3626 static_cast<size_type>(d.getInfo<CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE>()));
3627 }
3628
3629 return maxSize;
3630 }
3631
3632 template< class U, class... Args >
3633 void construct(U* p, Args&&... args)
3634 {
3635 new(p)T(args...);
3636 }
3637
3638 template< class U >
3639 void destroy(U* p)
3640 {
3641 p->~U();
3642 }
3643
3644 /**
3645 * Returns true if the contexts match.
3646 */
3647 inline bool operator==(SVMAllocator const& rhs)
3648 {
3649 return (context_==rhs.context_);
3650 }
3651
3652 inline bool operator!=(SVMAllocator const& a)
3653 {
3654 return !operator==(a);
3655 }
3656}; // class SVMAllocator return cl::pointer<T>(tmp, detail::Deleter<T, Alloc>{alloc, copies});
3657
3658
3659template<class SVMTrait>
3660class SVMAllocator<void, SVMTrait> {
3661public:
3662 typedef void value_type;
3663 typedef value_type* pointer;
3664 typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
3665
3666 template<typename U>
3667 struct rebind
3668 {
3669 typedef SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> other;
3670 };
3671
3672 template<typename U, typename V>
3673 friend class SVMAllocator;
3674};
3675
3676#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
3677namespace detail
3678{
3679 template<class Alloc>
3680 class Deleter {
3681 private:
3682 Alloc alloc_;
3683 size_type copies_;
3684
3685 public:
3686 typedef typename std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::pointer pointer;
3687
3688 Deleter(const Alloc &alloc, size_type copies) : alloc_{ alloc }, copies_{ copies }
3689 {
3690 }
3691
3692 void operator()(pointer ptr) const {
3693 Alloc tmpAlloc{ alloc_ };
3694 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::destroy(tmpAlloc, std::addressof(*ptr));
3695 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::deallocate(tmpAlloc, ptr, copies_);
3696 }
3697 };
3698} // namespace detail
3699
3700/**
3701 * Allocation operation compatible with std::allocate_ptr.
3702 * Creates a unique_ptr<T> by default.
3703 * This requirement is to ensure that the control block is not
3704 * allocated in memory inaccessible to the host.
3705 */
3706template <class T, class Alloc, class... Args>
3707cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<Alloc>> allocate_pointer(const Alloc &alloc_, Args&&... args)
3708{
3709 Alloc alloc(alloc_);
3710 static const size_type copies = 1;
3711
3712 // Ensure that creation of the management block and the
3713 // object are dealt with separately such that we only provide a deleter
3714
3715 T* tmp = std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::allocate(alloc, copies);
3716 if (!tmp) {
3717 std::bad_alloc excep;
3718 throw excep;
3719 }
3720 try {
3721 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::construct(
3722 alloc,
3723 std::addressof(*tmp),
3724 std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3725
3726 return cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<Alloc>>(tmp, detail::Deleter<Alloc>{alloc, copies});
3727 }
3728 catch (std::bad_alloc b)
3729 {
3730 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::deallocate(alloc, tmp, copies);
3731 throw;
3732 }
3733}
3734
3735template< class T, class SVMTrait, class... Args >
3736cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait>>> allocate_svm(Args... args)
3737{
3738 SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait> alloc;
3739 return cl::allocate_pointer<T>(alloc, args...);
3740}
3741
3742template< class T, class SVMTrait, class... Args >
3743cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait>>> allocate_svm(const cl::Context &c, Args... args)
3744{
3745 SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait> alloc(c);
3746 return cl::allocate_pointer<T>(alloc, args...);
3747}
3748#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
3749
3750/*! \brief Vector alias to simplify contruction of coarse-grained SVM containers.
3751 *
3752 */
3753template < class T >
3754using coarse_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<>>>;
3755
3756/*! \brief Vector alias to simplify contruction of fine-grained SVM containers.
3757*
3758*/
3759template < class T >
3760using fine_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitFine<>>>;
3761
3762/*! \brief Vector alias to simplify contruction of fine-grained SVM containers that support platform atomics.
3763*
3764*/
3765template < class T >
3766using atomic_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitAtomic<>>>;
3767
3768#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
3769
3770
3771/*! \brief Class interface for Buffer Memory Objects.
3772 *
3773 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
3774 *
3775 * \see Memory
3776 */
3777class Buffer : public Memory
3778{
3779public:
3780
3781 /*! \brief Constructs a Buffer in a specified context.
3782 *
3783 * Wraps clCreateBuffer().
3784 *
3785 * \param host_ptr Storage to be used if the CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR flag was
3786 * specified. Note alignment & exclusivity requirements.
3787 */
3788 Buffer(
3789 const Context& context,
3790 cl_mem_flags flags,
3791 size_type size,
3792 void* host_ptr = NULL,
3793 cl_int* err = NULL)
3794 {
3795 cl_int error;
3796 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, host_ptr, &error);
3797
3798 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3799 if (err != NULL) {
3800 *err = error;
3801 }
3802 }
3803
3804 /*! \brief Constructs a Buffer in the default context.
3805 *
3806 * Wraps clCreateBuffer().
3807 *
3808 * \param host_ptr Storage to be used if the CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR flag was
3809 * specified. Note alignment & exclusivity requirements.
3810 *
3811 * \see Context::getDefault()
3812 */
3813 Buffer(
3814 cl_mem_flags flags,
3815 size_type size,
3816 void* host_ptr = NULL,
3817 cl_int* err = NULL)
3818 {
3819 cl_int error;
3820
3821 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
3822
3823 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, host_ptr, &error);
3824
3825 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3826 if (err != NULL) {
3827 *err = error;
3828 }
3829 }
3830
3831 /*!
3832 * \brief Construct a Buffer from a host container via iterators.
3833 * IteratorType must be random access.
3834 * If useHostPtr is specified iterators must represent contiguous data.
3835 */
3836 template< typename IteratorType >
3837 Buffer(
3838 IteratorType startIterator,
3839 IteratorType endIterator,
3840 bool readOnly,
3841 bool useHostPtr = false,
3842 cl_int* err = NULL)
3843 {
3844 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
3845 cl_int error;
3846
3847 cl_mem_flags flags = 0;
3848 if( readOnly ) {
3849 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_ONLY;
3850 }
3851 else {
3852 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_WRITE;
3853 }
3854 if( useHostPtr ) {
3855 flags |= CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR;
3856 }
3857
3858 size_type size = sizeof(DataType)*(endIterator - startIterator);
3859
3860 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
3861
3862 if( useHostPtr ) {
3863 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, static_cast<DataType*>(&*startIterator), &error);
3864 } else {
3865 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, 0, &error);
3866 }
3867
3868 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3869 if (err != NULL) {
3870 *err = error;
3871 }
3872
3873 if( !useHostPtr ) {
3874 error = cl::copy(startIterator, endIterator, *this);
3875 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3876 if (err != NULL) {
3877 *err = error;
3878 }
3879 }
3880 }
3881
3882 /*!
3883 * \brief Construct a Buffer from a host container via iterators using a specified context.
3884 * IteratorType must be random access.
3885 * If useHostPtr is specified iterators must represent contiguous data.
3886 */
3887 template< typename IteratorType >
3888 Buffer(const Context &context, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator,
3889 bool readOnly, bool useHostPtr = false, cl_int* err = NULL);
3890
3891 /*!
3892 * \brief Construct a Buffer from a host container via iterators using a specified queue.
3893 * If useHostPtr is specified iterators must be random access.
3894 */
3895 template< typename IteratorType >
3896 Buffer(const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator,
3897 bool readOnly, bool useHostPtr = false, cl_int* err = NULL);
3898
3899 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
3900 Buffer() : Memory() { }
3901
3902 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
3903 *
3904 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
3905 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with earlier versions.
3906 *
3907 * See Memory for further details.
3908 */
3909 explicit Buffer(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
3910 Memory(buffer, retainObject) { }
3911
3912 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
3913 *
3914 * See Memory for further details.
3915 */
3916 Buffer& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
3917 {
3918 Memory::operator=(rhs);
3919 return *this;
3920 }
3921
3922 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
3923 * Required for MSVC.
3924 */
3925 Buffer(const Buffer& buf) : Memory(buf) {}
3926
3927 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
3928 * Required for MSVC.
3929 */
3930 Buffer& operator = (const Buffer &buf)
3931 {
3932 Memory::operator=(buf);
3933 return *this;
3934 }
3935
3936 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
3937 * Required for MSVC.
3938 */
3939 Buffer(Buffer&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Memory(std::move(buf)) {}
3940
3941 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
3942 * Required for MSVC.
3943 */
3944 Buffer& operator = (Buffer &&buf)
3945 {
3946 Memory::operator=(std::move(buf));
3947 return *this;
3948 }
3949
3950#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3951 /*! \brief Creates a new buffer object from this.
3952 *
3953 * Wraps clCreateSubBuffer().
3954 */
3955 Buffer createSubBuffer(
3956 cl_mem_flags flags,
3957 cl_buffer_create_type buffer_create_type,
3958 const void * buffer_create_info,
3959 cl_int * err = NULL)
3960 {
3961 Buffer result;
3962 cl_int error;
3963 result.object_ = ::clCreateSubBuffer(
3964 object_,
3965 flags,
3966 buffer_create_type,
3967 buffer_create_info,
3968 &error);
3969
3970 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_SUBBUFFER_ERR);
3971 if (err != NULL) {
3972 *err = error;
3973 }
3974
3975 return result;
3976 }
3977#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
3978};
3979
3980#if defined (CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
3981/*! \brief Class interface for creating OpenCL buffers from ID3D10Buffer's.
3982 *
3983 * This is provided to facilitate interoperability with Direct3D.
3984 *
3985 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
3986 *
3987 * \see Memory
3988 */
3989class BufferD3D10 : public Buffer
3990{
3991public:
3992
3993
3994 /*! \brief Constructs a BufferD3D10, in a specified context, from a
3995 * given ID3D10Buffer.
3996 *
3997 * Wraps clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR().
3998 */
3999 BufferD3D10(
4000 const Context& context,
4001 cl_mem_flags flags,
4002 ID3D10Buffer* bufobj,
4003 cl_int * err = NULL) : pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR(nullptr)
4004 {
4005 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_mem (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR)(
4006 cl_context context, cl_mem_flags flags, ID3D10Buffer* buffer,
4007 cl_int* errcode_ret);
4008 PFN_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR;
4009#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4010 vector<cl_context_properties> props = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_PROPERTIES>();
4011 cl_platform platform = -1;
4012 for( int i = 0; i < props.size(); ++i ) {
4013 if( props[i] == CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM ) {
4014 platform = props[i+1];
4015 }
4016 }
4017 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR);
4018#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
4019 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR);
4020#endif
4021
4022 cl_int error;
4023 object_ = pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR(
4024 context(),
4025 flags,
4026 bufobj,
4027 &error);
4028
4029 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_BUFFER_ERR);
4030 if (err != NULL) {
4031 *err = error;
4032 }
4033 }
4034
4035 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4036 BufferD3D10() : Buffer() { }
4037
4038 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4039 *
4040 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4041 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4042 * earlier versions.
4043 * See Memory for further details.
4044 */
4045 explicit BufferD3D10(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
4046 Buffer(buffer, retainObject) { }
4047
4048 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4049 *
4050 * See Memory for further details.
4051 */
4052 BufferD3D10& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4053 {
4054 Buffer::operator=(rhs);
4055 return *this;
4056 }
4057
4058 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4059 * Required for MSVC.
4060 */
4061 BufferD3D10(const BufferD3D10& buf) :
4062 Buffer(buf) {}
4063
4064 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4065 * Required for MSVC.
4066 */
4067 BufferD3D10& operator = (const BufferD3D10 &buf)
4068 {
4069 Buffer::operator=(buf);
4070 return *this;
4071 }
4072
4073 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4074 * Required for MSVC.
4075 */
4076 BufferD3D10(BufferD3D10&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Buffer(std::move(buf)) {}
4077
4078 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4079 * Required for MSVC.
4080 */
4081 BufferD3D10& operator = (BufferD3D10 &&buf)
4082 {
4083 Buffer::operator=(std::move(buf));
4084 return *this;
4085 }
4086};
4087#endif
4088
4089/*! \brief Class interface for GL Buffer Memory Objects.
4090 *
4091 * This is provided to facilitate interoperability with OpenGL.
4092 *
4093 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4094 *
4095 * \see Memory
4096 */
4097class BufferGL : public Buffer
4098{
4099public:
4100 /*! \brief Constructs a BufferGL in a specified context, from a given
4101 * GL buffer.
4102 *
4103 * Wraps clCreateFromGLBuffer().
4104 */
4105 BufferGL(
4106 const Context& context,
4107 cl_mem_flags flags,
4108 cl_GLuint bufobj,
4109 cl_int * err = NULL)
4110 {
4111 cl_int error;
4112 object_ = ::clCreateFromGLBuffer(
4113 context(),
4114 flags,
4115 bufobj,
4116 &error);
4117
4118 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_BUFFER_ERR);
4119 if (err != NULL) {
4120 *err = error;
4121 }
4122 }
4123
4124 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4125 BufferGL() : Buffer() { }
4126
4127 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4128 *
4129 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4130 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4131 * earlier versions.
4132 * See Memory for further details.
4133 */
4134 explicit BufferGL(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
4135 Buffer(buffer, retainObject) { }
4136
4137 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4138 *
4139 * See Memory for further details.
4140 */
4141 BufferGL& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4142 {
4143 Buffer::operator=(rhs);
4144 return *this;
4145 }
4146
4147 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4148 * Required for MSVC.
4149 */
4150 BufferGL(const BufferGL& buf) : Buffer(buf) {}
4151
4152 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4153 * Required for MSVC.
4154 */
4155 BufferGL& operator = (const BufferGL &buf)
4156 {
4157 Buffer::operator=(buf);
4158 return *this;
4159 }
4160
4161 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4162 * Required for MSVC.
4163 */
4164 BufferGL(BufferGL&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Buffer(std::move(buf)) {}
4165
4166 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4167 * Required for MSVC.
4168 */
4169 BufferGL& operator = (BufferGL &&buf)
4170 {
4171 Buffer::operator=(std::move(buf));
4172 return *this;
4173 }
4174
4175 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetGLObjectInfo().
4176 cl_int getObjectInfo(
4177 cl_gl_object_type *type,
4178 cl_GLuint * gl_object_name)
4179 {
4180 return detail::errHandler(
4181 ::clGetGLObjectInfo(object_,type,gl_object_name),
4182 __GET_GL_OBJECT_INFO_ERR);
4183 }
4184};
4185
4186/*! \brief Class interface for GL Render Buffer Memory Objects.
4187 *
4188 * This is provided to facilitate interoperability with OpenGL.
4189 *
4190 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4191 *
4192 * \see Memory
4193 */
4194class BufferRenderGL : public Buffer
4195{
4196public:
4197 /*! \brief Constructs a BufferRenderGL in a specified context, from a given
4198 * GL Renderbuffer.
4199 *
4200 * Wraps clCreateFromGLRenderbuffer().
4201 */
4202 BufferRenderGL(
4203 const Context& context,
4204 cl_mem_flags flags,
4205 cl_GLuint bufobj,
4206 cl_int * err = NULL)
4207 {
4208 cl_int error;

4210 context(),
4211 flags,
4212 bufobj,
4213 &error);
4214
4215 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_RENDER_BUFFER_ERR);
4216 if (err != NULL) {
4217 *err = error;
4218 }
4219 }
4220
4221 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4222 BufferRenderGL() : Buffer() { }
4223
4224 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4225 *
4226 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4227 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4228 * earlier versions.

4230 */
4231 explicit BufferRenderGL(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
4232 Buffer(buffer, retainObject) { }
4233

4235 *
4236 * See Memory for further details.
4237 */

4239 {
4240 Buffer::operator=(rhs);
4241 return *this;
4242 }
4243
4244 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4245 * Required for MSVC.
4246 */
4247 BufferRenderGL(const BufferRenderGL& buf) : Buffer(buf) {}
4248
4249 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4250 * Required for MSVC.
4251 */

4253 {
4254 Buffer::operator=(buf);
4255 return *this;
4256 }
4257

4259 * Required for MSVC.
4260 */
4261 BufferRenderGL(BufferRenderGL&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Buffer(std::move(buf)) {}
4262
4263 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4264 * Required for MSVC.
4265 */
4266 BufferRenderGL& operator = (BufferRenderGL &&buf)
4267 {
4268 Buffer::operator=(std::move(buf));
4269 return *this;
4270 }
4271
4272 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetGLObjectInfo().
4273 cl_int getObjectInfo(
4274 cl_gl_object_type *type,
4275 cl_GLuint * gl_object_name)
4276 {
