4277 return detail::errHandler(
4278 ::clGetGLObjectInfo(object_,type,gl_object_name),
4279 __GET_GL_OBJECT_INFO_ERR);
4280 }
4281};
4282
4283/*! \brief C++ base class for Image Memory objects.
4284 *
4285 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4286 *
4287 * \see Memory
4288 */
4289class Image : public Memory
4290{
4291protected:
4292 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4293 Image() : Memory() { }
4294
4295 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4296 *
4297 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4298 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4299 * earlier versions.
4300 * See Memory for further details.
4301 */
4302 explicit Image(const cl_mem& image, bool retainObject = false) :
4303 Memory(image, retainObject) { }
4304
4305 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4306 *
4307 * See Memory for further details.
4308 */
4309 Image& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4310 {
4311 Memory::operator=(rhs);
4312 return *this;
4313 }
4314
4315 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4316 * Required for MSVC.
4317 */
4318 Image(const Image& img) : Memory(img) {}
4319
4320 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4321 * Required for MSVC.
4322 */
4323 Image& operator = (const Image &img)
4324 {
4325 Memory::operator=(img);
4326 return *this;
4327 }
4328
4329 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4330 * Required for MSVC.
4331 */
4332 Image(Image&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Memory(std::move(img)) {}
4333
4334 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4335 * Required for MSVC.
4336 */
4337 Image& operator = (Image &&img)
4338 {
4339 Memory::operator=(std::move(img));
4340 return *this;
4341 }
4342
4343
4344public:
4345 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetImageInfo().
4346 template <typename T>
4347 cl_int getImageInfo(cl_image_info name, T* param) const
4348 {
4349 return detail::errHandler(
4350 detail::getInfo(&::clGetImageInfo, object_, name, param),
4351 __GET_IMAGE_INFO_ERR);
4352 }
4353
4354 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetImageInfo() that returns by value.
4355 template <cl_int name> typename
4356 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_image_info, name>::param_type
4357 getImageInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
4358 {
4359 typename detail::param_traits<
4360 detail::cl_image_info, name>::param_type param;
4361 cl_int result = getImageInfo(name, &param);
4362 if (err != NULL) {
4363 *err = result;
4364 }
4365 return param;
4366 }
4367};
4368
4369#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4370/*! \brief Class interface for 1D Image Memory objects.
4371 *
4372 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4373 *
4374 * \see Memory
4375 */
4376class Image1D : public Image
4377{
4378public:
4379 /*! \brief Constructs a 1D Image in a specified context.
4380 *
4381 * Wraps clCreateImage().
4382 */
4383 Image1D(
4384 const Context& context,
4385 cl_mem_flags flags,
4386 ImageFormat format,
4387 size_type width,
4388 void* host_ptr = NULL,
4389 cl_int* err = NULL)
4390 {
4391 cl_int error;
4392 cl_image_desc desc =
4393 {
4394 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE1D,
4395 width,
4396 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0
4397 };
4398 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4399 context(),
4400 flags,
4401 &format,
4402 &desc,
4403 host_ptr,
4404 &error);
4405
4406 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4407 if (err != NULL) {
4408 *err = error;
4409 }
4410 }
4411
4412 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4413 Image1D() { }
4414
4415 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4416 *
4417 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4418 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4419 * earlier versions.
4420 * See Memory for further details.
4421 */
4422 explicit Image1D(const cl_mem& image1D, bool retainObject = false) :
4423 Image(image1D, retainObject) { }
4424
4425 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4426 *
4427 * See Memory for further details.
4428 */
4429 Image1D& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4430 {
4431 Image::operator=(rhs);
4432 return *this;
4433 }
4434
4435 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4436 * Required for MSVC.
4437 */
4438 Image1D(const Image1D& img) : Image(img) {}
4439
4440 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4441 * Required for MSVC.
4442 */
4443 Image1D& operator = (const Image1D &img)
4444 {
4445 Image::operator=(img);
4446 return *this;
4447 }
4448
4449 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4450 * Required for MSVC.
4451 */
4452 Image1D(Image1D&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
4453
4454 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4455 * Required for MSVC.
4456 */
4457 Image1D& operator = (Image1D &&img)
4458 {
4459 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
4460 return *this;
4461 }
4462
4463};
4464
4465/*! \class Image1DBuffer
4466 * \brief Image interface for 1D buffer images.
4467 */
4468class Image1DBuffer : public Image
4469{
4470public:
4471 Image1DBuffer(
4472 const Context& context,
4473 cl_mem_flags flags,
4474 ImageFormat format,
4475 size_type width,
4476 const Buffer &buffer,
4477 cl_int* err = NULL)
4478 {
4479 cl_int error;
4480 cl_image_desc desc =
4481 {
4482 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE1D_BUFFER,
4483 width,
4484 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0,
4485 buffer()
4486 };
4487 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4488 context(),
4489 flags,
4490 &format,
4491 &desc,
4492 NULL,
4493 &error);
4494
4495 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4496 if (err != NULL) {
4497 *err = error;
4498 }
4499 }
4500
4501 Image1DBuffer() { }
4502
4503 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4504 *
4505 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4506 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4507 * earlier versions.
4508 * See Memory for further details.
4509 */
4510 explicit Image1DBuffer(const cl_mem& image1D, bool retainObject = false) :
4511 Image(image1D, retainObject) { }
4512
4513 Image1DBuffer& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4514 {
4515 Image::operator=(rhs);
4516 return *this;
4517 }
4518
4519 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4520 * Required for MSVC.
4521 */
4522 Image1DBuffer(const Image1DBuffer& img) : Image(img) {}
4523
4524 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4525 * Required for MSVC.
4526 */
4527 Image1DBuffer& operator = (const Image1DBuffer &img)
4528 {
4529 Image::operator=(img);
4530 return *this;
4531 }
4532
4533 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4534 * Required for MSVC.
4535 */
4536 Image1DBuffer(Image1DBuffer&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
4537
4538 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4539 * Required for MSVC.
4540 */
4541 Image1DBuffer& operator = (Image1DBuffer &&img)
4542 {
4543 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
4544 return *this;
4545 }
4546
4547};
4548
4549/*! \class Image1DArray
4550 * \brief Image interface for arrays of 1D images.
4551 */
4552class Image1DArray : public Image
4553{
4554public:
4555 Image1DArray(
4556 const Context& context,
4557 cl_mem_flags flags,
4558 ImageFormat format,
4559 size_type arraySize,
4560 size_type width,
4561 size_type rowPitch,
4562 void* host_ptr = NULL,
4563 cl_int* err = NULL)
4564 {
4565 cl_int error;
4566 cl_image_desc desc =
4567 {
4568 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE1D_ARRAY,
4569 width,
4570 0, 0, // height, depth (unused)
4571 arraySize,
4572 rowPitch,
4573 0, 0, 0, 0
4574 };
4575 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4576 context(),
4577 flags,
4578 &format,
4579 &desc,
4580 host_ptr,
4581 &error);
4582
4583 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4584 if (err != NULL) {
4585 *err = error;
4586 }
4587 }
4588
4589 Image1DArray() { }
4590
4591 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4592 *
4593 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4594 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4595 * earlier versions.
4596 * See Memory for further details.
4597 */
4598 explicit Image1DArray(const cl_mem& imageArray, bool retainObject = false) :
4599 Image(imageArray, retainObject) { }
4600
4601
4602 Image1DArray& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4603 {
4604 Image::operator=(rhs);
4605 return *this;
4606 }
4607
4608 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4609 * Required for MSVC.
4610 */
4611 Image1DArray(const Image1DArray& img) : Image(img) {}
4612
4613 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4614 * Required for MSVC.
4615 */
4616 Image1DArray& operator = (const Image1DArray &img)
4617 {
4618 Image::operator=(img);
4619 return *this;
4620 }
4621
4622 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4623 * Required for MSVC.
4624 */
4625 Image1DArray(Image1DArray&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
4626
4627 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4628 * Required for MSVC.
4629 */
4630 Image1DArray& operator = (Image1DArray &&img)
4631 {
4632 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
4633 return *this;
4634 }
4635
4636};
4637#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4638
4639
4640/*! \brief Class interface for 2D Image Memory objects.
4641 *
4642 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4643 *
4644 * \see Memory
4645 */
4646class Image2D : public Image
4647{
4648public:
4649 /*! \brief Constructs a 2D Image in a specified context.
4650 *
4651 * Wraps clCreateImage().
4652 */
4653 Image2D(
4654 const Context& context,
4655 cl_mem_flags flags,
4656 ImageFormat format,
4657 size_type width,
4658 size_type height,
4659 size_type row_pitch = 0,
4660 void* host_ptr = NULL,
4661 cl_int* err = NULL)
4662 {
4663 cl_int error;
4664 bool useCreateImage;
4665
4666#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
4667 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
4668 {
4669 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
4670 useCreateImage = (version >= 0x10002); // OpenCL 1.2 or above
4671 }
4672#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4673 useCreateImage = true;
4674#else
4675 useCreateImage = false;
4676#endif
4677
4678#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4679 if (useCreateImage)
4680 {
4681 cl_image_desc desc =
4682 {
4683 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE2D,
4684 width,
4685 height,
4686 0, 0, // depth, array size (unused)
4687 row_pitch,
4688 0, 0, 0, 0
4689 };
4690 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4691 context(),
4692 flags,
4693 &format,
4694 &desc,
4695 host_ptr,
4696 &error);
4697
4698 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4699 if (err != NULL) {
4700 *err = error;
4701 }
4702 }
4703#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4704#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
4705 if (!useCreateImage)
4706 {
4707 object_ = ::clCreateImage2D(
4708 context(), flags,&format, width, height, row_pitch, host_ptr, &error);
4709
4710 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE2D_ERR);
4711 if (err != NULL) {
4712 *err = error;
4713 }
4714 }
4715#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
4716 }
4717
4718#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 || defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_IMAGE2D_FROM_BUFFER_KHR)
4719 /*! \brief Constructs a 2D Image from a buffer.
4720 * \note This will share storage with the underlying buffer.
4721 *
4722 * Wraps clCreateImage().
4723 */
4724 Image2D(
4725 const Context& context,
4726 ImageFormat format,
4727 const Buffer &sourceBuffer,
4728 size_type width,
4729 size_type height,
4730 size_type row_pitch = 0,
4731 cl_int* err = nullptr)
4732 {
4733 cl_int error;
4734
4735 cl_image_desc desc =
4736 {
4737 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE2D,
4738 width,
4739 height,
4740 0, 0, // depth, array size (unused)
4741 row_pitch,
4742 0, 0, 0,
4743 // Use buffer as input to image
4744 sourceBuffer()
4745 };
4746 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4747 context(),
4748 0, // flags inherited from buffer
4749 &format,
4750 &desc,
4751 nullptr,
4752 &error);
4753
4754 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4755 if (err != nullptr) {
4756 *err = error;
4757 }
4758 }
4759#endif //#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 || defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_IMAGE2D_FROM_BUFFER_KHR)
4760
4761#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
4762 /*! \brief Constructs a 2D Image from an image.
4763 * \note This will share storage with the underlying image but may
4764 * reinterpret the channel order and type.
4765 *
4766 * The image will be created matching with a descriptor matching the source.
4767 *
4768 * \param order is the channel order to reinterpret the image data as.
4769 * The channel order may differ as described in the OpenCL
4770 * 2.0 API specification.
4771 *
4772 * Wraps clCreateImage().
4773 */
4774 Image2D(
4775 const Context& context,
4776 cl_channel_order order,
4777 const Image &sourceImage,
4778 cl_int* err = nullptr)
4779 {
4780 cl_int error;
4781
4782 // Descriptor fields have to match source image
4783 size_type sourceWidth =
4784 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_WIDTH>();
4785 size_type sourceHeight =
4786 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_HEIGHT>();
4787 size_type sourceRowPitch =
4788 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_ROW_PITCH>();
4789 cl_uint sourceNumMIPLevels =
4790 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_NUM_MIP_LEVELS>();
4791 cl_uint sourceNumSamples =
4792 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_NUM_SAMPLES>();
4793 cl_image_format sourceFormat =
4794 sourceImage.getImageInfo<CL_IMAGE_FORMAT>();
4795
4796 // Update only the channel order.
4797 // Channel format inherited from source.
4798 sourceFormat.image_channel_order = order;
4799 cl_image_desc desc =
4800 {
4801 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE2D,
4802 sourceWidth,
4803 sourceHeight,
4804 0, 0, // depth (unused), array size (unused)
4805 sourceRowPitch,
4806 0, // slice pitch (unused)
4807 sourceNumMIPLevels,
4808 sourceNumSamples,
4809 // Use buffer as input to image
4810 sourceImage()
4811 };
4812 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4813 context(),
4814 0, // flags should be inherited from mem_object
4815 &sourceFormat,
4816 &desc,
4817 nullptr,
4818 &error);
4819
4820 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4821 if (err != nullptr) {
4822 *err = error;
4823 }
4824 }
4825#endif //#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
4826
4827 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4828 Image2D() { }
4829
4830 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4831 *
4832 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4833 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4834 * earlier versions.
4835 * See Memory for further details.
4836 */
4837 explicit Image2D(const cl_mem& image2D, bool retainObject = false) :
4838 Image(image2D, retainObject) { }
4839
4840 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4841 *
4842 * See Memory for further details.
4843 */
4844 Image2D& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4845 {
4846 Image::operator=(rhs);
4847 return *this;
4848 }
4849
4850 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4851 * Required for MSVC.
4852 */
4853 Image2D(const Image2D& img) : Image(img) {}
4854
4855 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4856 * Required for MSVC.
4857 */
4858 Image2D& operator = (const Image2D &img)
4859 {
4860 Image::operator=(img);
4861 return *this;
4862 }
4863
4864 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4865 * Required for MSVC.
4866 */
4867 Image2D(Image2D&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
4868
4869 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4870 * Required for MSVC.
4871 */
4872 Image2D& operator = (Image2D &&img)
4873 {
4874 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
4875 return *this;
4876 }
4877
4878};
4879
4880
4881#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
4882/*! \brief Class interface for GL 2D Image Memory objects.
4883 *
4884 * This is provided to facilitate interoperability with OpenGL.
4885 *
4886 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
4887 *
4888 * \see Memory
4889 * \note Deprecated for OpenCL 1.2. Please use ImageGL instead.
4890 */
4891class CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED Image2DGL : public Image2D
4892{
4893public:
4894 /*! \brief Constructs an Image2DGL in a specified context, from a given
4895 * GL Texture.
4896 *
4897 * Wraps clCreateFromGLTexture2D().
4898 */
4899 Image2DGL(
4900 const Context& context,
4901 cl_mem_flags flags,
4902 cl_GLenum target,
4903 cl_GLint miplevel,
4904 cl_GLuint texobj,
4905 cl_int * err = NULL)
4906 {
4907 cl_int error;
4908 object_ = ::clCreateFromGLTexture2D(
4909 context(),
4910 flags,
4911 target,
4912 miplevel,
4913 texobj,
4914 &error);
4915
4916 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_TEXTURE_2D_ERR);
4917 if (err != NULL) {
4918 *err = error;
4919 }
4920
4921 }
4922
4923 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
4924 Image2DGL() : Image2D() { }
4925
4926 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
4927 *
4928 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
4929 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
4930 * earlier versions.
4931 * See Memory for further details.
4932 */
4933 explicit Image2DGL(const cl_mem& image, bool retainObject = false) :
4934 Image2D(image, retainObject) { }
4935
4936 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
4937 *c
4938 * See Memory for further details.
4939 */
4940 Image2DGL& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4941 {
4942 Image2D::operator=(rhs);
4943 return *this;
4944 }
4945
4946 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4947 * Required for MSVC.
4948 */
4949 Image2DGL(const Image2DGL& img) : Image2D(img) {}
4950
4951 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
4952 * Required for MSVC.
4953 */
4954 Image2DGL& operator = (const Image2DGL &img)
4955 {
4956 Image2D::operator=(img);
4957 return *this;
4958 }
4959
4960 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4961 * Required for MSVC.
4962 */
4963 Image2DGL(Image2DGL&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image2D(std::move(img)) {}
4964
4965 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
4966 * Required for MSVC.
4967 */
4968 Image2DGL& operator = (Image2DGL &&img)
4969 {
4970 Image2D::operator=(std::move(img));
4971 return *this;
4972 }
4973
4974} CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED;
4975#endif // CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
4976
4977#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4978/*! \class Image2DArray
4979 * \brief Image interface for arrays of 2D images.
4980 */
4981class Image2DArray : public Image
4982{
4983public:
4984 Image2DArray(
4985 const Context& context,
4986 cl_mem_flags flags,
4987 ImageFormat format,
4988 size_type arraySize,
4989 size_type width,
4990 size_type height,
4991 size_type rowPitch,
4992 size_type slicePitch,
4993 void* host_ptr = NULL,
4994 cl_int* err = NULL)
4995 {
4996 cl_int error;
4997 cl_image_desc desc =
4998 {
4999 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE2D_ARRAY,
5000 width,
5001 height,
5002 0, // depth (unused)
5003 arraySize,
5004 rowPitch,
5005 slicePitch,
5006 0, 0, 0
5007 };
5008 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
5009 context(),
5010 flags,
5011 &format,
5012 &desc,
5013 host_ptr,
5014 &error);
5015
5016 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
5017 if (err != NULL) {
5018 *err = error;
5019 }
5020 }
5021
5022 Image2DArray() { }
5023
5024 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
5025 *
5026 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5027 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5028 * earlier versions.
5029 * See Memory for further details.
5030 */
5031 explicit Image2DArray(const cl_mem& imageArray, bool retainObject = false) : Image(imageArray, retainObject) { }
5032
5033 Image2DArray& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
5034 {
5035 Image::operator=(rhs);
5036 return *this;
5037 }
5038
5039 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5040 * Required for MSVC.
5041 */
5042 Image2DArray(const Image2DArray& img) : Image(img) {}
5043
5044 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5045 * Required for MSVC.
5046 */
5047 Image2DArray& operator = (const Image2DArray &img)
5048 {
5049 Image::operator=(img);
5050 return *this;
5051 }
5052
5053 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5054 * Required for MSVC.
5055 */
5056 Image2DArray(Image2DArray&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
5057
5058 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5059 * Required for MSVC.
5060 */
5061 Image2DArray& operator = (Image2DArray &&img)
5062 {
5063 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
5064 return *this;
5065 }
5066};
5067#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5068
5069/*! \brief Class interface for 3D Image Memory objects.
5070 *
5071 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
5072 *
5073 * \see Memory
5074 */
5075class Image3D : public Image
5076{
5077public:
5078 /*! \brief Constructs a 3D Image in a specified context.
5079 *
5080 * Wraps clCreateImage().
5081 */
5082 Image3D(
5083 const Context& context,
5084 cl_mem_flags flags,
5085 ImageFormat format,
5086 size_type width,
5087 size_type height,
5088 size_type depth,
5089 size_type row_pitch = 0,
5090 size_type slice_pitch = 0,
5091 void* host_ptr = NULL,
5092 cl_int* err = NULL)
5093 {
5094 cl_int error;
5095 bool useCreateImage;
5096
5097#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
5098 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
5099 {
5100 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
5101 useCreateImage = (version >= 0x10002); // OpenCL 1.2 or above
5102 }
5103#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5104 useCreateImage = true;
5105#else
5106 useCreateImage = false;
5107#endif
5108
5109#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5110 if (useCreateImage)
5111 {
5112 cl_image_desc desc =
5113 {
5114 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE3D,
5115 width,
5116 height,
5117 depth,
5118 0, // array size (unused)
5119 row_pitch,
5120 slice_pitch,
5121 0, 0, 0
5122 };
5123 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
5124 context(),
5125 flags,
5126 &format,
5127 &desc,
5128 host_ptr,
5129 &error);
5130
5131 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
5132 if (err != NULL) {
5133 *err = error;
5134 }
5135 }
5136#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5137#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
5138 if (!useCreateImage)
5139 {
5140 object_ = ::clCreateImage3D(
5141 context(), flags, &format, width, height, depth, row_pitch,
5142 slice_pitch, host_ptr, &error);
5143
5144 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE3D_ERR);
5145 if (err != NULL) {
5146 *err = error;
5147 }
5148 }
5149#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
5150 }
5151
5152 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
5153 Image3D() : Image() { }
5154
5155 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
5156 *
5157 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5158 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5159 * earlier versions.
5160 * See Memory for further details.
5161 */
5162 explicit Image3D(const cl_mem& image3D, bool retainObject = false) :
5163 Image(image3D, retainObject) { }
5164
5165 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
5166 *
5167 * See Memory for further details.
5168 */
5169 Image3D& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
5170 {
5171 Image::operator=(rhs);
5172 return *this;
5173 }
5174
5175 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5176 * Required for MSVC.
5177 */
5178 Image3D(const Image3D& img) : Image(img) {}
5179
5180 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5181 * Required for MSVC.
5182 */
5183 Image3D& operator = (const Image3D &img)
5184 {
5185 Image::operator=(img);
5186 return *this;
5187 }
5188
5189 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5190 * Required for MSVC.
5191 */
5192 Image3D(Image3D&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
5193
5194 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5195 * Required for MSVC.
5196 */
5197 Image3D& operator = (Image3D &&img)
5198 {
5199 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
5200 return *this;
5201 }
5202};
5203
5204#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
5205/*! \brief Class interface for GL 3D Image Memory objects.
5206 *
5207 * This is provided to facilitate interoperability with OpenGL.
5208 *
5209 * See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
5210 *
5211 * \see Memory
5212 */
5213class Image3DGL : public Image3D
5214{
5215public:
5216 /*! \brief Constructs an Image3DGL in a specified context, from a given
5217 * GL Texture.
5218 *
5219 * Wraps clCreateFromGLTexture3D().
5220 */
5221 Image3DGL(
5222 const Context& context,
5223 cl_mem_flags flags,
5224 cl_GLenum target,
5225 cl_GLint miplevel,
5226 cl_GLuint texobj,
5227 cl_int * err = NULL)
5228 {
5229 cl_int error;
5230 object_ = ::clCreateFromGLTexture3D(
5231 context(),
5232 flags,
5233 target,
5234 miplevel,
5235 texobj,
5236 &error);
5237
5238 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_TEXTURE_3D_ERR);
5239 if (err != NULL) {
5240 *err = error;
5241 }
5242 }
5243
5244 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
5245 Image3DGL() : Image3D() { }
5246
5247 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
5248 *
5249 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5250 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5251 * earlier versions.
5252 * See Memory for further details.
5253 */
5254 explicit Image3DGL(const cl_mem& image, bool retainObject = false) :
5255 Image3D(image, retainObject) { }
5256
5257 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
5258 *
5259 * See Memory for further details.
5260 */
5261 Image3DGL& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
5262 {
5263 Image3D::operator=(rhs);
5264 return *this;
5265 }
5266
5267 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5268 * Required for MSVC.
5269 */
5270 Image3DGL(const Image3DGL& img) : Image3D(img) {}
5271
5272 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5273 * Required for MSVC.
5274 */
5275 Image3DGL& operator = (const Image3DGL &img)
5276 {
5277 Image3D::operator=(img);
5278 return *this;
5279 }
5280
5281 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5282 * Required for MSVC.
5283 */
5284 Image3DGL(Image3DGL&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image3D(std::move(img)) {}
5285
5286 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5287 * Required for MSVC.
5288 */
5289 Image3DGL& operator = (Image3DGL &&img)
5290 {
5291 Image3D::operator=(std::move(img));
5292 return *this;
5293 }
5294};
5295#endif // CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
5296
5297#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5298/*! \class ImageGL
5299 * \brief general image interface for GL interop.
5300 * We abstract the 2D and 3D GL images into a single instance here
5301 * that wraps all GL sourced images on the grounds that setup information
5302 * was performed by OpenCL anyway.
5303 */
5304class ImageGL : public Image
5305{
5306public:
5307 ImageGL(
5308 const Context& context,
5309 cl_mem_flags flags,
5310 cl_GLenum target,
5311 cl_GLint miplevel,
5312 cl_GLuint texobj,
5313 cl_int * err = NULL)
5314 {
5315 cl_int error;
5316 object_ = ::clCreateFromGLTexture(
5317 context(),
5318 flags,
5319 target,
5320 miplevel,
5321 texobj,
5322 &error);
5323
5324 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_TEXTURE_ERR);
5325 if (err != NULL) {
5326 *err = error;
5327 }
5328 }
5329
5330 ImageGL() : Image() { }
5331
5332 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
5333 *
5334 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5335 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5336 * earlier versions.
5337 * See Memory for further details.
5338 */
5339 explicit ImageGL(const cl_mem& image, bool retainObject = false) :
5340 Image(image, retainObject) { }
5341
5342 ImageGL& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
5343 {
5344 Image::operator=(rhs);
5345 return *this;
5346 }
5347
5348 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5349 * Required for MSVC.
5350 */
5351 ImageGL(const ImageGL& img) : Image(img) {}
5352
5353 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5354 * Required for MSVC.
5355 */
5356 ImageGL& operator = (const ImageGL &img)
5357 {
5358 Image::operator=(img);
5359 return *this;
5360 }
5361
5362 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5363 * Required for MSVC.
5364 */
5365 ImageGL(ImageGL&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
5366
5367 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5368 * Required for MSVC.
5369 */
5370 ImageGL& operator = (ImageGL &&img)
5371 {
5372 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
5373 return *this;
5374 }
5375};
5376#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5377
5378
5379
5380#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5381/*! \brief Class interface for Pipe Memory Objects.
5382*
5383* See Memory for details about copy semantics, etc.
5384*
5385* \see Memory
5386*/
5387class Pipe : public Memory
5388{
5389public:
5390
5391 /*! \brief Constructs a Pipe in a specified context.
5392 *
5393 * Wraps clCreatePipe().
5394 * @param context Context in which to create the pipe.
5395 * @param flags Bitfield. Only CL_MEM_READ_WRITE and CL_MEM_HOST_NO_ACCESS are valid.
5396 * @param packet_size Size in bytes of a single packet of the pipe.
5397 * @param max_packets Number of packets that may be stored in the pipe.
5398 *
5399 */
5400 Pipe(
5401 const Context& context,
5402 cl_uint packet_size,
5403 cl_uint max_packets,
5404 cl_int* err = NULL)
5405 {
5406 cl_int error;
5407
5408 cl_mem_flags flags = CL_MEM_READ_WRITE | CL_MEM_HOST_NO_ACCESS;
5409 object_ = ::clCreatePipe(context(), flags, packet_size, max_packets, nullptr, &error);
5410
5411 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PIPE_ERR);
5412 if (err != NULL) {
5413 *err = error;
5414 }
5415 }
5416
5417 /*! \brief Constructs a Pipe in a the default context.
5418 *
5419 * Wraps clCreatePipe().
5420 * @param flags Bitfield. Only CL_MEM_READ_WRITE and CL_MEM_HOST_NO_ACCESS are valid.
5421 * @param packet_size Size in bytes of a single packet of the pipe.
5422 * @param max_packets Number of packets that may be stored in the pipe.
5423 *
5424 */
5425 Pipe(
5426 cl_uint packet_size,
5427 cl_uint max_packets,
5428 cl_int* err = NULL)
5429 {
5430 cl_int error;
5431
5432 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
5433
5434 cl_mem_flags flags = CL_MEM_READ_WRITE | CL_MEM_HOST_NO_ACCESS;
5435 object_ = ::clCreatePipe(context(), flags, packet_size, max_packets, nullptr, &error);
5436
5437 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PIPE_ERR);
5438 if (err != NULL) {
5439 *err = error;
5440 }
5441 }
5442
5443 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
5444 Pipe() : Memory() { }
5445
5446 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
5447 *
5448 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5449 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with earlier versions.
5450 *
5451 * See Memory for further details.
5452 */
5453 explicit Pipe(const cl_mem& pipe, bool retainObject = false) :
5454 Memory(pipe, retainObject) { }
5455
5456 /*! \brief Assignment from cl_mem - performs shallow copy.
5457 *
5458 * See Memory for further details.
5459 */
5460 Pipe& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
5461 {
5462 Memory::operator=(rhs);
5463 return *this;
5464 }
5465
5466 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5467 * Required for MSVC.
5468 */
5469 Pipe(const Pipe& pipe) : Memory(pipe) {}
5470
5471 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5472 * Required for MSVC.
5473 */
5474 Pipe& operator = (const Pipe &pipe)
5475 {
5476 Memory::operator=(pipe);
5477 return *this;
5478 }
5479
5480 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5481 * Required for MSVC.
5482 */
5483 Pipe(Pipe&& pipe) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Memory(std::move(pipe)) {}
5484
5485 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5486 * Required for MSVC.
5487 */
5488 Pipe& operator = (Pipe &&pipe)
5489 {
5490 Memory::operator=(std::move(pipe));
5491 return *this;
5492 }
5493
5494 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetMemObjectInfo().
5495 template <typename T>
5496 cl_int getInfo(cl_pipe_info name, T* param) const
5497 {
5498 return detail::errHandler(
5499 detail::getInfo(&::clGetPipeInfo, object_, name, param),
5500 __GET_PIPE_INFO_ERR);
5501 }
5502
5503 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetMemObjectInfo() that returns by value.
5504 template <cl_int name> typename
5505 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_pipe_info, name>::param_type
5506 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
5507 {
5508 typename detail::param_traits<
5509 detail::cl_pipe_info, name>::param_type param;
5510 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
5511 if (err != NULL) {
5512 *err = result;
5513 }
5514 return param;
5515 }
5516}; // class Pipe
5517#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5518
5519
5520/*! \brief Class interface for cl_sampler.
5521 *
5522 * \note Copies of these objects are shallow, meaning that the copy will refer
5523 * to the same underlying cl_sampler as the original. For details, see
5524 * clRetainSampler() and clReleaseSampler().
5525 *
5526 * \see cl_sampler
5527 */
5528class Sampler : public detail::Wrapper<cl_sampler>
5529{
5530public:
5531 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
5532 Sampler() { }
5533
5534 /*! \brief Constructs a Sampler in a specified context.
5535 *
5536 * Wraps clCreateSampler().
5537 */
5538 Sampler(
5539 const Context& context,
5540 cl_bool normalized_coords,
5541 cl_addressing_mode addressing_mode,
5542 cl_filter_mode filter_mode,
5543 cl_int* err = NULL)
5544 {
5545 cl_int error;
5546
5547#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5548 cl_sampler_properties sampler_properties[] = {
5549 CL_SAMPLER_NORMALIZED_COORDS, normalized_coords,
5550 CL_SAMPLER_ADDRESSING_MODE, addressing_mode,
5551 CL_SAMPLER_FILTER_MODE, filter_mode,
5552 0 };
5553 object_ = ::clCreateSamplerWithProperties(
5554 context(),
5555 sampler_properties,
5556 &error);
5557
5558 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_SAMPLER_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
5559 if (err != NULL) {
5560 *err = error;
5561 }
5562#else
5563 object_ = ::clCreateSampler(
5564 context(),
5565 normalized_coords,
5566 addressing_mode,
5567 filter_mode,
5568 &error);
5569
5570 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_SAMPLER_ERR);
5571 if (err != NULL) {
5572 *err = error;
5573 }
5574#endif
5575 }
5576
5577 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_sampler - takes ownership.
5578 *
5579 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5580 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5581 * earlier versions.
5582 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the cl_sampler
5583 * into the new Sampler object.
5584 */
5585 explicit Sampler(const cl_sampler& sampler, bool retainObject = false) :
5586 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(sampler, retainObject) { }
5587
5588 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_sampler - takes ownership.
5589 *
5590 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the rhs and calls
5591 * clReleaseSampler() on the value previously held by this instance.
5592 */
5593 Sampler& operator = (const cl_sampler& rhs)
5594 {
5595 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
5596 return *this;
5597 }
5598
5599 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5600 * Required for MSVC.
5601 */
5602 Sampler(const Sampler& sam) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(sam) {}
5603
5604 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5605 * Required for MSVC.
5606 */
5607 Sampler& operator = (const Sampler &sam)
5608 {
5609 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(sam);
5610 return *this;
5611 }
5612
5613 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5614 * Required for MSVC.
5615 */
5616 Sampler(Sampler&& sam) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(sam)) {}
5617
5618 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5619 * Required for MSVC.
5620 */
5621 Sampler& operator = (Sampler &&sam)
5622 {
5623 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(sam));
5624 return *this;
5625 }
5626
5627 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetSamplerInfo().
5628 template <typename T>
5629 cl_int getInfo(cl_sampler_info name, T* param) const
5630 {
5631 return detail::errHandler(
5632 detail::getInfo(&::clGetSamplerInfo, object_, name, param),
5633 __GET_SAMPLER_INFO_ERR);
5634 }
5635
5636 //! \brief Wrapper for clGetSamplerInfo() that returns by value.
5637 template <cl_int name> typename
5638 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_sampler_info, name>::param_type
5639 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
5640 {
5641 typename detail::param_traits<
5642 detail::cl_sampler_info, name>::param_type param;
5643 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
5644 if (err != NULL) {
5645 *err = result;
5646 }
5647 return param;
5648 }
5649};
5650
5651class Program;
5652class CommandQueue;
5653class DeviceCommandQueue;
5654class Kernel;
5655
5656//! \brief Class interface for specifying NDRange values.
5657class NDRange
5658{
5659private:
5660 size_type sizes_[3];
5661 cl_uint dimensions_;
5662
5663public:
5664 //! \brief Default constructor - resulting range has zero dimensions.
5665 NDRange()
5666 : dimensions_(0)
5667 {
5668 sizes_[0] = 0;
5669 sizes_[1] = 0;
5670 sizes_[2] = 0;
5671 }
5672
5673 //! \brief Constructs one-dimensional range.
5674 NDRange(size_type size0)
5675 : dimensions_(1)
5676 {
5677 sizes_[0] = size0;
5678 sizes_[1] = 1;
5679 sizes_[2] = 1;
5680 }
5681
5682 //! \brief Constructs two-dimensional range.
5683 NDRange(size_type size0, size_type size1)
5684 : dimensions_(2)
5685 {
5686 sizes_[0] = size0;
5687 sizes_[1] = size1;
5688 sizes_[2] = 1;
5689 }
5690
5691 //! \brief Constructs three-dimensional range.
5692 NDRange(size_type size0, size_type size1, size_type size2)
5693 : dimensions_(3)
5694 {
5695 sizes_[0] = size0;
5696 sizes_[1] = size1;
5697 sizes_[2] = size2;
5698 }
5699
5700 /*! \brief Conversion operator to const size_type *.
5701 *
5702 * \returns a pointer to the size of the first dimension.
5703 */
5704 operator const size_type*() const {
5705 return sizes_;
5706 }
5707
5708 //! \brief Queries the number of dimensions in the range.
5709 size_type dimensions() const
5710 {
5711 return dimensions_;
5712 }
5713
5714 //! \brief Returns the size of the object in bytes based on the
5715 // runtime number of dimensions
5716 size_type size() const
5717 {
5718 return dimensions_*sizeof(size_type);
5719 }
5720
5721 size_type* get()
5722 {
5723 return sizes_;
5724 }
5725
5726 const size_type* get() const
5727 {
5728 return sizes_;
5729 }
5730};
5731
5732//! \brief A zero-dimensional range.
5733static const NDRange NullRange;
5734
5735//! \brief Local address wrapper for use with Kernel::setArg
5736struct LocalSpaceArg
5737{
5738 size_type size_;
5739};
5740
5741namespace detail {
5742
5743template <typename T, class Enable = void>
5744struct KernelArgumentHandler;
5745
5746// Enable for objects that are not subclasses of memory
5747// Pointers, constants etc
5748template <typename T>
5749struct KernelArgumentHandler<T, typename std::enable_if<!std::is_base_of<cl::Memory, T>::value>::type>
5750{
5751 static size_type size(const T&) { return sizeof(T); }
5752 static const T* ptr(const T& value) { return &value; }
5753};
5754
5755// Enable for subclasses of memory where we want to get a reference to the cl_mem out
5756// and pass that in for safety
5757template <typename T>
5758struct KernelArgumentHandler<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_base_of<cl::Memory, T>::value>::type>
5759{
5760 static size_type size(const T&) { return sizeof(cl_mem); }
5761 static const cl_mem* ptr(const T& value) { return &(value()); }
5762};
5763
5764// Specialization for DeviceCommandQueue defined later
5765
5766template <>
5767struct KernelArgumentHandler<LocalSpaceArg, void>
5768{
5769 static size_type size(const LocalSpaceArg& value) { return value.size_; }
5770 static const void* ptr(const LocalSpaceArg&) { return NULL; }
5771};
5772
5773}
5774//! \endcond
5775
5776/*! Local
5777 * \brief Helper function for generating LocalSpaceArg objects.
5778 */
5779inline LocalSpaceArg
5780Local(size_type size)
5781{
5782 LocalSpaceArg ret = { size };
5783 return ret;
5784}
5785
5786/*! \brief Class interface for cl_kernel.
5787 *
5788 * \note Copies of these objects are shallow, meaning that the copy will refer
5789 * to the same underlying cl_kernel as the original. For details, see
5790 * clRetainKernel() and clReleaseKernel().
5791 *
5792 * \see cl_kernel
5793 */
5794class Kernel : public detail::Wrapper<cl_kernel>
5795{
5796public:
5797 inline Kernel(const Program& program, const char* name, cl_int* err = NULL);
5798
5799 //! \brief Default constructor - initializes to NULL.
5800 Kernel() { }
5801
5802 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_kernel - takes ownership.
5803 *
5804 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
5805 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
5806 * earlier versions.
5807 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the cl_kernel
5808 * into the new Kernel object.
5809 */
5810 explicit Kernel(const cl_kernel& kernel, bool retainObject = false) :
5811 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(kernel, retainObject) { }
5812
5813 /*! \brief Assignment operator from cl_kernel - takes ownership.
5814 *
5815 * This effectively transfers ownership of a refcount on the rhs and calls
5816 * clReleaseKernel() on the value previously held by this instance.
5817 */
5818 Kernel& operator = (const cl_kernel& rhs)
5819 {
5820 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
5821 return *this;
5822 }
5823
5824 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5825 * Required for MSVC.
5826 */
5827 Kernel(const Kernel& kernel) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(kernel) {}
5828
5829 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
5830 * Required for MSVC.
5831 */
5832 Kernel& operator = (const Kernel &kernel)
5833 {
5834 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(kernel);
5835 return *this;
5836 }
5837
5838 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5839 * Required for MSVC.
5840 */
5841 Kernel(Kernel&& kernel) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(kernel)) {}
5842
5843 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
5844 * Required for MSVC.
5845 */
5846 Kernel& operator = (Kernel &&kernel)
5847 {
5848 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(kernel));
5849 return *this;
5850 }
5851
5852 template <typename T>
5853 cl_int getInfo(cl_kernel_info name, T* param) const
5854 {
5855 return detail::errHandler(
5856 detail::getInfo(&::clGetKernelInfo, object_, name, param),
5857 __GET_KERNEL_INFO_ERR);
5858 }
5859
5860 template <cl_int name> typename
5861 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_kernel_info, name>::param_type
5862 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
5863 {
5864 typename detail::param_traits<
5865 detail::cl_kernel_info, name>::param_type param;
5866 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
5867 if (err != NULL) {
5868 *err = result;
5869 }
5870 return param;
5871 }
5872
5873#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5874 template <typename T>
5875 cl_int getArgInfo(cl_uint argIndex, cl_kernel_arg_info name, T* param) const
5876 {
5877 return detail::errHandler(
5878 detail::getInfo(&::clGetKernelArgInfo, object_, argIndex, name, param),
5879 __GET_KERNEL_ARG_INFO_ERR);
5880 }
5881
5882 template <cl_int name> typename
5883 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_kernel_arg_info, name>::param_type
5884 getArgInfo(cl_uint argIndex, cl_int* err = NULL) const
5885 {
5886 typename detail::param_traits<
5887 detail::cl_kernel_arg_info, name>::param_type param;
5888 cl_int result = getArgInfo(argIndex, name, &param);
5889 if (err != NULL) {
5890 *err = result;
5891 }
5892 return param;
5893 }
5894#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
5895
5896 template <typename T>
5897 cl_int getWorkGroupInfo(
5898 const Device& device, cl_kernel_work_group_info name, T* param) const
5899 {
5900 return detail::errHandler(
5901 detail::getInfo(
5902 &::clGetKernelWorkGroupInfo, object_, device(), name, param),
5903 __GET_KERNEL_WORK_GROUP_INFO_ERR);
5904 }
5905
5906 template <cl_int name> typename
5907 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_kernel_work_group_info, name>::param_type
5908 getWorkGroupInfo(const Device& device, cl_int* err = NULL) const
5909 {
5910 typename detail::param_traits<
5911 detail::cl_kernel_work_group_info, name>::param_type param;
5912 cl_int result = getWorkGroupInfo(device, name, &param);
5913 if (err != NULL) {
5914 *err = result;
5915 }
5916 return param;
5917 }
5918
5919#if (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR)) || CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
5920 cl_int getSubGroupInfo(const cl::Device &dev, cl_kernel_sub_group_info name, const cl::NDRange &range, size_type* param) const
5921 {
5922#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
5923
5924 return detail::errHandler(
5925 clGetKernelSubGroupInfo(object_, dev(), name, range.size(), range.get(), sizeof(size_type), param, nullptr),
5926 __GET_KERNEL_SUB_GROUP_INFO_ERR);
5927
5928#else // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
5929
5930 typedef clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR_fn PFN_clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR;
5931 static PFN_clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR pfn_clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR = NULL;
5932 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR);
5933
5934 return detail::errHandler(
5935 pfn_clGetKernelSubGroupInfoKHR(object_, dev(), name, range.size(), range.get(), sizeof(size_type), param, nullptr),
5936 __GET_KERNEL_SUB_GROUP_INFO_ERR);
5937
5938#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
5939 }
5940
5941 template <cl_int name>
5942 size_type getSubGroupInfo(const cl::Device &dev, const cl::NDRange &range, cl_int* err = NULL) const
5943 {
5944 size_type param;
5945 cl_int result = getSubGroupInfo(dev, name, range, &param);
5946 if (err != NULL) {
5947 *err = result;
5948 }
5949 return param;
5950 }
5951#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5952
5953#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5954 /*! \brief setArg overload taking a shared_ptr type
5955 */
5956 template<typename T, class D>
5957 cl_int setArg(cl_uint index, const cl::pointer<T, D> &argPtr)
5958 {
5959 return detail::errHandler(
5960 ::clSetKernelArgSVMPointer(object_, index, argPtr.get()),
5961 __SET_KERNEL_ARGS_ERR);
5962 }
5963
5964 /*! \brief setArg overload taking a vector type.
5965 */
5966 template<typename T, class Alloc>
5967 cl_int setArg(cl_uint index, const cl::vector<T, Alloc> &argPtr)
5968 {
5969 return detail::errHandler(
5970 ::clSetKernelArgSVMPointer(object_, index, argPtr.data()),
5971 __SET_KERNEL_ARGS_ERR);
5972 }
5973
5974 /*! \brief setArg overload taking a pointer type
5975 */
5976 template<typename T>
5977 typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T>::value, cl_int>::type
5978 setArg(cl_uint index, const T argPtr)
5979 {
5980 return detail::errHandler(
5981 ::clSetKernelArgSVMPointer(object_, index, argPtr),
5982 __SET_KERNEL_ARGS_ERR);
5983 }
5984#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
5985
5986 /*! \brief setArg overload taking a POD type
5987 */
5988 template <typename T>
5989 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_pointer<T>::value, cl_int>::type
5990 setArg(cl_uint index, const T &value)
5991 {
5992 return detail::errHandler(
5993 ::clSetKernelArg(
5994 object_,
5995 index,
5996 detail::KernelArgumentHandler<T>::size(value),
5997 detail::KernelArgumentHandler<T>::ptr(value)),
5998 __SET_KERNEL_ARGS_ERR);
5999 }
6000
6001 cl_int setArg(cl_uint index, size_type size, const void* argPtr)
6002 {
6003 return detail::errHandler(
6004 ::clSetKernelArg(object_, index, size, argPtr),
6005 __SET_KERNEL_ARGS_ERR);
6006 }
6007
6008#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
6009 /*!
6010 * Specify a vector of SVM pointers that the kernel may access in
6011 * addition to its arguments.
6012 */
6013 cl_int setSVMPointers(const vector<void*> &pointerList)
6014 {
6015 return detail::errHandler(
6016 ::clSetKernelExecInfo(
6017 object_,
6018 CL_KERNEL_EXEC_INFO_SVM_PTRS,
6019 sizeof(void*)*pointerList.size(),
6020 pointerList.data()));
6021 }
6022
6023 /*!
6024 * Specify a std::array of SVM pointers that the kernel may access in
6025 * addition to its arguments.
6026 */
6027 template<int ArrayLength>
6028 cl_int setSVMPointers(const std::array<void*, ArrayLength> &pointerList)
6029 {
6030 return detail::errHandler(
6031 ::clSetKernelExecInfo(
6032 object_,
6033 CL_KERNEL_EXEC_INFO_SVM_PTRS,
6034 sizeof(void*)*pointerList.size(),
6035 pointerList.data()));
6036 }
6037
6038 /*! \brief Enable fine-grained system SVM.
6039 *
6040 * \note It is only possible to enable fine-grained system SVM if all devices
6041 * in the context associated with kernel support it.
6042 *
6043 * \param svmEnabled True if fine-grained system SVM is requested. False otherwise.
6044 * \return CL_SUCCESS if the function was executed succesfully. CL_INVALID_OPERATION
6045 * if no devices in the context support fine-grained system SVM.
6046 *
6047 * \see clSetKernelExecInfo
6048 */
6049 cl_int enableFineGrainedSystemSVM(bool svmEnabled)
6050 {
6051 cl_bool svmEnabled_ = svmEnabled ? CL_TRUE : CL_FALSE;
6052 return detail::errHandler(
6053 ::clSetKernelExecInfo(
6054 object_,
6055 CL_KERNEL_EXEC_INFO_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_SYSTEM,
6056 sizeof(cl_bool),
6057 &svmEnabled_
6058 )
6059 );
6060 }
6061
6062 template<int index, int ArrayLength, class D, typename T0, typename T1, typename... Ts>
6063 void setSVMPointersHelper(std::array<void*, ArrayLength> &pointerList, const pointer<T0, D> &t0, const pointer<T1, D> &t1, Ts & ... ts)
6064 {
6065 pointerList[index] = static_cast<void*>(t0.get());
6066 setSVMPointersHelper<index + 1, ArrayLength>(pointerList, t1, ts...);
6067 }
6068
6069 template<int index, int ArrayLength, typename T0, typename T1, typename... Ts>
6070 typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T0>::value, void>::type
6071 setSVMPointersHelper(std::array<void*, ArrayLength> &pointerList, T0 t0, T1 t1, Ts... ts)
6072 {
6073 pointerList[index] = static_cast<void*>(t0);
6074 setSVMPointersHelper<index + 1, ArrayLength>(pointerList, t1, ts...);
6075 }
6076
6077 template<int index, int ArrayLength, typename T0, class D>
6078 void setSVMPointersHelper(std::array<void*, ArrayLength> &pointerList, const pointer<T0, D> &t0)
6079 {
6080 pointerList[index] = static_cast<void*>(t0.get());
6081 }
6082
6083
6084 template<int index, int ArrayLength, typename T0>
6085 typename std::enable_if<std::is_pointer<T0>::value, void>::type
6086 setSVMPointersHelper(std::array<void*, ArrayLength> &pointerList, T0 t0)
6087 {
6088 pointerList[index] = static_cast<void*>(t0);
6089 }
6090
6091 template<typename T0, typename... Ts>
6092 cl_int setSVMPointers(const T0 &t0, Ts & ... ts)
6093 {
6094 std::array<void*, 1 + sizeof...(Ts)> pointerList;
6095
6096 setSVMPointersHelper<0, 1 + sizeof...(Ts)>(pointerList, t0, ts...);
6097 return detail::errHandler(
6098 ::clSetKernelExecInfo(
6099 object_,
6100 CL_KERNEL_EXEC_INFO_SVM_PTRS,
6101 sizeof(void*)*(1 + sizeof...(Ts)),
6102 pointerList.data()));
6103 }
6104#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
6105
6106#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6107 /**
6108 * Make a deep copy of the kernel object including its arguments.
6109 * @return A new kernel object with internal state entirely separate from that
6110 * of the original but with any arguments set on the original intact.
6111 */
6112 Kernel clone()
6113 {
6114 cl_int error;
6115 Kernel retValue(clCloneKernel(this->get(), &error));
6116
6117 detail::errHandler(error, __CLONE_KERNEL_ERR);
6118 return retValue;
6119 }
6120#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6121};
6122
6123/*! \class Program
6124 * \brief Program interface that implements cl_program.
6125 */
6126class Program : public detail::Wrapper<cl_program>
6127{
6128public:
6129#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6130 typedef vector<vector<unsigned char>> Binaries;
6131 typedef vector<string> Sources;
6132#else // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6133 typedef vector<std::pair<const void*, size_type> > Binaries;
6134 typedef vector<std::pair<const char*, size_type> > Sources;
6135#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6136
6137 Program(
6138 const string& source,
6139 bool build = false,
6140 cl_int* err = NULL)
6141 {
6142 cl_int error;
6143
6144 const char * strings = source.c_str();
6145 const size_type length = source.size();
6146
6147 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
6148
6149 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithSource(
6150 context(), (cl_uint)1, &strings, &length, &error);
6151
6152 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_SOURCE_ERR);
6153
6154 if (error == CL_SUCCESS && build) {
6155
6156 error = ::clBuildProgram(
6157 object_,
6158 0,
6159 NULL,
6160#if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6161 "-cl-std=CL2.0",
6162#else
6163 "",
6164#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6165 NULL,
6166 NULL);
6167
6168 detail::buildErrHandler(error, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6169 }
6170
6171 if (err != NULL) {
6172 *err = error;
6173 }
6174 }
6175
6176 Program(
6177 const Context& context,
6178 const string& source,
6179 bool build = false,
6180 cl_int* err = NULL)
6181 {
6182 cl_int error;
6183
6184 const char * strings = source.c_str();
6185 const size_type length = source.size();
6186
6187 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithSource(
6188 context(), (cl_uint)1, &strings, &length, &error);
6189
6190 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_SOURCE_ERR);
6191
6192 if (error == CL_SUCCESS && build) {
6193 error = ::clBuildProgram(
6194 object_,
6195 0,
6196 NULL,
6197#if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6198 "-cl-std=CL2.0",
6199#else
6200 "",
6201#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6202 NULL,
6203 NULL);
6204
6205 detail::buildErrHandler(error, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6206 }
6207
6208 if (err != NULL) {
6209 *err = error;
6210 }
6211 }
6212
6213 /**
6214 * Create a program from a vector of source strings and the default context.
6215 * Does not compile or link the program.
6216 */
6217 Program(
6218 const Sources& sources,
6219 cl_int* err = NULL)
6220 {
6221 cl_int error;
6222 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
6223
6224 const size_type n = (size_type)sources.size();
6225
6226 vector<size_type> lengths(n);
6227 vector<const char*> strings(n);
6228
6229 for (size_type i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
6230#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6231 strings[i] = sources[(int)i].data();
6232 lengths[i] = sources[(int)i].length();
6233#else // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6234 strings[i] = sources[(int)i].first;
6235 lengths[i] = sources[(int)i].second;
6236#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6237 }
6238
6239 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithSource(
6240 context(), (cl_uint)n, strings.data(), lengths.data(), &error);
6241
6242 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_SOURCE_ERR);
6243 if (err != NULL) {
6244 *err = error;
6245 }
6246 }
6247
6248 /**
6249 * Create a program from a vector of source strings and a provided context.
6250 * Does not compile or link the program.
6251 */
6252 Program(
6253 const Context& context,
6254 const Sources& sources,
6255 cl_int* err = NULL)
6256 {
6257 cl_int error;
6258
6259 const size_type n = (size_type)sources.size();
6260
6261 vector<size_type> lengths(n);
6262 vector<const char*> strings(n);
6263
6264 for (size_type i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
6265#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6266 strings[i] = sources[(int)i].data();
6267 lengths[i] = sources[(int)i].length();
6268#else // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6269 strings[i] = sources[(int)i].first;
6270 lengths[i] = sources[(int)i].second;
6271#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6272 }
6273
6274 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithSource(
6275 context(), (cl_uint)n, strings.data(), lengths.data(), &error);
6276
6277 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_SOURCE_ERR);
6278 if (err != NULL) {
6279 *err = error;
6280 }
6281 }
6282
6283
6284#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210 || (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION==200 && defined(CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR))
6285 /**
6286 * Program constructor to allow construction of program from SPIR-V or another IL.
6287 * Valid for either OpenCL >= 2.1 or when CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR is defined.
6288 */
6289 Program(
6290 const vector<char>& IL,
6291 bool build = false,
6292 cl_int* err = NULL)
6293 {
6294 cl_int error;
6295
6296 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
6297
6298#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6299
6300 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithIL(
6301 context(), static_cast<const void*>(IL.data()), IL.size(), &error);
6302
6303#else // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6304
6305 typedef clCreateProgramWithILKHR_fn PFN_clCreateProgramWithILKHR;
6306 static PFN_clCreateProgramWithILKHR pfn_clCreateProgramWithILKHR = NULL;
6307 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateProgramWithILKHR);
6308
6309 return detail::errHandler(
6310 pfn_clCreateProgramWithILKHR(
6311 context(), static_cast<const void*>(IL.data()), IL.size(), &error);
6312
6313#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6314
6315 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_IL_ERR);
6316
6317 if (error == CL_SUCCESS && build) {
6318
6319 error = ::clBuildProgram(
6320 object_,
6321 0,
6322 NULL,
6323#if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6324 "-cl-std=CL2.0",
6325#else
6326 "",
6327#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6328 NULL,
6329 NULL);
6330
6331 detail::buildErrHandler(error, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6332 }
6333
6334 if (err != NULL) {
6335 *err = error;
6336 }
6337 }
6338
6339 /**
6340 * Program constructor to allow construction of program from SPIR-V or another IL
6341 * for a specific context.
6342 * Valid for either OpenCL >= 2.1 or when CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR is defined.
6343 */
6344 Program(
6345 const Context& context,
6346 const vector<char>& IL,
6347 bool build = false,
6348 cl_int* err = NULL)
6349 {
6350 cl_int error;
6351
6352#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6353
6354 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithIL(
6355 context(), static_cast<const void*>(IL.data()), IL.size(), &error);
6356
6357#else // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6358
6359 typedef clCreateProgramWithILKHR_fn PFN_clCreateProgramWithILKHR;
6360 static PFN_clCreateProgramWithILKHR pfn_clCreateProgramWithILKHR = NULL;
6361 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateProgramWithILKHR);
6362
6363 return detail::errHandler(
6364 pfn_clCreateProgramWithILKHR(
6365 context(), static_cast<const void*>(IL.data()), IL.size(), &error);
6366
6367#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6368
6369 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_IL_ERR);
6370
6371 if (error == CL_SUCCESS && build) {
6372 error = ::clBuildProgram(
6373 object_,
6374 0,
6375 NULL,
6376#if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6377 "-cl-std=CL2.0",
6378#else
6379 "",
6380#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_CL_1_2_DEFAULT_BUILD)
6381 NULL,
6382 NULL);
6383
6384 detail::buildErrHandler(error, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6385 }
6386
6387 if (err != NULL) {
6388 *err = error;
6389 }
6390 }
6391#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
6392
6393 /**
6394 * Construct a program object from a list of devices and a per-device list of binaries.
6395 * \param context A valid OpenCL context in which to construct the program.
6396 * \param devices A vector of OpenCL device objects for which the program will be created.
6397 * \param binaries A vector of pairs of a pointer to a binary object and its length.
6398 * \param binaryStatus An optional vector that on completion will be resized to
6399 * match the size of binaries and filled with values to specify if each binary
6400 * was successfully loaded.
6401 * Set to CL_SUCCESS if the binary was successfully loaded.
6402 * Set to CL_INVALID_VALUE if the length is 0 or the binary pointer is NULL.
6403 * Set to CL_INVALID_BINARY if the binary provided is not valid for the matching device.
6404 * \param err if non-NULL will be set to CL_SUCCESS on successful operation or one of the following errors:
6405 * CL_INVALID_CONTEXT if context is not a valid context.
6406 * CL_INVALID_VALUE if the length of devices is zero; or if the length of binaries does not match the length of devices;
6407 * or if any entry in binaries is NULL or has length 0.
6408 * CL_INVALID_DEVICE if OpenCL devices listed in devices are not in the list of devices associated with context.
6409 * CL_INVALID_BINARY if an invalid program binary was encountered for any device. binaryStatus will return specific status for each device.
6410 * CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY if there is a failure to allocate resources required by the OpenCL implementation on the host.
6411 */
6412 Program(
6413 const Context& context,
6414 const vector<Device>& devices,
6415 const Binaries& binaries,
6416 vector<cl_int>* binaryStatus = NULL,
6417 cl_int* err = NULL)
6418 {
6419 cl_int error;
6420
6421 const size_type numDevices = devices.size();
6422
6423 // Catch size mismatch early and return
6424 if(binaries.size() != numDevices) {
6425 error = CL_INVALID_VALUE;
6426 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_BINARY_ERR);
6427 if (err != NULL) {
6428 *err = error;
6429 }
6430 return;
6431 }
6432
6433
6434 vector<size_type> lengths(numDevices);
6435 vector<const unsigned char*> images(numDevices);
6436#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6437 for (size_type i = 0; i < numDevices; ++i) {
6438 images[i] = binaries[i].data();
6439 lengths[i] = binaries[(int)i].size();
6440 }
6441#else // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6442 for (size_type i = 0; i < numDevices; ++i) {
6443 images[i] = (const unsigned char*)binaries[i].first;
6444 lengths[i] = binaries[(int)i].second;
6445 }
6446#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_PROGRAM_CONSTRUCTION_FROM_ARRAY_COMPATIBILITY)
6447
6448 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
6449 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
6450 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
6451 }
6452
6453 if(binaryStatus) {
6454 binaryStatus->resize(numDevices);
6455 }
6456
6457 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithBinary(
6458 context(), (cl_uint) devices.size(),
6459 deviceIDs.data(),
6460 lengths.data(), images.data(), (binaryStatus != NULL && numDevices > 0)
6461 ? &binaryStatus->front()
6462 : NULL, &error);
6463
6464 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_BINARY_ERR);
6465 if (err != NULL) {
6466 *err = error;
6467 }
6468 }
6469
6470
6471#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6472 /**
6473 * Create program using builtin kernels.
6474 * \param kernelNames Semi-colon separated list of builtin kernel names
6475 */
6476 Program(
6477 const Context& context,
6478 const vector<Device>& devices,
6479 const string& kernelNames,
6480 cl_int* err = NULL)
6481 {
6482 cl_int error;
6483
6484
6485 size_type numDevices = devices.size();
6486 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
6487 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
6488 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
6489 }
6490
6491 object_ = ::clCreateProgramWithBuiltInKernels(
6492 context(),
6493 (cl_uint) devices.size(),
6494 deviceIDs.data(),
6495 kernelNames.c_str(),
6496 &error);
6497
6498 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_PROGRAM_WITH_BUILT_IN_KERNELS_ERR);
6499 if (err != NULL) {
6500 *err = error;
6501 }
6502 }
6503#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6504
6505 Program() { }
6506
6507
6508 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
6509 *
6510 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
6511 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
6512 * earlier versions.
6513 */
6514 explicit Program(const cl_program& program, bool retainObject = false) :
6515 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(program, retainObject) { }
6516
6517 Program& operator = (const cl_program& rhs)
6518 {
6519 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
6520 return *this;
6521 }
6522
6523 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
6524 * Required for MSVC.
6525 */
6526 Program(const Program& program) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(program) {}
6527
6528 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
6529 * Required for MSVC.
6530 */
6531 Program& operator = (const Program &program)
6532 {
6533 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(program);
6534 return *this;
6535 }
6536
6537 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
6538 * Required for MSVC.
6539 */
6540 Program(Program&& program) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(program)) {}
6541
6542 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
6543 * Required for MSVC.
6544 */
6545 Program& operator = (Program &&program)
6546 {
6547 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(program));
6548 return *this;
6549 }
6550
6551 cl_int build(
6552 const vector<Device>& devices,
6553 const char* options = NULL,
6554 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(cl_program, void *) = NULL,
6555 void* data = NULL) const
6556 {
6557 size_type numDevices = devices.size();
6558 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
6559
6560 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
6561 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
6562 }
6563
6564 cl_int buildError = ::clBuildProgram(
6565 object_,
6566 (cl_uint)
6567 devices.size(),
6568 deviceIDs.data(),
6569 options,
6570 notifyFptr,
6571 data);
6572
6573 return detail::buildErrHandler(buildError, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6574 }
6575
6576 cl_int build(
6577 const char* options = NULL,
6578 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(cl_program, void *) = NULL,
6579 void* data = NULL) const
6580 {
6581 cl_int buildError = ::clBuildProgram(
6582 object_,
6583 0,
6584 NULL,
6585 options,
6586 notifyFptr,
6587 data);
6588
6589
6590 return detail::buildErrHandler(buildError, __BUILD_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6591 }
6592
6593#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6594 cl_int compile(
6595 const char* options = NULL,
6596 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(cl_program, void *) = NULL,
6597 void* data = NULL) const
6598 {
6599 cl_int error = ::clCompileProgram(
6600 object_,
6601 0,
6602 NULL,
6603 options,
6604 0,
6605 NULL,
6606 NULL,
6607 notifyFptr,
6608 data);
6609 return detail::buildErrHandler(error, __COMPILE_PROGRAM_ERR, getBuildInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>());
6610 }
6611#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6612
6613 template <typename T>
6614 cl_int getInfo(cl_program_info name, T* param) const
6615 {
6616 return detail::errHandler(
6617 detail::getInfo(&::clGetProgramInfo, object_, name, param),
6618 __GET_PROGRAM_INFO_ERR);
6619 }
6620
6621 template <cl_int name> typename
6622 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_info, name>::param_type
6623 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
6624 {
6625 typename detail::param_traits<
6626 detail::cl_program_info, name>::param_type param;
6627 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
6628 if (err != NULL) {
6629 *err = result;
6630 }
6631 return param;
6632 }
6633
6634 template <typename T>
6635 cl_int getBuildInfo(
6636 const Device& device, cl_program_build_info name, T* param) const
6637 {
6638 return detail::errHandler(
6639 detail::getInfo(
6640 &::clGetProgramBuildInfo, object_, device(), name, param),
6641 __GET_PROGRAM_BUILD_INFO_ERR);
6642 }
6643
6644 template <cl_int name> typename
6645 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type
6646 getBuildInfo(const Device& device, cl_int* err = NULL) const
6647 {
6648 typename detail::param_traits<
6649 detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type param;
6650 cl_int result = getBuildInfo(device, name, &param);
6651 if (err != NULL) {
6652 *err = result;
6653 }
6654 return param;
6655 }
6656
6657 /**
6658 * Build info function that returns a vector of device/info pairs for the specified
6659 * info type and for all devices in the program.
6660 * On an error reading the info for any device, an empty vector of info will be returned.
6661 */
6662 template <cl_int name>
6663 vector<std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type>>
6664 getBuildInfo(cl_int *err = NULL) const
6665 {
6666 cl_int result = CL_SUCCESS;
6667
6668 auto devs = getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_DEVICES>(&result);
6669 vector<std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type>>
6670 devInfo;
6671
6672 // If there was an initial error from getInfo return the error
6673 if (result != CL_SUCCESS) {
6674 if (err != NULL) {
6675 *err = result;
6676 }
6677 return devInfo;
6678 }
6679
6680 for (const cl::Device &d : devs) {
6681 typename detail::param_traits<
6682 detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type param;
6683 result = getBuildInfo(d, name, &param);
6684 devInfo.push_back(
6685 std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, name>::param_type>
6686 (d, param));
6687 if (result != CL_SUCCESS) {
6688 // On error, leave the loop and return the error code
6689 break;
6690 }
6691 }
6692 if (err != NULL) {
6693 *err = result;
6694 }
6695 if (result != CL_SUCCESS) {
6696 devInfo.clear();
6697 }
6698 return devInfo;
6699 }
6700
6701 cl_int createKernels(vector<Kernel>* kernels)
6702 {
6703 cl_uint numKernels;
6704 cl_int err = ::clCreateKernelsInProgram(object_, 0, NULL, &numKernels);
6705 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
6706 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_KERNELS_IN_PROGRAM_ERR);
6707 }
6708
6709 vector<cl_kernel> value(numKernels);
6710
6711 err = ::clCreateKernelsInProgram(
6712 object_, numKernels, value.data(), NULL);
6713 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
6714 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_KERNELS_IN_PROGRAM_ERR);
6715 }
6716
6717 if (kernels) {
6718 kernels->resize(value.size());
6719
6720 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
6721 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
6722 for (size_type i = 0; i < value.size(); i++) {
6723 // We do not need to retain because this kernel is being created
6724 // by the runtime
6725 (*kernels)[i] = Kernel(value[i], false);
6726 }
6727 }
6728 return CL_SUCCESS;
6729 }
6730};
6731
6732#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6733inline Program linkProgram(
6734 Program input1,
6735 Program input2,
6736 const char* options = NULL,
6737 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(cl_program, void *) = NULL,
6738 void* data = NULL,
6739 cl_int* err = NULL)
6740{
6741 cl_int error_local = CL_SUCCESS;
6742
6743 cl_program programs[2] = { input1(), input2() };
6744
6745 Context ctx = input1.getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_CONTEXT>(&error_local);
6746 if(error_local!=CL_SUCCESS) {
6747 detail::errHandler(error_local, __LINK_PROGRAM_ERR);
6748 }
6749
6750 cl_program prog = ::clLinkProgram(
6751 ctx(),
6752 0,
6753 NULL,
6754 options,
6755 2,
6756 programs,
6757 notifyFptr,
6758 data,
6759 &error_local);
6760
6761 detail::errHandler(error_local,__COMPILE_PROGRAM_ERR);
6762 if (err != NULL) {
6763 *err = error_local;
6764 }
6765
6766 return Program(prog);
6767}
6768
6769inline Program linkProgram(
6770 vector<Program> inputPrograms,
6771 const char* options = NULL,
6772 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(cl_program, void *) = NULL,
6773 void* data = NULL,
6774 cl_int* err = NULL)
6775{
6776 cl_int error_local = CL_SUCCESS;
6777
6778 vector<cl_program> programs(inputPrograms.size());
6779
6780 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < inputPrograms.size(); i++) {
6781 programs[i] = inputPrograms[i]();
6782 }
6783
6784 Context ctx;
6785 if(inputPrograms.size() > 0) {
6786 ctx = inputPrograms[0].getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_CONTEXT>(&error_local);
6787 if(error_local!=CL_SUCCESS) {
6788 detail::errHandler(error_local, __LINK_PROGRAM_ERR);
6789 }
6790 }
6791 cl_program prog = ::clLinkProgram(
6792 ctx(),
6793 0,
6794 NULL,
6795 options,
6796 (cl_uint)inputPrograms.size(),
6797 programs.data(),
6798 notifyFptr,
6799 data,
6800 &error_local);
6801
6802 detail::errHandler(error_local,__COMPILE_PROGRAM_ERR);
6803 if (err != NULL) {
6804 *err = error_local;
6805 }
6806
6807 return Program(prog, false);
6808}
6809#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
6810
6811// Template specialization for CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES
6812template <>
6813inline cl_int cl::Program::getInfo(cl_program_info name, vector<vector<unsigned char>>* param) const
6814{
6815 if (name != CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES) {
6816 return CL_INVALID_VALUE;
6817 }
6818 if (param) {
6819 // Resize the parameter array appropriately for each allocation
6820 // and pass down to the helper
6821
6822 vector<size_type> sizes = getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BINARY_SIZES>();
6823 size_type numBinaries = sizes.size();
6824
6825 // Resize the parameter array and constituent arrays
6826 param->resize(numBinaries);
6827 for (size_type i = 0; i < numBinaries; ++i) {
6828 (*param)[i].resize(sizes[i]);
6829 }
6830
6831 return detail::errHandler(
6832 detail::getInfo(&::clGetProgramInfo, object_, name, param),
6833 __GET_PROGRAM_INFO_ERR);
6834 }
6835
6836 return CL_SUCCESS;
6837}
6838
6839template<>
6840inline vector<vector<unsigned char>> cl::Program::getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES>(cl_int* err) const
6841{
6842 vector<vector<unsigned char>> binariesVectors;
6843
6844 cl_int result = getInfo(CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES, &binariesVectors);
6845 if (err != NULL) {
6846 *err = result;
6847 }
6848 return binariesVectors;
6849}
6850
6851inline Kernel::Kernel(const Program& program, const char* name, cl_int* err)
6852{
6853 cl_int error;
6854
6855 object_ = ::clCreateKernel(program(), name, &error);
6856 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_KERNEL_ERR);
6857
6858 if (err != NULL) {
6859 *err = error;
6860 }
6861
6862}
6863
6864enum class QueueProperties : cl_command_queue_properties
6865{
6866 None = 0,
6867 Profiling = CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE,
6868 OutOfOrder = CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE,
6869};
6870
6871inline QueueProperties operator|(QueueProperties lhs, QueueProperties rhs)
6872{
6873 return static_cast<QueueProperties>(static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(lhs) | static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(rhs));
6874}
6875
6876/*! \class CommandQueue
6877 * \brief CommandQueue interface for cl_command_queue.
6878 */
6879class CommandQueue : public detail::Wrapper<cl_command_queue>
6880{
6881private:
6882 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
6883 static CommandQueue default_;
6884 static cl_int default_error_;
6885
6886 /*! \brief Create the default command queue returned by @ref getDefault.
6887 *
6888 * It sets default_error_ to indicate success or failure. It does not throw
6889 * @c cl::Error.
6890 */
6891 static void makeDefault()
6892 {
6893 /* We don't want to throw an error from this function, so we have to
6894 * catch and set the error flag.
6895 */
6896#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
6897 try
6898#endif
6899 {
6900 int error;
6901 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
6902
6903 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
6904 default_error_ = error;
6905 }
6906 else {
6907 Device device = Device::getDefault();
6908 default_ = CommandQueue(context, device, 0, &default_error_);
6909 }
6910 }
6911#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
6912 catch (cl::Error &e) {
6913 default_error_ = e.err();
6914 }
6915#endif
6916 }
6917
6918 /*! \brief Create the default command queue.
6919 *
6920 * This sets @c default_. It does not throw
6921 * @c cl::Error.
6922 */
6923 static void makeDefaultProvided(const CommandQueue &c) {
6924 default_ = c;
6925 }
6926
6927public:
6928#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
6929 /*! \brief Reset the default.
6930 *
6931 * This sets @c default_ to an empty value to support cleanup in
6932 * the unit test framework.
6933 * This function is not thread safe.
6934 */
6935 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
6936 default_ = CommandQueue();
6937 }
6938#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
6939
6940
6941 /*!
6942 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue based on passed properties.
6943 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
6944 */
6945 CommandQueue(
6946 cl_command_queue_properties properties,
6947 cl_int* err = NULL)
6948 {
6949 cl_int error;
6950
6951 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
6952 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
6953
6954 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
6955 if (err != NULL) {
6956 *err = error;
6957 }
6958 }
6959 else {
6960 Device device = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()[0];
6961 bool useWithProperties;
6962
6963#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
6964 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
6965 {
6966 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
6967 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
6968 }
6969#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
6970 useWithProperties = true;
6971#else
6972 useWithProperties = false;
6973#endif
6974
6975#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
6976 if (useWithProperties) {
6977 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
6978 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties, 0 };
6979 if ((properties & CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE) == 0) {
6980 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
6981 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
6982 }
6983 else {
6984 error = CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES;
6985 }
6986
6987 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
6988 if (err != NULL) {
6989 *err = error;
6990 }
6991 }
6992#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
6993#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
6994 if (!useWithProperties) {
6995 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
6996 context(), device(), properties, &error);
6997
6998 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
6999 if (err != NULL) {
7000 *err = error;
7001 }
7002 }
7003#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7004 }
7005 }
7006
7007 /*!
7008 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue based on passed properties.
7009 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
7010 */
7011 CommandQueue(
7012 QueueProperties properties,
7013 cl_int* err = NULL)
7014 {
7015 cl_int error;
7016
7017 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
7018 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
7019
7020 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
7021 if (err != NULL) {
7022 *err = error;
7023 }
7024 }
7025 else {
7026 Device device = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()[0];
7027 bool useWithProperties;
7028
7029#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7030 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
7031 {
7032 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
7033 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
7034 }
7035#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7036 useWithProperties = true;
7037#else
7038 useWithProperties = false;
7039#endif
7040
7041#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7042 if (useWithProperties) {
