7043 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
7044 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, static_cast<cl_queue_properties>(properties), 0 };
7045
7046 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
7047 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
7048
7049 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7050 if (err != NULL) {
7051 *err = error;
7052 }
7053 }
7054#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7055#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7056 if (!useWithProperties) {
7057 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
7058 context(), device(), static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties), &error);
7059
7060 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7061 if (err != NULL) {
7062 *err = error;
7063 }
7064 }
7065#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7066
7067 }
7068 }
7069
7070 /*!
7071 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue for an implementation defined device in the given context
7072 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
7073 */
7074 explicit CommandQueue(
7075 const Context& context,
7076 cl_command_queue_properties properties = 0,
7077 cl_int* err = NULL)
7078 {
7079 cl_int error;
7080 bool useWithProperties;
7081 vector<cl::Device> devices;
7082 error = context.getInfo(CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, &devices);
7083
7084 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
7085
7086 if (error != CL_SUCCESS)
7087 {
7088 if (err != NULL) {
7089 *err = error;
7090 }
7091 return;
7092 }
7093
7094#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7095 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
7096 {
7097 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
7098 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
7099 }
7100#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7101 useWithProperties = true;
7102#else
7103 useWithProperties = false;
7104#endif
7105
7106#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7107 if (useWithProperties) {
7108 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
7109 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties, 0 };
7110 if ((properties & CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE) == 0) {
7111 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
7112 context(), devices[0](), queue_properties, &error);
7113 }
7114 else {
7115 error = CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES;
7116 }
7117
7118 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7119 if (err != NULL) {
7120 *err = error;
7121 }
7122 }
7123#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7124#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7125 if (!useWithProperties) {
7126 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
7127 context(), devices[0](), properties, &error);
7128
7129 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7130 if (err != NULL) {
7131 *err = error;
7132 }
7133 }
7134#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7135 }
7136
7137 /*!
7138 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue for an implementation defined device in the given context
7139 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
7140 */
7141 explicit CommandQueue(
7142 const Context& context,
7143 QueueProperties properties,
7144 cl_int* err = NULL)
7145 {
7146 cl_int error;
7147 bool useWithProperties;
7148 vector<cl::Device> devices;
7149 error = context.getInfo(CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, &devices);
7150
7151 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
7152
7153 if (error != CL_SUCCESS)
7154 {
7155 if (err != NULL) {
7156 *err = error;
7157 }
7158 return;
7159 }
7160
7161#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7162 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
7163 {
7164 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
7165 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
7166 }
7167#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7168 useWithProperties = true;
7169#else
7170 useWithProperties = false;
7171#endif
7172
7173#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7174 if (useWithProperties) {
7175 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
7176 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, static_cast<cl_queue_properties>(properties), 0 };
7177 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
7178 context(), devices[0](), queue_properties, &error);
7179
7180 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7181 if (err != NULL) {
7182 *err = error;
7183 }
7184 }
7185#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7186#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7187 if (!useWithProperties) {
7188 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
7189 context(), devices[0](), static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties), &error);
7190
7191 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7192 if (err != NULL) {
7193 *err = error;
7194 }
7195 }
7196#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7197 }
7198
7199 /*!
7200 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue for a passed device and context
7201 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
7202 */
7203 CommandQueue(
7204 const Context& context,
7205 const Device& device,
7206 cl_command_queue_properties properties = 0,
7207 cl_int* err = NULL)
7208 {
7209 cl_int error;
7210 bool useWithProperties;
7211
7212#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7213 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
7214 {
7215 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
7216 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
7217 }
7218#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7219 useWithProperties = true;
7220#else
7221 useWithProperties = false;
7222#endif
7223
7224#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7225 if (useWithProperties) {
7226 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
7227 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties, 0 };
7228 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
7229 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
7230
7231 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7232 if (err != NULL) {
7233 *err = error;
7234 }
7235 }
7236#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7237#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7238 if (!useWithProperties) {
7239 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
7240 context(), device(), properties, &error);
7241
7242 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7243 if (err != NULL) {
7244 *err = error;
7245 }
7246 }
7247#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7248 }
7249
7250 /*!
7251 * \brief Constructs a CommandQueue for a passed device and context
7252 * Will return an CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES error if CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE is specified.
7253 */
7254 CommandQueue(
7255 const Context& context,
7256 const Device& device,
7257 QueueProperties properties,
7258 cl_int* err = NULL)
7259 {
7260 cl_int error;
7261 bool useWithProperties;
7262
7263#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7264 // Run-time decision based on the actual platform
7265 {
7266 cl_uint version = detail::getContextPlatformVersion(context());
7267 useWithProperties = (version >= 0x20000); // OpenCL 2.0 or above
7268 }
7269#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7270 useWithProperties = true;
7271#else
7272 useWithProperties = false;
7273#endif
7274
7275#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7276 if (useWithProperties) {
7277 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
7278 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, static_cast<cl_queue_properties>(properties), 0 };
7279 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
7280 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
7281
7282 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7283 if (err != NULL) {
7284 *err = error;
7285 }
7286 }
7287#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7288#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7289 if (!useWithProperties) {
7290 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueue(
7291 context(), device(), static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties), &error);
7292
7293 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7294 if (err != NULL) {
7295 *err = error;
7296 }
7297 }
7298#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
7299 }
7300
7301 static CommandQueue getDefault(cl_int * err = NULL)
7302 {
7303 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
7304#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7305 detail::errHandler(default_error_, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
7306#else // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7307 detail::errHandler(default_error_, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
7308#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7309 if (err != NULL) {
7310 *err = default_error_;
7311 }
7312 return default_;
7313 }
7314
7315 /**
7316 * Modify the default command queue to be used by
7317 * subsequent operations.
7318 * Will only set the default if no default was previously created.
7319 * @return updated default command queue.
7320 * Should be compared to the passed value to ensure that it was updated.
7321 */
7322 static CommandQueue setDefault(const CommandQueue &default_queue)
7323 {
7324 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_queue));
7325 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
7326 return default_;
7327 }
7328
7329 CommandQueue() { }
7330
7331
7332 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_mem - takes ownership.
7333 *
7334 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
7335 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
7336 * earlier versions.
7337 */
7338 explicit CommandQueue(const cl_command_queue& commandQueue, bool retainObject = false) :
7339 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(commandQueue, retainObject) { }
7340
7341 CommandQueue& operator = (const cl_command_queue& rhs)
7342 {
7343 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
7344 return *this;
7345 }
7346
7347 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
7348 * Required for MSVC.
7349 */
7350 CommandQueue(const CommandQueue& queue) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(queue) {}
7351
7352 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
7353 * Required for MSVC.
7354 */
7355 CommandQueue& operator = (const CommandQueue &queue)
7356 {
7357 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(queue);
7358 return *this;
7359 }
7360
7361 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
7362 * Required for MSVC.
7363 */
7364 CommandQueue(CommandQueue&& queue) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(queue)) {}
7365
7366 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
7367 * Required for MSVC.
7368 */
7369 CommandQueue& operator = (CommandQueue &&queue)
7370 {
7371 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(queue));
7372 return *this;
7373 }
7374
7375 template <typename T>
7376 cl_int getInfo(cl_command_queue_info name, T* param) const
7377 {
7378 return detail::errHandler(
7379 detail::getInfo(
7380 &::clGetCommandQueueInfo, object_, name, param),
7381 __GET_COMMAND_QUEUE_INFO_ERR);
7382 }
7383
7384 template <cl_int name> typename
7385 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_command_queue_info, name>::param_type
7386 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
7387 {
7388 typename detail::param_traits<
7389 detail::cl_command_queue_info, name>::param_type param;
7390 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
7391 if (err != NULL) {
7392 *err = result;
7393 }
7394 return param;
7395 }
7396
7397 cl_int enqueueReadBuffer(
7398 const Buffer& buffer,
7399 cl_bool blocking,
7400 size_type offset,
7401 size_type size,
7402 void* ptr,
7403 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7404 Event* event = NULL) const
7405 {
7406 cl_event tmp;
7407 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7408 ::clEnqueueReadBuffer(
7409 object_, buffer(), blocking, offset, size,
7410 ptr,
7411 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7412 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7413 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7414 __ENQUEUE_READ_BUFFER_ERR);
7415
7416 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7417 *event = tmp;
7418
7419 return err;
7420 }
7421
7422 cl_int enqueueWriteBuffer(
7423 const Buffer& buffer,
7424 cl_bool blocking,
7425 size_type offset,
7426 size_type size,
7427 const void* ptr,
7428 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7429 Event* event = NULL) const
7430 {
7431 cl_event tmp;
7432 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7433 ::clEnqueueWriteBuffer(
7434 object_, buffer(), blocking, offset, size,
7435 ptr,
7436 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7437 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7438 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7439 __ENQUEUE_WRITE_BUFFER_ERR);
7440
7441 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7442 *event = tmp;
7443
7444 return err;
7445 }
7446
7447 cl_int enqueueCopyBuffer(
7448 const Buffer& src,
7449 const Buffer& dst,
7450 size_type src_offset,
7451 size_type dst_offset,
7452 size_type size,
7453 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7454 Event* event = NULL) const
7455 {
7456 cl_event tmp;
7457 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7458 ::clEnqueueCopyBuffer(
7459 object_, src(), dst(), src_offset, dst_offset, size,
7460 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7461 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7462 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7463 __ENQEUE_COPY_BUFFER_ERR);
7464
7465 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7466 *event = tmp;
7467
7468 return err;
7469 }
7470#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
7471 cl_int enqueueReadBufferRect(
7472 const Buffer& buffer,
7473 cl_bool blocking,
7474 const array<size_type, 3>& buffer_offset,
7475 const array<size_type, 3>& host_offset,
7476 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7477 size_type buffer_row_pitch,
7478 size_type buffer_slice_pitch,
7479 size_type host_row_pitch,
7480 size_type host_slice_pitch,
7481 void *ptr,
7482 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7483 Event* event = NULL) const
7484 {
7485 cl_event tmp;
7486 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7487 ::clEnqueueReadBufferRect(
7488 object_,
7489 buffer(),
7490 blocking,
7491 buffer_offset.data(),
7492 host_offset.data(),
7493 region.data(),
7494 buffer_row_pitch,
7495 buffer_slice_pitch,
7496 host_row_pitch,
7497 host_slice_pitch,
7498 ptr,
7499 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7500 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7501 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7502 __ENQUEUE_READ_BUFFER_RECT_ERR);
7503
7504 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7505 *event = tmp;
7506
7507 return err;
7508 }
7509
7510 cl_int enqueueWriteBufferRect(
7511 const Buffer& buffer,
7512 cl_bool blocking,
7513 const array<size_type, 3>& buffer_offset,
7514 const array<size_type, 3>& host_offset,
7515 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7516 size_type buffer_row_pitch,
7517 size_type buffer_slice_pitch,
7518 size_type host_row_pitch,
7519 size_type host_slice_pitch,
7520 const void *ptr,
7521 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7522 Event* event = NULL) const
7523 {
7524 cl_event tmp;
7525 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7526 ::clEnqueueWriteBufferRect(
7527 object_,
7528 buffer(),
7529 blocking,
7530 buffer_offset.data(),
7531 host_offset.data(),
7532 region.data(),
7533 buffer_row_pitch,
7534 buffer_slice_pitch,
7535 host_row_pitch,
7536 host_slice_pitch,
7537 ptr,
7538 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7539 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7540 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7541 __ENQUEUE_WRITE_BUFFER_RECT_ERR);
7542
7543 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7544 *event = tmp;
7545
7546 return err;
7547 }
7548
7549 cl_int enqueueCopyBufferRect(
7550 const Buffer& src,
7551 const Buffer& dst,
7552 const array<size_type, 3>& src_origin,
7553 const array<size_type, 3>& dst_origin,
7554 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7555 size_type src_row_pitch,
7556 size_type src_slice_pitch,
7557 size_type dst_row_pitch,
7558 size_type dst_slice_pitch,
7559 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7560 Event* event = NULL) const
7561 {
7562 cl_event tmp;
7563 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7564 ::clEnqueueCopyBufferRect(
7565 object_,
7566 src(),
7567 dst(),
7568 src_origin.data(),
7569 dst_origin.data(),
7570 region.data(),
7571 src_row_pitch,
7572 src_slice_pitch,
7573 dst_row_pitch,
7574 dst_slice_pitch,
7575 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7576 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7577 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7578 __ENQEUE_COPY_BUFFER_RECT_ERR);
7579
7580 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7581 *event = tmp;
7582
7583 return err;
7584 }
7585#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
7586#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
7587 /**
7588 * Enqueue a command to fill a buffer object with a pattern
7589 * of a given size. The pattern is specified as a vector type.
7590 * \tparam PatternType The datatype of the pattern field.
7591 * The pattern type must be an accepted OpenCL data type.
7592 * \tparam offset Is the offset in bytes into the buffer at
7593 * which to start filling. This must be a multiple of
7594 * the pattern size.
7595 * \tparam size Is the size in bytes of the region to fill.
7596 * This must be a multiple of the pattern size.
7597 */
7598 template<typename PatternType>
7599 cl_int enqueueFillBuffer(
7600 const Buffer& buffer,
7601 PatternType pattern,
7602 size_type offset,
7603 size_type size,
7604 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7605 Event* event = NULL) const
7606 {
7607 cl_event tmp;
7608 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7609 ::clEnqueueFillBuffer(
7610 object_,
7611 buffer(),
7612 static_cast<void*>(&pattern),
7613 sizeof(PatternType),
7614 offset,
7615 size,
7616 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7617 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7618 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7619 __ENQUEUE_FILL_BUFFER_ERR);
7620
7621 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7622 *event = tmp;
7623
7624 return err;
7625 }
7626#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
7627
7628 cl_int enqueueReadImage(
7629 const Image& image,
7630 cl_bool blocking,
7631 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
7632 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7633 size_type row_pitch,
7634 size_type slice_pitch,
7635 void* ptr,
7636 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7637 Event* event = NULL) const
7638 {
7639 cl_event tmp;
7640 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7641 ::clEnqueueReadImage(
7642 object_,
7643 image(),
7644 blocking,
7645 origin.data(),
7646 region.data(),
7647 row_pitch,
7648 slice_pitch,
7649 ptr,
7650 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7651 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7652 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7653 __ENQUEUE_READ_IMAGE_ERR);
7654
7655 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7656 *event = tmp;
7657
7658 return err;
7659 }
7660
7661 cl_int enqueueWriteImage(
7662 const Image& image,
7663 cl_bool blocking,
7664 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
7665 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7666 size_type row_pitch,
7667 size_type slice_pitch,
7668 const void* ptr,
7669 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7670 Event* event = NULL) const
7671 {
7672 cl_event tmp;
7673 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7674 ::clEnqueueWriteImage(
7675 object_,
7676 image(),
7677 blocking,
7678 origin.data(),
7679 region.data(),
7680 row_pitch,
7681 slice_pitch,
7682 ptr,
7683 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7684 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7685 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7686 __ENQUEUE_WRITE_IMAGE_ERR);
7687
7688 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7689 *event = tmp;
7690
7691 return err;
7692 }
7693
7694 cl_int enqueueCopyImage(
7695 const Image& src,
7696 const Image& dst,
7697 const array<size_type, 3>& src_origin,
7698 const array<size_type, 3>& dst_origin,
7699 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7700 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7701 Event* event = NULL) const
7702 {
7703 cl_event tmp;
7704 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7705 ::clEnqueueCopyImage(
7706 object_,
7707 src(),
7708 dst(),
7709 src_origin.data(),
7710 dst_origin.data(),
7711 region.data(),
7712 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7713 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7714 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7715 __ENQUEUE_COPY_IMAGE_ERR);
7716
7717 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7718 *event = tmp;
7719
7720 return err;
7721 }
7722
7723#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
7724 /**
7725 * Enqueue a command to fill an image object with a specified color.
7726 * \param fillColor is the color to use to fill the image.
7727 * This is a four component RGBA floating-point color value if
7728 * the image channel data type is not an unnormalized signed or
7729 * unsigned data type.
7730 */
7731 cl_int enqueueFillImage(
7732 const Image& image,
7733 cl_float4 fillColor,
7734 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
7735 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7736 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7737 Event* event = NULL) const
7738 {
7739 cl_event tmp;
7740 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7741 ::clEnqueueFillImage(
7742 object_,
7743 image(),
7744 static_cast<void*>(&fillColor),
7745 origin.data(),
7746 region.data(),
7747 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7748 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7749 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7750 __ENQUEUE_FILL_IMAGE_ERR);
7751
7752 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7753 *event = tmp;
7754
7755 return err;
7756 }
7757
7758 /**
7759 * Enqueue a command to fill an image object with a specified color.
7760 * \param fillColor is the color to use to fill the image.

7762 * the image channel data type is an unnormalized signed integer
7763 * type.
7764 */
7765 cl_int enqueueFillImage(
7766 const Image& image,
7767 cl_int4 fillColor,
7768 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
7769 const array<size_type, 3>& region,

7778 static_cast<void*>(&fillColor),

7780 region.data(),
7781 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7782 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7783 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7784 __ENQUEUE_FILL_IMAGE_ERR);
7785
7786 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7787 *event = tmp;
7788
7789 return err;
7790 }

7797 * type.
7798 */

7800 const Image& image,
7801 cl_uint4 fillColor,

7803 const array<size_type, 3>& region,

7809 ::clEnqueueFillImage(
7810 object_,
7811 image(),
7812 static_cast<void*>(&fillColor),
7813 origin.data(),
7814 region.data(),
7815 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7816 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7817 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7818 __ENQUEUE_FILL_IMAGE_ERR);
7819
7820 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7821 *event = tmp;
7822
7823 return err;
7824 }

7830 const array<size_type, 3>& src_origin,
7831 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7832 size_type dst_offset,
7833 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7834 Event* event = NULL) const
7835 {

7837 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7838 ::clEnqueueCopyImageToBuffer(
7839 object_,
7840 src(),
7841 dst(),
7842 src_origin.data(),
7843 region.data(),
7844 dst_offset,
7845 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7846 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7847 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7848 __ENQUEUE_COPY_IMAGE_TO_BUFFER_ERR);
7849
7850 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7851 *event = tmp;
7852
7853 return err;
7854 }
7855
7856 cl_int enqueueCopyBufferToImage(
7857 const Buffer& src,
7858 const Image& dst,
7859 size_type src_offset,
7860 const array<size_type, 3>& dst_origin,
7861 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7862 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7863 Event* event = NULL) const
7864 {
7865 cl_event tmp;
7866 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
7867 ::clEnqueueCopyBufferToImage(
7868 object_,
7869 src(),
7870 dst(),
7871 src_offset,
7872 dst_origin.data(),
7873 region.data(),
7874 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7875 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7876 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7877 __ENQUEUE_COPY_BUFFER_TO_IMAGE_ERR);
7878
7879 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7880 *event = tmp;
7881
7882 return err;
7883 }
7884
7885 void* enqueueMapBuffer(
7886 const Buffer& buffer,
7887 cl_bool blocking,
7888 cl_map_flags flags,
7889 size_type offset,
7890 size_type size,
7891 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7892 Event* event = NULL,
7893 cl_int* err = NULL) const
7894 {
7895 cl_event tmp;
7896 cl_int error;
7897 void * result = ::clEnqueueMapBuffer(
7898 object_, buffer(), blocking, flags, offset, size,
7899 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7900 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7901 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL,
7902 &error);
7903
7904 detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
7905 if (err != NULL) {
7906 *err = error;
7907 }
7908 if (event != NULL && error == CL_SUCCESS)
7909 *event = tmp;
7910
7911 return result;
7912 }
7913
7914 void* enqueueMapImage(
7915 const Image& buffer,
7916 cl_bool blocking,
7917 cl_map_flags flags,
7918 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
7919 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
7920 size_type * row_pitch,
7921 size_type * slice_pitch,
7922 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7923 Event* event = NULL,
7924 cl_int* err = NULL) const
7925 {
7926 cl_event tmp;
7927 cl_int error;
7928 void * result = ::clEnqueueMapImage(
7929 object_, buffer(), blocking, flags,
7930 origin.data(),
7931 region.data(),
7932 row_pitch, slice_pitch,
7933 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
7934 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
7935 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL,
7936 &error);
7937
7938 detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_IMAGE_ERR);
7939 if (err != NULL) {
7940 *err = error;
7941 }
7942 if (event != NULL && error == CL_SUCCESS)
7943 *event = tmp;
7944 return result;
7945 }
7946
7947#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
7948 /**
7949 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host to update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
7950 * This variant takes a raw SVM pointer.
7951 */
7952 template<typename T>
7953 cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
7954 T* ptr,
7955 cl_bool blocking,
7956 cl_map_flags flags,
7957 size_type size,
7958 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7959 Event* event = NULL) const
7960 {
7961 cl_event tmp;
7962 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(::clEnqueueSVMMap(
7963 object_, blocking, flags, static_cast<void*>(ptr), size,
7964 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
7965 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
7966 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7967 __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
7968
7969 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7970 *event = tmp;
7971
7972 return err;
7973 }
7974
7975
7976 /**
7977 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host to update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
7978 * This variant takes a cl::pointer instance.
7979 */
7980 template<typename T, class D>
7981 cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
7982 cl::pointer<T, D> &ptr,
7983 cl_bool blocking,
7984 cl_map_flags flags,
7985 size_type size,
7986 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
7987 Event* event = NULL) const
7988 {
7989 cl_event tmp;
7990 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(::clEnqueueSVMMap(
7991 object_, blocking, flags, static_cast<void*>(ptr.get()), size,
7992 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
7993 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
7994 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
7995 __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
7996
7997 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
7998 *event = tmp;
7999
8000 return err;
8001 }
8002
8003 /**
8004 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host to update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
8005 * This variant takes a cl::vector instance.
8006 */
8007 template<typename T, class Alloc>
8008 cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
8009 cl::vector<T, Alloc> &container,
8010 cl_bool blocking,
8011 cl_map_flags flags,
8012 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8013 Event* event = NULL) const
8014 {
8015 cl_event tmp;
8016 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(::clEnqueueSVMMap(
8017 object_, blocking, flags, static_cast<void*>(container.data()), container.size(),
8018 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
8019 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
8020 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8021 __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
8022
8023 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8024 *event = tmp;
8025
8026 return err;
8027 }
8028#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
8029
8030 cl_int enqueueUnmapMemObject(
8031 const Memory& memory,
8032 void* mapped_ptr,
8033 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8034 Event* event = NULL) const
8035 {
8036 cl_event tmp;
8037 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8038 ::clEnqueueUnmapMemObject(
8039 object_, memory(), mapped_ptr,
8040 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8041 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8042 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8043 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
8044
8045 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8046 *event = tmp;
8047
8048 return err;
8049 }

8052#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
8053 /**
8054 * Enqueues a command that will release a coarse-grained SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
8055 * This variant takes a raw SVM pointer.
8056 */
8057 template<typename T>
8058 cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
8059 T* ptr,
8060 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8061 Event* event = NULL) const
8062 {
8063 cl_event tmp;
8064 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8065 ::clEnqueueSVMUnmap(
8066 object_, static_cast<void*>(ptr),
8067 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
8068 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
8069 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8070 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
8071
8072 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8073 *event = tmp;
8074
8075 return err;
8076 }
8077
8078 /**
8079 * Enqueues a command that will release a coarse-grained SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
8080 * This variant takes a cl::pointer instance.
8081 */
8082 template<typename T, class D>
8083 cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
8084 cl::pointer<T, D> &ptr,
8085 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8086 Event* event = NULL) const
8087 {
8088 cl_event tmp;
8089 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8090 ::clEnqueueSVMUnmap(
8091 object_, static_cast<void*>(ptr.get()),
8092 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
8093 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
8094 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8095 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
8096
8097 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8098 *event = tmp;
8099
8100 return err;
8101 }
8102
8103 /**
8104 * Enqueues a command that will release a coarse-grained SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
8105 * This variant takes a cl::vector instance.
8106 */
8107 template<typename T, class Alloc>
8108 cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
8109 cl::vector<T, Alloc> &container,
8110 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8111 Event* event = NULL) const
8112 {
8113 cl_event tmp;
8114 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8115 ::clEnqueueSVMUnmap(
8116 object_, static_cast<void*>(container.data()),
8117 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
8118 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
8119 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8120 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
8121
8122 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8123 *event = tmp;
8124
8125 return err;
8126 }
8127#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
8128
8129#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
8130 /**
8131 * Enqueues a marker command which waits for either a list of events to complete,
8132 * or all previously enqueued commands to complete.
8133 *
8134 * Enqueues a marker command which waits for either a list of events to complete,
8135 * or if the list is empty it waits for all commands previously enqueued in command_queue
8136 * to complete before it completes. This command returns an event which can be waited on,
8137 * i.e. this event can be waited on to insure that all events either in the event_wait_list
8138 * or all previously enqueued commands, queued before this command to command_queue,
8139 * have completed.
8140 */
8141 cl_int enqueueMarkerWithWaitList(
8142 const vector<Event> *events = 0,
8143 Event *event = 0) const
8144 {
8145 cl_event tmp;
8146 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8147 ::clEnqueueMarkerWithWaitList(
8148 object_,
8149 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8150 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8151 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8152 __ENQUEUE_MARKER_WAIT_LIST_ERR);
8153
8154 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8155 *event = tmp;
8156
8157 return err;
8158 }
8159
8160 /**
8161 * A synchronization point that enqueues a barrier operation.
8162 *
8163 * Enqueues a barrier command which waits for either a list of events to complete,
8164 * or if the list is empty it waits for all commands previously enqueued in command_queue
8165 * to complete before it completes. This command blocks command execution, that is, any
8166 * following commands enqueued after it do not execute until it completes. This command
8167 * returns an event which can be waited on, i.e. this event can be waited on to insure that
8168 * all events either in the event_wait_list or all previously enqueued commands, queued
8169 * before this command to command_queue, have completed.
8170 */
8171 cl_int enqueueBarrierWithWaitList(
8172 const vector<Event> *events = 0,
8173 Event *event = 0) const
8174 {
8175 cl_event tmp;
8176 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8177 ::clEnqueueBarrierWithWaitList(
8178 object_,
8179 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8180 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8181 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8182 __ENQUEUE_BARRIER_WAIT_LIST_ERR);
8183
8184 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8185 *event = tmp;
8186
8187 return err;
8188 }
8189
8190 /**
8191 * Enqueues a command to indicate with which device a set of memory objects
8192 * should be associated.
8193 */
8194 cl_int enqueueMigrateMemObjects(
8195 const vector<Memory> &memObjects,
8196 cl_mem_migration_flags flags,
8197 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8198 Event* event = NULL
8199 ) const
8200 {
8201 cl_event tmp;
8202
8203 vector<cl_mem> localMemObjects(memObjects.size());
8204
8205 for( int i = 0; i < (int)memObjects.size(); ++i ) {
8206 localMemObjects[i] = memObjects[i]();
8207 }
8208
8209 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8210 ::clEnqueueMigrateMemObjects(
8211 object_,
8212 (cl_uint)memObjects.size(),
8213 localMemObjects.data(),
8214 flags,
8215 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8216 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8217 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8218 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
8219
8220 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8221 *event = tmp;
8222
8223 return err;
8224 }
8225#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
8226
8227
8228#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
8229 /**
8230 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate ranges within a set of
8231 * SVM allocations with a device.
8232 * @param sizes - The length from each pointer to migrate.
8233 */
8234 template<typename T>
8235 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8236 const cl::vector<T*> &svmRawPointers,
8237 const cl::vector<size_type> &sizes,
8238 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8239 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8240 Event* event = NULL) const
8241 {
8242 cl_event tmp;
8243 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(::clEnqueueSVMMigrateMem(
8244 object_,
8245 svmRawPointers.size(), static_cast<void**>(svmRawPointers.data()),
8246 sizes.data(), // array of sizes not passed
8247 flags,
8248 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
8249 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
8250 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8251 __ENQUEUE_MIGRATE_SVM_ERR);
8252
8253 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8254 *event = tmp;
8255
8256 return err;
8257 }
8258
8259 /**
8260 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate a set of SVM allocations with
8261 * a device.
8262 */
8263 template<typename T>
8264 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8265 const cl::vector<T*> &svmRawPointers,
8266 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8267 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8268 Event* event = NULL) const
8269 {
8270 return enqueueMigrateSVM(svmRawPointers, cl::vector<size_type>(svmRawPointers.size()), flags, events, event);
8271 }
8272
8273
8274 /**
8275 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate ranges within a set of
8276 * SVM allocations with a device.
8277 * @param sizes - The length from each pointer to migrate.
8278 */
8279 template<typename T, class D>
8280 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8281 const cl::vector<cl::pointer<T, D>> &svmPointers,
8282 const cl::vector<size_type> &sizes,
8283 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8284 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8285 Event* event = NULL) const
8286 {
8287 cl_event tmp;
8288 cl::vector<void*> svmRawPointers;
8289 svmRawPointers.reserve(svmPointers.size());
8290 for (auto p : svmPointers) {
8291 svmRawPointers.push_back(static_cast<void*>(p.get()));
8292 }
8293
8294 return enqueueMigrateSVM(svmRawPointers, sizes, flags, events, event);
8295 }
8296
8297
8298 /**
8299 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate a set of SVM allocations with
8300 * a device.
8301 */
8302 template<typename T, class D>
8303 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8304 const cl::vector<cl::pointer<T, D>> &svmPointers,
8305 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8306 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8307 Event* event = NULL) const
8308 {
8309 return enqueueMigrateSVM(svmPointers, cl::vector<size_type>(svmPointers.size()), flags, events, event);
8310 }
8311
8312 /**
8313 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate ranges within a set of
8314 * SVM allocations with a device.
8315 * @param sizes - The length from the beginning of each container to migrate.
8316 */
8317 template<typename T, class Alloc>
8318 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8319 const cl::vector<cl::vector<T, Alloc>> &svmContainers,
8320 const cl::vector<size_type> &sizes,
8321 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8322 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8323 Event* event = NULL) const
8324 {
8325 cl_event tmp;
8326 cl::vector<void*> svmRawPointers;
8327 svmRawPointers.reserve(svmContainers.size());
8328 for (auto p : svmContainers) {
8329 svmRawPointers.push_back(static_cast<void*>(p.data()));
8330 }
8331
8332 return enqueueMigrateSVM(svmRawPointers, sizes, flags, events, event);
8333 }
8334
8335 /**
8336 * Enqueues a command that will allow the host associate a set of SVM allocations with
8337 * a device.
8338 */
8339 template<typename T, class Alloc>
8340 cl_int enqueueMigrateSVM(
8341 const cl::vector<cl::vector<T, Alloc>> &svmContainers,
8342 cl_mem_migration_flags flags = 0,
8343 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8344 Event* event = NULL) const
8345 {
8346 return enqueueMigrateSVM(svmContainers, cl::vector<size_type>(svmContainers.size()), flags, events, event);
8347 }
8348
8349#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
8350
8351 cl_int enqueueNDRangeKernel(
8352 const Kernel& kernel,
8353 const NDRange& offset,
8354 const NDRange& global,
8355 const NDRange& local = NullRange,
8356 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8357 Event* event = NULL) const
8358 {
8359 cl_event tmp;
8360 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8361 ::clEnqueueNDRangeKernel(
8362 object_, kernel(), (cl_uint) global.dimensions(),
8363 offset.dimensions() != 0 ? (const size_type*) offset : NULL,
8364 (const size_type*) global,
8365 local.dimensions() != 0 ? (const size_type*) local : NULL,
8366 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8367 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8368 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8369 __ENQUEUE_NDRANGE_KERNEL_ERR);
8370
8371 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8372 *event = tmp;
8373
8374 return err;
8375 }
8376
8377#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
8378 CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED cl_int enqueueTask(
8379 const Kernel& kernel,
8380 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8381 Event* event = NULL) const CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
8382 {
8383 cl_event tmp;
8384 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8385 ::clEnqueueTask(
8386 object_, kernel(),
8387 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8388 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8389 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8390 __ENQUEUE_TASK_ERR);
8391
8392 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8393 *event = tmp;
8394
8395 return err;
8396 }
8397#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
8398
8399 cl_int enqueueNativeKernel(
8400 void (CL_CALLBACK *userFptr)(void *),
8401 std::pair<void*, size_type> args,
8402 const vector<Memory>* mem_objects = NULL,
8403 const vector<const void*>* mem_locs = NULL,
8404 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8405 Event* event = NULL) const
8406 {
8407 size_type elements = 0;
8408 if (mem_objects != NULL) {
8409 elements = mem_objects->size();
8410 }
8411 vector<cl_mem> mems(elements);
8412 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elements; i++) {
8413 mems[i] = ((*mem_objects)[i])();
8414 }
8415
8416 cl_event tmp;
8417 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8418 ::clEnqueueNativeKernel(
8419 object_, userFptr, args.first, args.second,
8420 (mem_objects != NULL) ? (cl_uint) mem_objects->size() : 0,
8421 mems.data(),
8422 (mem_locs != NULL && mem_locs->size() > 0) ? (const void **) &mem_locs->front() : NULL,
8423 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8424 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8425 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8426 __ENQUEUE_NATIVE_KERNEL);
8427
8428 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8429 *event = tmp;
8430
8431 return err;
8432 }
8433
8434/**
8435 * Deprecated APIs for 1.2
8436 */
8437#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
8438 CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8439 cl_int enqueueMarker(Event* event = NULL) const CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8440 {
8441 cl_event tmp;
8442 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8443 ::clEnqueueMarker(
8444 object_,
8445 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8446 __ENQUEUE_MARKER_ERR);
8447
8448 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8449 *event = tmp;
8450
8451 return err;
8452 }
8453
8454 CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8455 cl_int enqueueWaitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events) const CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8456 {
8457 return detail::errHandler(
8458 ::clEnqueueWaitForEvents(
8459 object_,
8460 (cl_uint) events.size(),
8461 events.size() > 0 ? (const cl_event*) &events.front() : NULL),
8462 __ENQUEUE_WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
8463 }
8464#endif // defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
8465
8466 cl_int enqueueAcquireGLObjects(
8467 const vector<Memory>* mem_objects = NULL,
8468 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8469 Event* event = NULL) const
8470 {
8471 cl_event tmp;
8472 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8473 ::clEnqueueAcquireGLObjects(
8474 object_,
8475 (mem_objects != NULL) ? (cl_uint) mem_objects->size() : 0,
8476 (mem_objects != NULL && mem_objects->size() > 0) ? (const cl_mem *) &mem_objects->front(): NULL,
8477 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8478 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8479 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8480 __ENQUEUE_ACQUIRE_GL_ERR);
8481
8482 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8483 *event = tmp;
8484
8485 return err;
8486 }
8487
8488 cl_int enqueueReleaseGLObjects(
8489 const vector<Memory>* mem_objects = NULL,
8490 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8491 Event* event = NULL) const
8492 {
8493 cl_event tmp;
8494 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8495 ::clEnqueueReleaseGLObjects(
8496 object_,
8497 (mem_objects != NULL) ? (cl_uint) mem_objects->size() : 0,
8498 (mem_objects != NULL && mem_objects->size() > 0) ? (const cl_mem *) &mem_objects->front(): NULL,
8499 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8500 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8501 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8502 __ENQUEUE_RELEASE_GL_ERR);
8503
8504 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8505 *event = tmp;
8506
8507 return err;
8508 }
8509
8510#if defined (CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
8511typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR)(
8512 cl_command_queue command_queue, cl_uint num_objects,
8513 const cl_mem* mem_objects, cl_uint num_events_in_wait_list,
8514 const cl_event* event_wait_list, cl_event* event);
8515typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR)(
8516 cl_command_queue command_queue, cl_uint num_objects,
8517 const cl_mem* mem_objects, cl_uint num_events_in_wait_list,
8518 const cl_event* event_wait_list, cl_event* event);
8519
8520 cl_int enqueueAcquireD3D10Objects(
8521 const vector<Memory>* mem_objects = NULL,
8522 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8523 Event* event = NULL) const
8524 {
8525 static PFN_clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR pfn_clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR = NULL;
8526#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
8527 cl_context context = getInfo<CL_QUEUE_CONTEXT>();
8528 cl::Device device(getInfo<CL_QUEUE_DEVICE>());
8529 cl_platform_id platform = device.getInfo<CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM>();
8530 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR);
8531#endif
8532#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
8533 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR);
8534#endif
8535
8536 cl_event tmp;
8537 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8538 pfn_clEnqueueAcquireD3D10ObjectsKHR(
8539 object_,
8540 (mem_objects != NULL) ? (cl_uint) mem_objects->size() : 0,
8541 (mem_objects != NULL && mem_objects->size() > 0) ? (const cl_mem *) &mem_objects->front(): NULL,
8542 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8543 (events != NULL) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8544 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8545 __ENQUEUE_ACQUIRE_GL_ERR);
8546
8547 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8548 *event = tmp;
8549
8550 return err;
8551 }
8552
8553 cl_int enqueueReleaseD3D10Objects(
8554 const vector<Memory>* mem_objects = NULL,
8555 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
8556 Event* event = NULL) const
8557 {
8558 static PFN_clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR pfn_clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR = NULL;
8559#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
8560 cl_context context = getInfo<CL_QUEUE_CONTEXT>();
8561 cl::Device device(getInfo<CL_QUEUE_DEVICE>());
8562 cl_platform_id platform = device.getInfo<CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM>();
8563 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR);
8564#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
8565#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
8566 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR);
8567#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
8568
8569 cl_event tmp;
8570 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
8571 pfn_clEnqueueReleaseD3D10ObjectsKHR(
8572 object_,
8573 (mem_objects != NULL) ? (cl_uint) mem_objects->size() : 0,
8574 (mem_objects != NULL && mem_objects->size() > 0) ? (const cl_mem *) &mem_objects->front(): NULL,
8575 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
8576 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
8577 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
8578 __ENQUEUE_RELEASE_GL_ERR);
8579
8580 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
8581 *event = tmp;
8582
8583 return err;
8584 }
8585#endif
8586
8587/**
8588 * Deprecated APIs for 1.2
8589 */
8590#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
8591 CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8592 cl_int enqueueBarrier() const CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
8593 {
8594 return detail::errHandler(
8595 ::clEnqueueBarrier(object_),
8596 __ENQUEUE_BARRIER_ERR);
8597 }
8598#endif // CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
8599
8600 cl_int flush() const
8601 {
8602 return detail::errHandler(::clFlush(object_), __FLUSH_ERR);
8603 }
8604
8605 cl_int finish() const
8606 {
8607 return detail::errHandler(::clFinish(object_), __FINISH_ERR);
8608 }
8609}; // CommandQueue
8610
8611CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag CommandQueue::default_initialized_;
8612CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ CommandQueue CommandQueue::default_;
8613CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int CommandQueue::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
8614
8615
8616#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
8617enum class DeviceQueueProperties : cl_command_queue_properties
8618{
8619 None = 0,
8620 Profiling = CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE,
8621};
8622
8623inline DeviceQueueProperties operator|(DeviceQueueProperties lhs, DeviceQueueProperties rhs)
8624{
8625 return static_cast<DeviceQueueProperties>(static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(lhs) | static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(rhs));
8626}
8627
8628/*! \class DeviceCommandQueue
8629 * \brief DeviceCommandQueue interface for device cl_command_queues.
8630 */
8631class DeviceCommandQueue : public detail::Wrapper<cl_command_queue>
8632{
8633public:
8634
8635 /*!
8636 * Trivial empty constructor to create a null queue.
8637 */
8638 DeviceCommandQueue() { }
8639
8640 /*!
8641 * Default construct device command queue on default context and device
8642 */
8643 DeviceCommandQueue(DeviceQueueProperties properties, cl_int* err = NULL)
8644 {
8645 cl_int error;
8646 cl::Context context = cl::Context::getDefault();
8647 cl::Device device = cl::Device::getDefault();
8648
8649 cl_command_queue_properties mergedProperties =
8650 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties);
8651
8652 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8653 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, mergedProperties, 0 };
8654 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8655 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
8656
8657 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8658 if (err != NULL) {
8659 *err = error;
8660 }
8661 }
8662
8663 /*!
8664 * Create a device command queue for a specified device in the passed context.
8665 */
8666 DeviceCommandQueue(
8667 const Context& context,
8668 const Device& device,
8669 DeviceQueueProperties properties = DeviceQueueProperties::None,
8670 cl_int* err = NULL)
8671 {
8672 cl_int error;
8673
8674 cl_command_queue_properties mergedProperties =
8675 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties);
8676 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8677 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, mergedProperties, 0 };
8678 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8679 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
8680
8681 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8682 if (err != NULL) {
8683 *err = error;
8684 }
8685 }
8686
8687 /*!
8688 * Create a device command queue for a specified device in the passed context.
8689 */
8690 DeviceCommandQueue(
8691 const Context& context,
8692 const Device& device,
8693 cl_uint queueSize,
8694 DeviceQueueProperties properties = DeviceQueueProperties::None,
8695 cl_int* err = NULL)
8696 {
8697 cl_int error;
8698
8699 cl_command_queue_properties mergedProperties =
8700 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | static_cast<cl_command_queue_properties>(properties);
8701 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8702 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, mergedProperties,
8703 CL_QUEUE_SIZE, queueSize,
8704 0 };
8705 object_ = ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8706 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error);
8707
8708 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8709 if (err != NULL) {
8710 *err = error;
8711 }
8712 }
8713
8714 /*! \brief Constructor from cl_command_queue - takes ownership.
8715 *
8716 * \param retainObject will cause the constructor to retain its cl object.
8717 * Defaults to false to maintain compatibility with
8718 * earlier versions.
8719 */
8720 explicit DeviceCommandQueue(const cl_command_queue& commandQueue, bool retainObject = false) :
8721 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(commandQueue, retainObject) { }
8722
8723 DeviceCommandQueue& operator = (const cl_command_queue& rhs)
8724 {
8725 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
8726 return *this;
8727 }
8728
8729 /*! \brief Copy constructor to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
8730 * Required for MSVC.
8731 */
8732 DeviceCommandQueue(const DeviceCommandQueue& queue) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(queue) {}
8733
8734 /*! \brief Copy assignment to forward copy to the superclass correctly.
8735 * Required for MSVC.
8736 */
8737 DeviceCommandQueue& operator = (const DeviceCommandQueue &queue)
8738 {
8739 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(queue);
8740 return *this;
8741 }
8742
8743 /*! \brief Move constructor to forward move to the superclass correctly.
8744 * Required for MSVC.
8745 */
8746 DeviceCommandQueue(DeviceCommandQueue&& queue) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(queue)) {}
8747
8748 /*! \brief Move assignment to forward move to the superclass correctly.
8749 * Required for MSVC.
8750 */
8751 DeviceCommandQueue& operator = (DeviceCommandQueue &&queue)
8752 {
8753 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(queue));
8754 return *this;
8755 }
8756
8757 template <typename T>
8758 cl_int getInfo(cl_command_queue_info name, T* param) const
8759 {
8760 return detail::errHandler(
8761 detail::getInfo(
8762 &::clGetCommandQueueInfo, object_, name, param),
8763 __GET_COMMAND_QUEUE_INFO_ERR);
8764 }
8765
8766 template <cl_int name> typename
8767 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_command_queue_info, name>::param_type
8768 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
8769 {
8770 typename detail::param_traits<
8771 detail::cl_command_queue_info, name>::param_type param;
8772 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
8773 if (err != NULL) {
8774 *err = result;
8775 }
8776 return param;
8777 }
8778
8779 /*!
8780 * Create a new default device command queue for the default device,
8781 * in the default context and of the default size.
8782 * If there is already a default queue for the specified device this
8783 * function will return the pre-existing queue.
8784 */
8785 static DeviceCommandQueue makeDefault(
8786 cl_int *err = nullptr)
8787 {
8788 cl_int error;
8789 cl::Context context = cl::Context::getDefault();
8790 cl::Device device = cl::Device::getDefault();
8791
8792 cl_command_queue_properties properties =
8793 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE_DEFAULT;
8794 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8795 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties,
8796 0 };
8797 DeviceCommandQueue deviceQueue(
8798 ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8799 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error));
8800
8801 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8802 if (err != NULL) {
8803 *err = error;
8804 }
8805
8806 return deviceQueue;
8807 }
8808
8809 /*!
8810 * Create a new default device command queue for the specified device
8811 * and of the default size.
8812 * If there is already a default queue for the specified device this
8813 * function will return the pre-existing queue.
8814 */
8815 static DeviceCommandQueue makeDefault(
8816 const Context &context, const Device &device, cl_int *err = nullptr)
8817 {
8818 cl_int error;
8819
8820 cl_command_queue_properties properties =
8821 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE_DEFAULT;
8822 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8823 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties,
8824 0 };
8825 DeviceCommandQueue deviceQueue(
8826 ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8827 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error));
8828
8829 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8830 if (err != NULL) {
8831 *err = error;
8832 }
8833
8834 return deviceQueue;
8835 }
8836
8837 /*!
8838 * Create a new default device command queue for the specified device
8839 * and of the requested size in bytes.
8840 * If there is already a default queue for the specified device this
8841 * function will return the pre-existing queue.
8842 */
8843 static DeviceCommandQueue makeDefault(
8844 const Context &context, const Device &device, cl_uint queueSize, cl_int *err = nullptr)
8845 {
8846 cl_int error;
8847
8848 cl_command_queue_properties properties =
8849 CL_QUEUE_OUT_OF_ORDER_EXEC_MODE_ENABLE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE | CL_QUEUE_ON_DEVICE_DEFAULT;
8850 cl_queue_properties queue_properties[] = {
8851 CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES, properties,
8852 CL_QUEUE_SIZE, queueSize,
8853 0 };
8854 DeviceCommandQueue deviceQueue(
8855 ::clCreateCommandQueueWithProperties(
8856 context(), device(), queue_properties, &error));
8857
8858 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_WITH_PROPERTIES_ERR);
8859 if (err != NULL) {
8860 *err = error;
8861 }
8862
8863 return deviceQueue;
8864 }
8865
8866
8867
8868#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
8869 /*!
8870 * Modify the default device command queue to be used for subsequent kernels.
8871 * This can update the default command queue for a device repeatedly to account
8872 * for kernels that rely on the default.
8873 * @return updated default device command queue.
8874 */
8875 static DeviceCommandQueue updateDefault(const Context &context, const Device &device, const DeviceCommandQueue &default_queue, cl_int *err = nullptr)
8876 {
8877 cl_int error;
8878 error = clSetDefaultDeviceCommandQueue(context.get(), device.get(), default_queue.get());
8879
8880 detail::errHandler(error, __SET_DEFAULT_DEVICE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR);
8881 if (err != NULL) {
8882 *err = error;
8883 }
8884 return default_queue;
8885 }
8886
8887 /*!
8888 * Return the current default command queue for the specified command queue
8889 */
8890 static DeviceCommandQueue getDefault(const CommandQueue &queue, cl_int * err = NULL)
8891 {
8892 return queue.getInfo<CL_QUEUE_DEVICE_DEFAULT>(err);
8893 }
8894
8895#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
8896}; // DeviceCommandQueue
8897
8898namespace detail
8899{
8900 // Specialization for device command queue
8901 template <>
8902 struct KernelArgumentHandler<cl::DeviceCommandQueue, void>
8903 {
8904 static size_type size(const cl::DeviceCommandQueue&) { return sizeof(cl_command_queue); }
8905 static const cl_command_queue* ptr(const cl::DeviceCommandQueue& value) { return &(value()); }
8906 };
8907} // namespace detail
8908
8909#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
8910
8911
8912template< typename IteratorType >
8913Buffer::Buffer(
8914 const Context &context,
8915 IteratorType startIterator,
8916 IteratorType endIterator,
8917 bool readOnly,
8918 bool useHostPtr,
8919 cl_int* err)
8920{
8921 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
8922 cl_int error;
8923
8924 cl_mem_flags flags = 0;
8925 if( readOnly ) {
8926 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_ONLY;
8927 }
8928 else {
8929 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_WRITE;
8930 }
8931 if( useHostPtr ) {
8932 flags |= CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR;
8933 }
8934
8935 size_type size = sizeof(DataType)*(endIterator - startIterator);
8936
8937 if( useHostPtr ) {
8938 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, static_cast<DataType*>(&*startIterator), &error);
8939 } else {
8940 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, 0, &error);
8941 }
8942
8943 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
8944 if (err != NULL) {
8945 *err = error;
8946 }
8947
8948 if( !useHostPtr ) {
8949 CommandQueue queue(context, 0, &error);
8950 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
8951 if (err != NULL) {
8952 *err = error;
8953 }
8954
8955 error = cl::copy(queue, startIterator, endIterator, *this);
8956 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
8957 if (err != NULL) {
8958 *err = error;
8959 }
8960 }
8961}
8962
8963template< typename IteratorType >
8964Buffer::Buffer(
8965 const CommandQueue &queue,
8966 IteratorType startIterator,
8967 IteratorType endIterator,
8968 bool readOnly,
8969 bool useHostPtr,
8970 cl_int* err)
8971{
8972 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
8973 cl_int error;
8974
8975 cl_mem_flags flags = 0;
8976 if (readOnly) {
8977 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_ONLY;
8978 }
8979 else {
8980 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_WRITE;
8981 }
8982 if (useHostPtr) {
8983 flags |= CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR;
8984 }
8985
8986 size_type size = sizeof(DataType)*(endIterator - startIterator);
8987
8988 Context context = queue.getInfo<CL_QUEUE_CONTEXT>();
8989
8990 if (useHostPtr) {
8991 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, static_cast<DataType*>(&*startIterator), &error);
8992 }
8993 else {
8994 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, 0, &error);
8995 }
8996
8997 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
8998 if (err != NULL) {
8999 *err = error;
9000 }
9001
9002 if (!useHostPtr) {
9003 error = cl::copy(queue, startIterator, endIterator, *this);
9004 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
9005 if (err != NULL) {
9006 *err = error;
9007 }
9008 }
9009}
9010
9011inline cl_int enqueueReadBuffer(
9012 const Buffer& buffer,
9013 cl_bool blocking,
9014 size_type offset,
9015 size_type size,
9016 void* ptr,
9017 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9018 Event* event = NULL)
9019{
9020 cl_int error;
9021 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9022
9023 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9024 return error;
9025 }
9026
9027 return queue.enqueueReadBuffer(buffer, blocking, offset, size, ptr, events, event);
9028}
9029
9030inline cl_int enqueueWriteBuffer(
9031 const Buffer& buffer,
9032 cl_bool blocking,
9033 size_type offset,
9034 size_type size,
9035 const void* ptr,
9036 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9037 Event* event = NULL)
9038{
9039 cl_int error;
9040 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9041
9042 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9043 return error;
9044 }
9045
9046 return queue.enqueueWriteBuffer(buffer, blocking, offset, size, ptr, events, event);
9047}
9048
9049inline void* enqueueMapBuffer(
9050 const Buffer& buffer,
9051 cl_bool blocking,
9052 cl_map_flags flags,
9053 size_type offset,
9054 size_type size,
9055 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9056 Event* event = NULL,
9057 cl_int* err = NULL)
9058{
9059 cl_int error;
9060 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9061 detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9062 if (err != NULL) {
9063 *err = error;
9064 }
9065
9066 void * result = ::clEnqueueMapBuffer(
9067 queue(), buffer(), blocking, flags, offset, size,
9068 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint) events->size() : 0,
9069 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*) &events->front() : NULL,
9070 (cl_event*) event,
9071 &error);
9072
9073 detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9074 if (err != NULL) {
9075 *err = error;
9076 }
9077 return result;
9078}
9079
9080
9081#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9082/**
9083 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will allow the host to
9084 * update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
9085 * This variant takes a raw SVM pointer.
9086 */
9087template<typename T>
9088inline cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
9089 T* ptr,
9090 cl_bool blocking,
9091 cl_map_flags flags,
9092 size_type size,
9093 const vector<Event>* events,
9094 Event* event)
9095{
9096 cl_int error;
9097 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9098 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9099 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9100 }
9101
9102 return queue.enqueueMapSVM(
9103 ptr, blocking, flags, size, events, event);
9104}
9105
9106/**
9107 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will allow the host to
9108 * update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
9109 * This variant takes a cl::pointer instance.
9110 */
9111template<typename T, class D>
9112inline cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
9113 cl::pointer<T, D> ptr,
9114 cl_bool blocking,
9115 cl_map_flags flags,
9116 size_type size,
9117 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9118 Event* event = NULL)
9119{
9120 cl_int error;
9121 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9122 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9123 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9124 }
9125
9126 return queue.enqueueMapSVM(
9127 ptr, blocking, flags, size, events, event);
9128}
9129
9130/**
9131 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will allow the host to
9132 * update a region of a coarse-grained SVM buffer.
9133 * This variant takes a cl::vector instance.
9134 */
9135template<typename T, class Alloc>
9136inline cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
9137 cl::vector<T, Alloc> container,
9138 cl_bool blocking,
9139 cl_map_flags flags,
9140 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9141 Event* event = NULL)
9142{
9143 cl_int error;
9144 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9145 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9146 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9147 }
9148
9149 return queue.enqueueMapSVM(
9150 container, blocking, flags, events, event);
9151}
9152
9153#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9154
9155inline cl_int enqueueUnmapMemObject(
9156 const Memory& memory,
9157 void* mapped_ptr,
9158 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9159 Event* event = NULL)
9160{
9161 cl_int error;
9162 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9163 detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_MAP_BUFFER_ERR);
9164 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9165 return error;
9166 }
9167
9168 cl_event tmp;
9169 cl_int err = detail::errHandler(
9170 ::clEnqueueUnmapMemObject(
9171 queue(), memory(), mapped_ptr,
9172 (events != NULL) ? (cl_uint)events->size() : 0,
9173 (events != NULL && events->size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events->front() : NULL,
9174 (event != NULL) ? &tmp : NULL),
9175 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9176
9177 if (event != NULL && err == CL_SUCCESS)
9178 *event = tmp;
9179
9180 return err;
9181}
9182
9183#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9184/**
9185 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will release a coarse-grained
9186 * SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
9187 * This variant takes a raw SVM pointer.
9188 */
9189template<typename T>
9190inline cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
9191 T* ptr,
9192 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9193 Event* event = NULL)
9194{
9195 cl_int error;
9196 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9197 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9198 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9199 }
9200
9201 return detail::errHandler(queue.enqueueUnmapSVM(ptr, events, event),
9202 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9203
9204}
9205
9206/**
9207 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will release a coarse-grained
9208 * SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
9209 * This variant takes a cl::pointer instance.
9210 */
9211template<typename T, class D>
9212inline cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
9213 cl::pointer<T, D> &ptr,
9214 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9215 Event* event = NULL)
9216{
9217 cl_int error;
9218 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9219 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9220 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9221 }
9222
9223 return detail::errHandler(queue.enqueueUnmapSVM(ptr, events, event),
9224 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9225}
9226
9227/**
9228 * Enqueues to the default queue a command that will release a coarse-grained
9229 * SVM buffer back to the OpenCL runtime.
9230 * This variant takes a cl::vector instance.
9231 */
9232template<typename T, class Alloc>
9233inline cl_int enqueueUnmapSVM(
9234 cl::vector<T, Alloc> &container,
9235 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9236 Event* event = NULL)
9237{
9238 cl_int error;
9239 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9240 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9241 return detail::errHandler(error, __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9242 }
9243
9244 return detail::errHandler(queue.enqueueUnmapSVM(container, events, event),
9245 __ENQUEUE_UNMAP_MEM_OBJECT_ERR);
9246}
9247
9248#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9249
9250inline cl_int enqueueCopyBuffer(
9251 const Buffer& src,
9252 const Buffer& dst,
9253 size_type src_offset,
9254 size_type dst_offset,
9255 size_type size,
9256 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9257 Event* event = NULL)
9258{
9259 cl_int error;
9260 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9261
9262 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9263 return error;
9264 }
9265
9266 return queue.enqueueCopyBuffer(src, dst, src_offset, dst_offset, size, events, event);
9267}
9268
9269/**
9270 * Blocking copy operation between iterators and a buffer.
9271 * Host to Device.
9272 * Uses default command queue.
9273 */
9274template< typename IteratorType >
9275inline cl_int copy( IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer )
9276{
9277 cl_int error;
9278 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9279 if (error != CL_SUCCESS)
9280 return error;
9281
9282 return cl::copy(queue, startIterator, endIterator, buffer);
9283}
9284
9285/**
9286 * Blocking copy operation between iterators and a buffer.
9287 * Device to Host.
9288 * Uses default command queue.
9289 */
9290template< typename IteratorType >
9291inline cl_int copy( const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator )
9292{
9293 cl_int error;
9294 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9295 if (error != CL_SUCCESS)
9296 return error;
9297
9298 return cl::copy(queue, buffer, startIterator, endIterator);
9299}
9300
9301/**
9302 * Blocking copy operation between iterators and a buffer.
9303 * Host to Device.
9304 * Uses specified queue.
9305 */
9306template< typename IteratorType >
9307inline cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer )
9308{
9309 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
9310 cl_int error;
9311
9312 size_type length = endIterator-startIterator;
9313 size_type byteLength = length*sizeof(DataType);
9314
9315 DataType *pointer =
9316 static_cast<DataType*>(queue.enqueueMapBuffer(buffer, CL_TRUE, CL_MAP_WRITE, 0, byteLength, 0, 0, &error));
9317 // if exceptions enabled, enqueueMapBuffer will throw
9318 if( error != CL_SUCCESS ) {
9319 return error;
9320 }
9321#if defined(_MSC_VER)
9322 std::copy(
9323 startIterator,
9324 endIterator,
9325 stdext::checked_array_iterator<DataType*>(
9326 pointer, length));
9327#else
9328 std::copy(startIterator, endIterator, pointer);
9329#endif
9330 Event endEvent;
9331 error = queue.enqueueUnmapMemObject(buffer, pointer, 0, &endEvent);
9332 // if exceptions enabled, enqueueUnmapMemObject will throw
9333 if( error != CL_SUCCESS ) {
9334 return error;
9335 }
9336 endEvent.wait();
9337 return CL_SUCCESS;
9338}
9339
9340/**
9341 * Blocking copy operation between iterators and a buffer.
9342 * Device to Host.
9343 * Uses specified queue.
9344 */
9345template< typename IteratorType >
9346inline cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator )
9347{
9348 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
9349 cl_int error;
9350
9351 size_type length = endIterator-startIterator;
9352 size_type byteLength = length*sizeof(DataType);
9353
9354 DataType *pointer =
9355 static_cast<DataType*>(queue.enqueueMapBuffer(buffer, CL_TRUE, CL_MAP_READ, 0, byteLength, 0, 0, &error));
9356 // if exceptions enabled, enqueueMapBuffer will throw
9357 if( error != CL_SUCCESS ) {
9358 return error;
9359 }
9360 std::copy(pointer, pointer + length, startIterator);
9361 Event endEvent;
9362 error = queue.enqueueUnmapMemObject(buffer, pointer, 0, &endEvent);
9363 // if exceptions enabled, enqueueUnmapMemObject will throw
9364 if( error != CL_SUCCESS ) {
9365 return error;
9366 }
9367 endEvent.wait();
9368 return CL_SUCCESS;
9369}
9370
9371
9372#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9373/**
9374 * Blocking SVM map operation - performs a blocking map underneath.
9375 */
9376template<typename T, class Alloc>
9377inline cl_int mapSVM(cl::vector<T, Alloc> &container)
9378{
9379 return enqueueMapSVM(container, CL_TRUE, CL_MAP_READ | CL_MAP_WRITE);
9380}
9381
9382/**
9383* Blocking SVM map operation - performs a blocking map underneath.
9384*/
9385template<typename T, class Alloc>
9386inline cl_int unmapSVM(cl::vector<T, Alloc> &container)
9387{
9388 return enqueueUnmapSVM(container);
9389}
9390
9391#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
9392
9393#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
9394inline cl_int enqueueReadBufferRect(
9395 const Buffer& buffer,
9396 cl_bool blocking,
9397 const array<size_type, 3>& buffer_offset,
9398 const array<size_type, 3>& host_offset,
9399 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9400 size_type buffer_row_pitch,
9401 size_type buffer_slice_pitch,
9402 size_type host_row_pitch,
9403 size_type host_slice_pitch,
9404 void *ptr,
9405 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9406 Event* event = NULL)
9407{
9408 cl_int error;
9409 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9410
9411 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9412 return error;
9413 }
9414
9415 return queue.enqueueReadBufferRect(
9416 buffer,
9417 blocking,
9418 buffer_offset,
9419 host_offset,
9420 region,
9421 buffer_row_pitch,
9422 buffer_slice_pitch,
9423 host_row_pitch,
9424 host_slice_pitch,
9425 ptr,
9426 events,
9427 event);
9428}
9429
9430inline cl_int enqueueWriteBufferRect(
9431 const Buffer& buffer,
9432 cl_bool blocking,
9433 const array<size_type, 3>& buffer_offset,
9434 const array<size_type, 3>& host_offset,
9435 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9436 size_type buffer_row_pitch,
9437 size_type buffer_slice_pitch,
9438 size_type host_row_pitch,
9439 size_type host_slice_pitch,
9440 const void *ptr,
9441 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9442 Event* event = NULL)
9443{
9444 cl_int error;
9445 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9446
9447 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9448 return error;
9449 }
9450
9451 return queue.enqueueWriteBufferRect(
9452 buffer,
9453 blocking,
9454 buffer_offset,
9455 host_offset,
9456 region,
9457 buffer_row_pitch,
9458 buffer_slice_pitch,
9459 host_row_pitch,
9460 host_slice_pitch,
9461 ptr,
9462 events,
9463 event);
9464}
9465
9466inline cl_int enqueueCopyBufferRect(
9467 const Buffer& src,
9468 const Buffer& dst,
9469 const array<size_type, 3>& src_origin,
9470 const array<size_type, 3>& dst_origin,
9471 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9472 size_type src_row_pitch,
9473 size_type src_slice_pitch,
9474 size_type dst_row_pitch,
9475 size_type dst_slice_pitch,
9476 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9477 Event* event = NULL)
9478{
9479 cl_int error;
9480 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9481
9482 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9483 return error;
9484 }
9485
9486 return queue.enqueueCopyBufferRect(
9487 src,
9488 dst,
9489 src_origin,
9490 dst_origin,
9491 region,
9492 src_row_pitch,
9493 src_slice_pitch,
9494 dst_row_pitch,
9495 dst_slice_pitch,
9496 events,
9497 event);
9498}
9499#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
9500
9501inline cl_int enqueueReadImage(
9502 const Image& image,
9503 cl_bool blocking,
9504 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
9505 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9506 size_type row_pitch,
9507 size_type slice_pitch,
9508 void* ptr,
9509 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9510 Event* event = NULL)
9511{
9512 cl_int error;
9513 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9514
9515 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9516 return error;
9517 }
9518
9519 return queue.enqueueReadImage(
9520 image,
9521 blocking,
9522 origin,
9523 region,
9524 row_pitch,
9525 slice_pitch,
9526 ptr,
9527 events,
9528 event);
9529}
9530
9531inline cl_int enqueueWriteImage(
9532 const Image& image,
9533 cl_bool blocking,
9534 const array<size_type, 3>& origin,
9535 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9536 size_type row_pitch,
9537 size_type slice_pitch,
9538 const void* ptr,
9539 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9540 Event* event = NULL)
9541{
9542 cl_int error;
9543 CommandQueue queue = CommandQueue::getDefault(&error);
9544
9545 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
9546 return error;
9547 }
9548
9549 return queue.enqueueWriteImage(
9550 image,
9551 blocking,
9552 origin,
9553 region,
9554 row_pitch,
9555 slice_pitch,
9556 ptr,
9557 events,
9558 event);
9559}
9560
9561inline cl_int enqueueCopyImage(
9562 const Image& src,
9563 const Image& dst,
9564 const array<size_type, 3>& src_origin,
9565 const array<size_type, 3>& dst_origin,
9566 const array<size_type, 3>& region,
9567 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
9568 Event* event = NULL)
9569{

9572

9574 return error;
